review_body: Every staff member was extremely helpful and kind during our stay. One of the front desk agents helped us make a reservation in Japanese at an amazing sushi restaurant. We think it was the best meal of our lives so we were very grateful for their gracious help.The location of the hotel can't be beat with Shinjuku station just a short walk away. There's a Lawson convenience store right downstairs if you need anything, and the Golden Gai with plenty of bars is right behind the hotel. The neighborhood is lively and vibrant but the inside it's quiet and relaxing. Our room was a decent size and VERY clean. I really loved the dimmable light next to the bed.Thank you for a perfect stay! We can't wait to come back!
user_name:
peacelovegelato2020
New York City, New York

review_body: 4 years ago we stayed at the Citadines Central Sjinjuku and because of the central location we stayed here for some nights again. It’s on walking distance from Sjinjuku Station which makes it a perfect place. Lots of restaurants around, so easy choice. Rooms are not huge, but clean and comfortable, Very friendly staff.

Recently stayed at hotel with partner, great location very close walking to train and restaurants, clean room, small but after staying throughout Japan most rooms are small, suited 2 of us fine. Staff friendly and accommodated to English speaking. Highly recommend.

Great location near JR Shinjuku Station. Few minutes walk from JR Shinjuku station, lots of shopping and restaurants, good staff, small bed, clean room, quiet, full facility. Free WIFI but the connection might appear slow

My first time to Japan and as usual stay Ascott properties when I travelling. Guest service very friendly and efficiency, they will assist and guide you where to go with patients when I’m not sure about the location how to go. Location was good, walking distance about 10-15 minutes to Shinjuku East Entrance Station. Room was fine.

The location of the hotel was really handy. We arrived quite late from Narita and needed to pop out for some food and that wasn't a problem.We needed a room with space to repack suitcases and there was plenty of floorspace in the room we booked. For the price, I was really pleased with the spaciousness of the room. It's worth checking that the type of room you book provides you with what you need, as I think some are bigger than others.The shower and bathroom facilities were clean and absolutely fine. It was a traditional Japanese set up where you shower outside of the bath and then use the bath for soaking.The staff were friendly and very helpful.Overall a really good stay and I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for somewhere good quality to stay in this part of Shinjuku.

The highlight of this hotel is definitely how central it is - walking distance to just about everything in the area. And they put on a pretty good breakfast (actually the best we had in Japan).Otherwise, it's tired and shabby, rooms are small and really old and run-down.We've stayed in Citadal hotels (in Germany) before which was why we booked here - and it was overall a rather unpleasant stay - we almost considered moving hotels but we had paid 100% upfront and didn't play to spend a lot of time indoors, so just rolled with it.Our arrival - late at night - was by taxi - dropped off across the road and into a rather strange "gangster" environment - we later learned there is Nigerian group who operate there (and from the golden Gia) and try to lure in drunk tourists - offering free drinks and other things and then later try to swindle them. Needless to say, it wasn't a great first impression and I think the hotel is aware of this, but powerless to control what happens outside their establishment, not really their fault, but it impacted on our experience.Once we got into our room, it was small and dingy - shabby and tired. We could have overlooked what was going on outside, but the room seemed to support the first impression and we felt sullied. We also didn't enjoy the Golden Gai which was 1 minute walk away - probably great for drinkers/smokers but the tiny little pubs felt claustrophobic, dirty and not really "our thing".Positives: the hotel was super central - we could walk everywhere and enjoyed the Samurai Museum the next day (5 minutes away) and the Robot Restaurant (also 5 mins but we didn't go in) and other attractions.The hotel also allowed us to experience the "seedy" side of Tokyo which is a part of any big city - so that "enhanced" our experience. We were glad to stay in Ginza when we returned from Kyoto.There was a 7/11 store downstairs - open 24 hours - where we could buy snacks and drinks.Tokyo is AMAZING though so if this is all you can afford, then it is what it is, but I;'m pretty sure there are other places at the same price that would be better. Citadel should look into this hotel bringing down their otherwise good reputation.
user_name:
Candice C
Cape Town Central, South Africa

review_body: Citadine in central Shinjuku- standard services and amenities with the chain and popular among western travelers - Reception is on the 3rd floor of the building with a Lawson and a 7-11 closed to the elevator- Location wise , can’t beat it, it’s closed to everything, shops, eats and transit - went in at around noon and was checkin to room earliest as a member of the chain- Room is small with the basic set of tv, a sofa, a small desk, a safety deposit box, a small fridge and a full bath tub and shower- linen smells fresh and beddings are good - Temperature can be adjusted to liking- dropped luggages in the front desk for airport luggage delivery service, the young guy staff was pleasant and helpful- in all, a very good stay - would definitely recommend

Great hotel for a convenient location to the main train station. We took the Narita Express from the airport and then walked about 10 minutes to the hotel. Great location-5 minutes walk to local subway. Breakfast buffet was average but very good for the price. Rooms are small, clean and well equipped. All you need for a great stay in Tokyo. Front desk staff so friendly.

Citadines is right near the infamous Golden Gai which was great (not at all loud). It also is connected to a Lawson convenience store and Udon restaurant which worked out great. Staff spoke good english and check in and check out was smooth. Hotel room is small but was to be expected. Room was clean and well looks after during our stay. Heating and cooling was perfect. Internet was touch and go depending on the time of day/night. Would recommended and stay again.

We stayed 3 nights and was a great location. Close to metro and the staff were more than happy to point us in the right direction when we were unsure of things. Clean rooms and enjoyed the buffet breakfast. The bed was comfortable so it was a great way to start off our holiday. Can recommend

Good location. Friendly and helpful staff. Rooms are CLEAN. Breakfast buffet was worth the money. Read in some reviews that there were touts near and they might be annoying, but no one came to bothered my group. Unlike some hotels that choose dim lights or dark colours for atmosphere, we particularly liked the brightness of the room.

My wife and I used to stay at Citadines at the end of December during our vacation in Tokyo. Our choice was based on location and cost of stay. Seems it was the best choice! Also a very helpful personal should be mentioned, Overall - a very good value for money.

I traveled to Japan in December 2019 as part of a Japan/Thailand solo trip. The hotel is centrally located in Shinjuku and served as a great base for exploring the city (in fact, it’s right in front of the famous Golden Gai). I found the room straightforward/clean - your basic hotel set up. The staff was friendly and helpful, and held my luggage as I explored the city after check-out on my last day. They even mailed my post cards for me. I would pick this spot again.

Exceptional service, location and rooms for a family stay. Would highly recommend this hotel when travelling to Tokyo. We stayed for 7 nights and would definitely come again next time we are in Japan.

This experience was OK. Front desk staff were extremely friendly and helpful. We liked the hotel location, which was right in the mess of Kabukicho. Steps from Golden Gai and near the metro. Tons of bars and restaurants on the doorstep. The rooms are pretty small but at least we had somewhere to put our bags without tripping over them. The rooms were clean but did feel dated ie. chair was falling apart, bed sagged in the middle.

This hotel 's room is approx 17 meter square which is bigger than the regular hotel room in Tokyo. There is two seats sofa in the room and still have enough space for me to open my luggage case on the floor. I would stay this hotel again whenever I come back to Tokyo.

The hotel location is in excellence location. Close to Shinjuku train station and surrounding by restaurants. The hotel staffs were very polite and helpful. The room is clean. Only heater in the pathway was too warm for the rest is perfect.

This hotel was great, rooms weren’t too small. The breakfast was good too. It’s not super close to train stations but not a far walk either. It’s real close the the golden Gai. Everything is easy to walk to around town as well.

The aparthotel was right smack between Golden Gai and Kabukicho so there was no lack of drinking and dining options (including cheap fast food restaurants and convenience stores). Shopping wise, Don Quijote, drugstores (for cosmetics) and Muji was within a 5 minute walk.The rooms were decent though small (as was expected), service was good but our room unfortunately smelt of cigarettes even though we asked for a no-smoking room.

We specifically asked for two rooms next to each other. When we arrived, they just said no and we weren't even on the same floor. No apologies except that the hotel is full. It is a three star and it's in the red light district. There were fights and shouting you could hear from the streets. There are better places to stay.

Great location blocks from Shinjuku train station with access to all of Tokyo. Lots and lots of food, beverage and shopping options in area. Room and bathroom are spotless, very clean and had no issue with climate control. Two huge negatives, do not, do not hope for or plan on WiFi working. On night of arrival after going out, WiFi worked at 2am and then not again until 3 days later for about an hour the morning of our departure. Even then, it is extremely slow. Lastly, street hustlers pushing massages/sex are relentless in area, no boundaries. At one point I had to physically defend myself as one grabbed me by arm, probably not the area for families to stay.

We stayed at this hotel during our 11 day stay in Tokyo and found the staff very helpful and wonderfully polite. The rooms are very clean and you are given bottled water each day. Reception staff are able to assist you with finding your way around Tokyo and have printed details for most of the popular tourist spots. The hotel is about 5-10 min walk from Shinjuku station and close to subway stations making it easy to make your own way around Tokyo. There is a Lawsons convenience store right next door to the lift leading to the hotel reception, so you can pick up supplies from there, we opted to have breakfast at the hotel as they also included cereal, toast and pastries plus a small buffet of other breakfast items (make sure you book that when checking in to get the discount). Shinjuku itself also has wonderful restaurants, a samurai museum, robot restaurant and more making it a great area to stay.

My partner and I stayed for four nights and it was fantastic. Hotel is in a really good location, staff are friendly and welcoming.Bed was super comfy (I requested a softer pillow with no problems at all), room was pretty spacious (enough for our two big suitcases to remain open and accessible), and extremely clean. We opted not to have breakfast at the hotel and made use of the Lawson’s right downstairs and 7/11 up the road. We cannot fault this hotel and would definitely recommend to family and friends for a comfortable and convenient stay in Shinjuku.

Great hotel in a great location. The staff is very friendly and willing to help at all times. We only had the chance to have breakfast at the restaurant in the hotel but it was delicious and reasonably priced. Would stay here again!
user_name:
jessicasanchez718
New York City, New York

review_body: Citadines property in central Shinjuku is clean, good sized and very well located. Staff are professional and everyone knew their jobs. Even asked what type of food we liked to eat and gave recommendations.

Citadines Central met expectations. It's location was amazing, the Lawson downstairs was a great bonus and the staff really made this stay warm. Besides the amount of guys out front hassling you for the adult clubs, I felt the Citadines experience was above expectation. Room was comfortable for 2 with space bigger than the average Tokyo hotel room. Bathroom was very modern and had space to move around. Would happily stay here again.

Easy access to all shopping areas. the hotel room is clean and tidy and very comfortable. staff are efficient and polite. complaint to them the next day that our room was too noisy ie on 5th floor as it was facing busy road etc. when we returned from. our sight seeings they moved us to a higher floor. will definitely return again. the breakfast is good and healthy.

The main plus here is the rooms are OK size for Tokyo: big enough for a couple of people to maneuver around. And at this price, and in this location, this may be enough to qualify for 5 stars alone. And it’s clean. And housekeeping is prompt and good. And they have a large number of reasonably priced coin washers with self-dispensing detergent. (Only tip: if you want the machines to self-sanitize, you’ve only got a couple of seconds to push the button after you put the money in, so read the instructions carefully!) Only caveat as always (and as others have mentioned) it’s in the red light district, although it’s also just a few seconds away from the Golden Gai area, which in the past couple of years has gotten extremely popular with tourists. On the day I was leaving I received a notice that they were updating their WiFi, which is good. After staying here many times over the years, my only consistent complaint (even back to when it was a Best Western) was the WiFi was consistently very bad (including during this stay—which to their credit they did fix eventually by putting a separate router in our room). So it’s obviously a problem they’re aware of and if they’re finally fixing it: great! Staff was always friendly and helpful to us and they were very nice about storing the baggage we didn’t need during a side trip.

We stayed here for 4 nights at the start of our honeymoon trip in Japan. We booked this hotel due to its central location, however not realising it was in the red light district!! You will hear sirens every night and encounter drunk people and the touts outside the clubs... not ideal start to the honeymoon. Also, we were in the room next to the laundry room and did not have a good night’s sleep at all! So avoid room 714 (or anything on the 7th floor if you can!). The hotel had no WiFi for the entirety of our stay which was completely unexpected given what we had paid for the room. Overall, I would only recommend this place to stay if you’re desperate to be amongst all the action... otherwise I’d choose another hotel!

Over all, ok. Good location. Big room more than other hotel.You can leave the baggage at the hotel. Check in+Check out, it’s quickly Below the hotel has Lawson and more local restaurantBut the basin has problem

I stayed at Citadines central in Shinjuku with my partner for 6 nights at the end of October this year.The hotel is situated in Kabukicho which is the red light-district of Shinjuku. For our 1st visit to Japan we found this was a little bit of sensory overload for us and although Shinjuku was spectacular and we were amongst the action, the seedy nightlife and overall crowds of the area was difficult to navigate.. expect liveliness outside the hotel every night - noise (you can hear from your room), drunk people roaming the alleyways, long lines for every restaurant as well as street hawkers hustling you whilst trying to get back to the hotel (they stand directly outside the hotel at night).. The hotel is situated about a 10 minute walk from Shinjuku station - although this is convenient we found at times buses were easier to access (only a 3 or 4 minute walk) and quite often found ourselves needing to take a quick taxi to get back from the station to the hotel to save our legs after a long day of exploring.Although staying near Shinjuku station was handy- it was a very crowded station and a lot of the areas in Tokyo took a long time and multiple trains to reach.The room itself was perfectly fine for two people - a little cramped but comfortable and clean, a reasonable size. The bed was little uncomfortable and small (they only have a double size- no queen or king) but we found were able to sleep pretty well...Our deal included breakfast which was nothing special but was able to provide a decent meal for us to start the day.The hotel staff - although not overly pleasant were able to help with all our needs and generally spoke good English.Overall, a nice stay and introduction to the hustle and bustle of Tokyo, I wouldn’t stay here again but that had more to do with the location rather than the quality of the hotel..

The Double room size actually not big enough when you need to open the 26 inch travel case in the room. The room is quite cleaning, the toilet and shower is quite big than other Hotel in this price range. The Hotel Facility is pretty good, near subway exit just few minutes and close to shinjuku but far away the noise. Since there is another Citadines in Shinjuku Gyo-en, front desk will give you the small map and pinned the Hotel location. However, one of the Hotel frontdesk that make me wont come this Hotel again. Most of the front desk can use english to communicate. When i go to hotel to check in, I realized that made the mistake to reserve the double room for 2 of my family member to stay. I told the front desk that i have request twin bed in the order and i have not received any reject from Hotel. The front desk is very impolitely and impatient to answer me that Hotel have reviewed my request but not accept. First, i accept i have made the mistake in the booking. However, i think Agoda have introduced the better way for communication between Hotel and client. When Hotel reviewed the request and decide the request is unable to fulfill, Hotel can send the email to client, or informally just send the message via Agoda? I think it is very common in servicing industry. This matter is my fault but I actually mad on the attitude of the front desk, i cant remember his face and how he impolite to provide his "service" to me even it is from Jan 2019. Just not saying the Hotel servicing, i dont think he is up to standard for doing the service job. Actually i dont know why he need to use this attitude to the client or just to me? Then, i just ask him how much to upgrade the double room to twin bed, the upgrade price is more than the original price of Double room booking. After that, when i have something to ask frontdesk, i will wait for other front desk, they are quite nice.

Great location to access Shinjuku train station or walk between the districts.The staff were extremely welcoming, friendly and accommodating with excellent English which made it very easy to communicate. We arrived before check in opened and our departure was scheduled very late at night however we were able to leave our luggage in a room behind the reception desk which was very convenient. The room was a good size which was clean, although would benefit from modernising, and bottled water was provided daily. Overall I would recommend Citadines Central Shinjuku.

I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone with kids. Technically this hotel won due to the location, however the location itself more like "semi red district". I also put my son birthday cake with clear request of putting in the freezer, yet my son birthday cake MELTED when I pick it up from them. The services also not up to good standard (but everyone probably have bad day).

The hotel is centrally located and in the middle of the action. While the hotel is technically in the red light district we never felt uncomfortable. The staff were pleasant and helpful. People have complained about the WiFi but if you bring it to their attention the hotel will provide an external router for your room. The bedroom with a double is very small. We paid $30 more and got a room with two twins which was perfect. The breakfast buffet could be improved but it does provide hot/cold foods. If you want a hotel near restaurants, the subway, and fun activities this is your hotel.

Hotel’s location could be good (it depends). The hotel is located in a very busy place. It is near the Shinjuku station, near a lot of restaurants and shopping place but also near a lot of clubs. So you could imagine what it looks like at night, expect when you’re walking to your hotel, you’ll be passing by some people who’ll invite you into the club. The hotel it self is average, staffs will help you with what you need, though there won’t be smile on their face. Cleanliness is average, you’ll see some stains in the bathroom tiles, dust on the side table. The room is a little tired I must say. Over all average. Will I be back? I don’t usually go back to a hotel unless I really love it, because I always like to try different hotels, so no I might not come back (but it’s just me).

Very poor service at the reception and concierge - the service staff are curt, has no patience, gave wrong instructions to restaurants, refused to give the receipts for the rooms even though we paid upfront, poor wifi in rooms, poor toiletries given in rooms

Thank God we got this hotel. Comfort and sound.Much much much better than the one we got while in Tokyo.Nice location.Nice staffs.Very near with convenience store.Near the train station.Gonna recommend it to anyone who looking hotel in Tokyo!

I recently spent a weekend in Tokyo at the Citadines. It was a great experience, very close to shopping, restaurants, and public transport. There is a lovely treed path outside the hotel that was a welcome relief from the business of Shinjuku. I'll be back for sure.

We stayed here for several nights. It’s a very well located hotel near many sites, including robot restaurant and my personal favourite, golden guy which is directly behind the hotel.It’s a vibrant area but the hotel offers seclusion from the hustle and bustle.It’s about a 10 minute walk from the train station.The room was tidy and comfortable. It on the small side, with the bed pressed up against the wall on one side.The breakfast is a bit expensive but a good option as there aren’t that many breakfast places in the immediate area.The laundry room is a god send. 300¥ for a load (detergent included) the dryer 100¥ for 30 mins. Getting laundry done by the hotel is super expensive.I’d definitely stay here again.

Great location to trains, convenience store and local attractions. Close to many dining options and shrines. Front office and cleaning employees friendly and speak English. One bedroom provides more space with separate sitting area to the bedroom.

Excellent location in Shinjuku. Close to shops, restaurants and an easy 7 minute walk to Shinjuku station. Rooms are clean and have everything you need, though the wifi is very slow on the 12th floor. It also has laundry facilities which was great. Recommend tryinf the sake bar across the road.

This is a very good hotel in a good location, about 7 minutes walk from the JR Station and close to the subway. It is close to the Shinjuku shopping area and there is a Lawson, grocery store, downstairs at the entrance. We arrived a day early due to the typhoon disrupting travel plans and there was no problem getting a room for the extra night. The staff were very friendly and helpful and even upgraded us. The room is a good size with a bath and a shower. The breakfast is a buffet and caters for most tastes. The only problem we had was with the wifi. We were on the 13th floor and the wifi was intermittent in our room. To get good reception we had to go out in the hallway or near the left or down to the lobby but this didn't detract much from our stay.The wifi may be better on the lower floors. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

We stayed here for 5 nights during the Rugby World Cup. Check in was quick and the reception staff were very friendly and helpful. We ordered a taxi from the reception on one occasion without any issue and it arrived promptly.The room was a standard size hotel room for Japan. Bathroom was of a decent size and was regularly stocked with toiletries. The room was cleaned to a high standard every day. The hotel is in a good location in Shinjuku and is good value for money. It is at most a 10 minute walk to Shinjuku JR station. The walk is through a few busy streets and is enjoyable, however with suitcases it may be a little difficult for some people especially in the heat (we managed fine). There are other metro stations and an abundance of shops/restaurants located near the hotel. We had breakfast on 3 occasions. It is a buffet breakfast with a good variety on offer.

Citadines has some nice hotels, some are a little fancier than others, but the rates are pretty affordable, the rooms are clean and the staff are friendly. The staff speak english and mandarin in case your japanese isn't up to par.

Superbly positioned & price excellent. Very comfortable, clean & spacious room. 'reception very helpful & courtious, train station nearby, & very central, with Temples in walking distance. Would definitely stay again

We stayed here as our 1st stop on our tour of Japan during the early weeks of the Rugby World Cup.We took a transfer from the Airport to the hotel which was a really great idea as its a fair walk, especially with cases from any of the stations.The staff are friendly and had a good level of English. We were on the 8th floor in a double suite which was large with a good bed, separate sitting area, small kitchen area and a good size bathroom with bath.We slept well in the room which was quiet as we didn't have much of a view.This is an excellent location, it's walking distance to Shinjuku Station and there are restaurants and shops nearby.We would love to return to Japan and if Tokyo would definitely stay here again

Centrally located at Shinjuku (albeit the red-light district area, the environment is considered mild, no public sleaze), hotel is at the heart of action. Ground floor is a fairly big Lawson (convenience store) and hotel lobby is on 3rd floor. Takes less than 5 mins on foot to reach shopping area, 7 mins to reach JR station & 9 mins to metro. For those arriving / departing via Haneda airport, if you do not fancy pulling your luggage all the way to Shinjuku bus station, you can take Airport Limo bus to Keio Plaza Hotel before taking a cab to Citadines. Cab fare is less than 1,000 yen.Space is very important for me and was initially very worried about small room size (stayed in standard double). Do note that bed is smaller than regular queen and walking space is limited if you open two 32” suitcases. Limited channels on TV. But all these are made up for with cleverly designed space & cleanliness. Housekeeping is spotless. Room is very well maintained, no mould in toilet or smell from carpet. Aircon is adjustable in room.I’ll definitely recommend!

Great place to stay the breakfast buffet was great or there is a convenience store just below to grab something quick although you are surrounded by many restaurants not quite a 10 min walk from Shinjuku station and shops nearby room was very clean and had everything we needed housekeeping services were great there is also a coin laundromat in the building which is handy if you are staying a while

The hotel itself is a relatively short walk from Shinjuku station, which is a bonus if you're doing a lot of travelling. On arrival at the hotel around 3pm the location seemed really good, sitting centrally in a vibrant and busy area (two mins from Golden Gai). Hotel staff were really helpful, even helping book a restaurant in Shibuya, and the room was acceptable for a busy Tokyo location. Only a couple minor faults - no iron in the room and the shampoo, soap, etc. were of poor quality. One big plus was laundry room. Really simple to use and cheap too. Great when travelling for a long period.The major downside though was the location in the evening. It is next to Golden Gai so you can expect some noise, but the amount of touts trying to get you into massage parlours or 'gentleman's clubs' was ridiculous. As someone who travels a lot you do get used to this and a simple 'no thanks' does usually work, but it does get a bit annoying having to do they repeatedly. If you can put up with this I would recommend this hotel, otherwise probably best avoid.

Nice location, it was right at the heart of the shopping area and very near to train station.Nice room, the size of the room was not very big. But good enough for 2 person with 2 big luggages.Great staff, they were very professional and polite.

Great Location right in the heart of the action. Friendly and very helpful staff, everything done with a smile. No issues with room size for 2 big lads. Twin beds that were larger then regular single beds. Great powerful shower not over the bath.Great breakfast buffet included in deal.

This is a great little hotel however you are in the middle of the red light district, something I wasn't aware of. The staff are friendly and accommodating and there are coin-op washing machines and dryers which are handy.The bathrooms are a good size.The The

Overall a pleasant stay in Tokyo for 4 nights, wasn’t expecting the ritz - no real bells and whistles to this place, you can sleep and shower. Great location for the train station and backs on to the Golden Gei (fabulous little bars we frequented often).Toiletries good - didn’t even get mine out of my bag.Very poor WiFi, didn’t reach the rooms

Stayed here for 6 nights with family; 2 rooms on the 14th floor. Beds are good but close together and the bathroom is pretty small. What is odd is that the windows have a deck you cannot access with opaque-ish railing outside them that blocks the views unless you are standing by the window. The cleaners were amazing and thorough. Easy to use (5) laundry machines with driers on the 7th floor. What was odd is I paid for there entire stay when we checked in, but then when we checked out the attendant said the needed Y2000 more (about 20 USD) because they miscalculated then room tax at check-in. Not a big amount (or big deal) but I would've thought a hotel would just eat that and move on of they had made a small mistake on a 12-night stay bill. But staff were otherwise generally cheerful and tried to be helpful. Although I didn't stay there, you might also want to look at Hotel Gracery Shinjuku - the cost seems to be about the same but that location is even more central.

This hotel is about 10 mins walk to Shinjuku station. The first time you will need some type of GPS to guide you through the small narrow streets.My hotel room ( 1312) was slightly larger than typical hotel rooms in Japan. I do like that this hotel provides 2 water bottles for each night of stay, although the water is safe to drink from the tap. There’s a small fridge inside your room also a safe inside one of the drawers in the desk. Also this property has washing machines and dryers on the 7 floor. There is a convenient store directly below the hotel.The staff were very helpful and speak English. The amenities are very good and buffet breakfast every day is great, the restaurant hostess is lovely, Konichiwa every morning! Location is perfect just around the corner from the Robot Restaurant and the Golden Gai, It’s a fun and lively location and would stay here again when in Tokyo.

Room fairly basic but absolutely fine, especially if you’ll be out and about a lot. Great location, near Golden Gai and Shinjuku. Room fairly small but we managed to get two suitcases in it with a bit of clambering over them. Not expensive so can’t complain. Front desk staff were excellent.

The hotel is in a great location right in the heart of Kabukicho with a convenience store on the ground floor.Reception staff were great very helpful and attentive to anything that I asked or required.The room as expected was very small and I booked one of the larger ones but it was only for sleeping so no big deal.There was a laundry with 5 washing machines and 5 dryers which was also very convenient.There was a couple of downsides the WiFi in the room was very poor (I enquired about this at the front desk and was told it was being fixed but it didn’t improve throughout our stay) We also had breakfast twice which wasn’t great either.Overall though I really enjoyed my stay here and would recommend this hotel

The hotel is right in the middle of Kabukicho where all kinds of actions take place. An area filled with foreigners and also many touting for business.... very packed area.Check in is at Level 3 where you can take an elevator or escalator up. As there is only one elevator , it can be busy at time. From the check in area, you take another set of elevators to the room and well you are in Tokyo so don’t expect much from the room which is simple and small. Serving only the purpose of sleep, the room is not one place I will want to stay long in.One good thing about the hotel is that it comes with a good number of washing and drying machines , 5 each so that there is no long waiting time.Overall a good place to stay in but if you drive , there is no parking at the hotel but at associated parking space for 2500 yen overnight

The hotel is located in a very good position,near Shinjuku station in a very lively zone. The room is quite large with respect the Tokyo standard and this is a comfortable thing. Good services and nice breakfast.The price is reasonable.

We wanted a convenient hotel with space close to Shinjuku station. The Citadines more than delivered.It was very affordable, very clean, very reasonable space for Tokyo. Very good looking hotel with very good amenities, friendly staff.The room had a wet room and a bath, shampoo, body wash and conditioner, all toiletries you would expect to find in a Japanese hotel.We came in from a long flight very early in the morning and staff were kind enough to let us check in and use the room before official check in time (3pm), we would really like to thank them for the chance of having a little rest and a shower before going out exploring.The hotel is perfect for exploring the Kabukicho and is just behind the Golden Gai, however, it is quiet, we had no problem whatsoever with noise.

This hotel is in a great central location, with the metro station two minutes away, in a neighborhood with many services, particularly catering. The staff is courteous and helpful. The hotel is quiet, overlooking the temple

The most friendly and helpful staff. With the help of the staff we where able to travel anywhere in Toko. Accommodation was great and central right in the middle of all the action of a crazy and fun city. Will stay there anytime.

Stayed 5 nights on level 10 with room facing main street. Hardly can hear any noise except when there's siren from ambulance. The street seems to be alive around 2-3 am (but can't hear sound).Once you get the bearing right the hotel isn't too far from Shinjuku station but do your homework if you need access to elevator/escalator when at the station.Coin operated laundry located on level 7, cost 300 yen per wash and 100 yen for half hour drying (you would need about 2 hours to really dry the clothes). Very good room cleaning. We stayed at studio deluxe twin which is spacious for two people.

Being a long time client and hotel owner myself it’s always good to see quality is the same or better than before. In this case no five stars because rooms are small but that’s normal to find in Japan and the rooms could need a facelift but nothing extraordinary. Just keep on goin like this and you will find agua in in your hotels.

The hotel was comfortable and clean. The double bed in a small room was challenging but we didn't spend any time in our room apart from sleeping so we managed ok. The location of this hotel is central and only a 8 minute walk to Shinjuku station. The hotel is right next to Golden Gai, tiny alleyways filled small bars. There is a Lawson's on the ground floor so that was super handy for food coffee and snacks. The staff were friendly.

Amenities excellent, location pleasant, only difficulty not on hotel pickup list for tours.Needed expensive taxi(organised by staff) to connect with hop on hop off bus or tour starting locations. Breakfast and lunch only served in dining room but Japanese’s restaurant in building and convenience store on street level. Take away food and ATM also available there.

The staff here were phenomenal! They would go out of their way for you for even for the smallest thing. Lovely layout, the street the hotel was on had some not so family friendly buildings nearby, but that didn’t bother us. There was a Lawson convenience store right underneath the hotel which had everything you could need! The hotel was about a 5-7 minute walk from Shinjuku station, and not a complicated walk either. Loads of shops, bars, restaurants, a cinema, and even a shrine right next door. The rooms were small, which seems to be more of a Japanese thing I have found, but had everything we needed. Shampoo, conditioner, and shower gel all in the room topped up. Fresh slippers, water bottles, face cloths and toothbrush and toothpaste brought every day too, and the front desk even had extras (Razors, cotton buds, hair bobbles, comb) The bath room was lovely as well! Tea and coffee supplies too. There was a safe in the room, and a large TV, but only 2 English channels, which had the same 4 shows on all day. They even left me a little happy birthday note and gift on my birthday which was soo cute!Overall, fantastic and I will definitely stay again!

The hotel is great! Fantastic staff, rooms and location! We spent around a week here and would come back. Beware!!!!!!! (As far as I'm aware not at all related to the hotel) The "Sake" bar below the hotel is pro whaling. More whale on the menu than sake.

The double bed is too small and I'm Asian. I had to sleep on the couch. The pillows are too hard, like rocks. The Lawson below was fantastic, you can have breakfast there. Sleep on the couch if you have 2 people with a double bed.

I was staying for a few days in the Citadines Central Shinjuku Hotel, and was very pleased. The room was tiny, but that was to be expected, and it contained all we needed. The location is great, desk service polite and very helpful, room service great.

We loved our stay at The Citadines Central Shinjuku. Only a 10-15 minute walk to the busy Shinjuku Station from where we were able to connect to all the locations we wanted to see in Tokyo - station able to be accessed by the Subnade underground shopping mall for which you can see stairs and signs for as you get closer to the station. A nicer walk underground on very hot days.We were a family of 4 so we had 2 x double rooms. They were certainly the right size for us (and we had a lot of luggage!). We liked the chair & desk in the room and also the lounge chair by the window. Air con was welcome as the temperatures were over 34 degrees celsius during our stay. Great amenities including coin operated washers and dryers, a drinks vending machine - not required as 2 bottles of water were provided per room per day - a nice touch. Convenience store on level 1 and a 7 eleven a few doors down.Bathroom was perfect, hand wash, shampoo, conditioner and body wash provided.Staff were always friendly, helpful and welcoming.Staff were happy to store our luggage so we could enjoy Tokyo for a few more hours after check out and before our flight.Although the hotel is in the red light district we always felt safe and the lively area meant lots of choices for eating out with places open very late, which suited us. We never heard any noise at night and our room was on a lower level (4) and overlooked the Golden Gai bars.Special mention about the impeccable housekeeping! Our note said that Shah was our housekeeper and it was lovely to return after a hot and busy day out to find our room serviced and as clean and tidy as the day we checked in.We had breakfast once in the hotel restaurant but it wasn't to our taste and the hot items were cold, but we didn't stay there for the breakfasts so it certainly doesn't alter our view of the hotel, which was great!

Just less than 10 mins walk from Shinjuku station, shopping outlets at your doorstep and plenty of choices on food. There is a 24 hour family mart just next door. There are a few bars around the hotel.

We stayed here for three nights and were really pleased with our choice.We loved the location - right in the thick of it all.We paid a little extra for a bigger room, and were glad we did, it was an acceptable size so we didn't find it too small.Hotel is near a small supermarket time shop so good to stock up on drinks/snacks for room.Didn't find it too hard to locate either.Would happily stay here again.

We stayed at a Standard Double Room for 1 night. The room was compact but good enough for two people. It was clean. The bed was quite comfortable. The shower worked fine. Shower gel, shampoo and conditioner were readily available. Wifi connection was fine. We had a room on 4/F which was just one floor above the reception area and were worried that it would be noisy at night but it was quiet. We prepaid for our room. Check in and check out was quick and easy. The staff was friendly.The best thing about the hotel was the location. It was close to the metro station and easy to walk to Shinjuku JR station. It was also very close to Isetan. There were a lot of shops and restaurants in the area and a Lawson was just downstairs. We would consider staying here again the next time we are in Tokyo.

We booked the Citadines with no real expectation and we were a bit nervous about the room size (we had a double room). Overall, the room was small but efficient and didn't feel crammed. Next time, we would probably bring our own pillows, as their pillows are a bit harder and not as comfortable. The washroom was a great size and their shower water pressure was phenomenal! What was great about this hotel was it had a Lawson's (convenience store) right beside it so we could purchase water, snacks, etc. They also have an ATM machine in case you need to take out more cash. The hotel is about a 7 min walk to the Shinjuku station and is right beside the Golden Gai! The Golden Gai has hundreds of small bars and it was definitely the highlight of our trip. We would definitely come back to this hotel on our next trip to Tokyo!

I stayed at Citadines Central Shinjuku Tokyo with my daughter for her high school graduation trip to Japan for 4 nights. we found the hotel very well located and were ready to pay high price for the location. it ended to be "location only" stay.our room was so small we hardly could fit in with two luggage. the breakfast was very poor and very low quality (unusual for Japan).But the worst was the service of the front desk staff. since our check in (around noon) they were unfriendly - just stick to the rules saying "check in is at 3 pm", never showing any kind of empathy to the 20 hour flight we came from. during our stay we had a problem with understanding the shinkansen schedule and rules. i went to the reception staff to get their assistance with the problem. i hardly pooled one of the staff from inner room they were in...he was reluctant to do something and did not want even to understand the problem, not saying to solve it (and as we understood ourselves later on it was not a problem at all and he could have had assisted if he was willing to)

Our third visit to Tokyo, we had seen this hotel on previous visits and commented that it would be nice to stay there. The location was the most enticing at first but the hotel and rooms ended up being very clean and comfortable. We would not hesitate to stay here again.

This hotel is right in the middle of everything, including a bustling 'nightlife'. The standard rooms are very small. Don't go with a large suitcase, it won't fit in the room. The beds in the double are just that - small doubles.The rooms on the upper floors are much larger, but cost more.

We stayed in this hotel during our recent holiday in Japan. We chose Shinjuku based on our first visit 12 years ago. We went back to where we stayed and the little streets of shops and restaurants had been replaced by canyons of office blocks.But Shinjuku is still a lively centre of restaurants and bars, brasher than before, but still fun. Citadines is located on the respectable side of the street overlooking girly bars and a block back , a benign street devoted to picking up ladies, and a block further on the fun street featuring a roaring Godzilla. In short, this is a great location for the light-hearted.Our room was excellent with ample room for a king-size bed and a small couch. The TV offered a very limited range of English language programs, but that’s not why we were in Japan. At the back of the hotel, across a delightful pedestrian walk there was an area full of tiny bars, some with a cover charge and some without. These bars only opened in the evening and most were only big enough for about 6 patrons at a time. We went to one for a drink and sat at a bar with no room between the bar and the wall to push our stools back, and with a sign reading “All drinks 500 yen”.The breakfast provided in the airy dining room as part of the tariff was excellent and plentiful. The staff both in Reception and the Restaurant were helpful, friendly and efficient.It’s hard to fault this hotel as a mid-range ($300+) place to be based in Tokyo and its location, close enough to the mighty Shinjuku Station, makes access to anywhere in Tokyo a matter of ease.

Room is spacious, comfortable, quiet, tidy and clean. Many coin washing machine and no need to wait for long. Close to Shinjuku shopping area. Many restaurants near by. Next to Thermae-yu for relaxation.
user_name:
Clara Y
Mae Hong Son, Thailand

review_body: First stay at Citadines Central Shinjuku at my brother's recommendation. We booked premier twin so the room is spacious. The location is great and short walking distance to JR station. A lawson convenience store right beside the entrance of the hotel and a lot of restaurants around so not problem to find eating place. Staff are very nice even the room cleaning service staff who are non-japanese were willing to assist and highly efficient. I will certainly come back and recommend it to my friends.

Excellent hotel in prime location with great staff. I have traveled all over Asia and very happy I stayed in this hotel. Friendly and welcoming staff. Perfect location for everything Tokyo. Room was perfect. I highly recommend.

Stayed in this place for 7 nights whist visiting Tokyo. Staff were brilliant - always smiling and greeting us with warm and friendly words. The place was better than I imagined fr central Tokyo - not huge but a lot bigger than others. The rooms were fine, no impact from the busy streets outside. It is really centrally located - you are surrounded by this amazing city. Good value too, and great breakfasts. All in all a great place to base yourself for a Tokyo visit.

For our first time in Japan, we thought this hotel was value for money. The room was a decent size, clean and service from staff were good. The bed was comfortable, air-conditioning worked with good amenities. There were two convenience stores located nearby and about 10 minutes from Shinjuku Station. The only negative was the location, as we frequented places near Shinjuku Station more so if you don't mind the 10 walk, it's a good place to stay.

We had a 4 days stay in this hotel, and they were great. Good service, kindness, room and breakfast.But the suburb tho...that was not expected at all. Kabukichō is a great place to spend a night out, but non for passing thru while going back to your hotel with your wife in late night. Everything is great inside, but the location is a bit "strange" (at least for the travel purposes with my wife, of course). Nevertheless, the hotel is in a very strategic and central position in Tokyo!

We were pleasantly surprised by the the great position in Shinjuku.The hotel had a small supermarket downstairs. The room was pleasant and not too small as we found at the next 2 hotels that we stayed at on our travels in Japan.

We had a double room and the size is small as the standard of Tokyo but neat and clean. The location is great especially for first-time visitors and late-nighters, around 10mins walk to Shinjuku Station for Narita Express direct to/from the airport. The room has hair dryer, free bottled water, coffee and tea, slippers, shampoo, shower gel and a great hair conditioner (bonus!) which is rare for hotels. There is a convenient store right downstairs of the hotel, many restaurant and bar choices for the area of course. Staff speak acceptable level of English, helpful. Was a satisfactory stay.

Situated in the red light district, right next to the Golden Gai with lots of hustlers and drunk people. Hotel is tired and shabby. Not on standard with other Citadines Hotels that we stayed at. Breakfast ok. The area is central.
user_name:
Keeponmooving
Cape Town Central, South Africa

review_body: This place is the best, there is so much things to see outside the hotels and the room didn't get the noise from outside.Walking distance from the shinjuku railways stations and bus stations.Breakfast is nice but lack of variations.

If you are going to go to Tokyo for a short visit this is one of the best places to stay. Not very expensive, right in the heart of Shinjuku Area, very close to subways and pretty much everything else. Even though the rooms are a little small, its clean and has everything you need ! To top it all off, great, friendly staff.

The hotel is situated close to the Golden Gai area where there are a lot of bars, eating places and entertainment. The hotel staff was friendly and polite. The room was of adequate size but definitely needed to be refurbished.

The hotel is close to both JR Shinjuku Station and Shinjuku Sanchome stations which will bring you almost anywhere you need to go in the city. During the day, the area is quiet but it comes to life at night. However, you still feel safe and I did not hear any noise from my hotel room. The best part about the hotel room was the shower/bathtub which was quite big compared to the room. The rooms and washroom were very clean! The room is decent sized and perfect for resting at night. With so much to see in Tokyo, we didn't spend much time in the room anyways. The bed could have been a bit more comfortable but we were so tired by the end of the day it didn't matter so much. There is shower gel/shampoo/conditioner in the washroom and some basics like cotton buds/shower cap and comb available at the front desk. The staff are very friendly. We asked to check-in earlier and they allowed it but asked us to join the Ascott Star Rewards program which we did.

Stayed for 6 nights and found the room very small. Limited space for luggage and bed was against wall on one side. We had to use the couch to store one bag which meant we had nowhere but the bed to sit. We stayed in hotels all over Japan and this was the smallest room we had. Bathroom was a good size though and we'll appointed. Staff are helpful and we were facilitated with an early check in. This hotel is located in Kabuchiko though so very busy at night.It is a 5 minute walk to the station making sight seeing very easy.If staying for a few days it's fine but I would have preferred a larger room for our stay.

My husband and I stayed here for 9 nights. The location is amazing if you are there for the nightlife especially. The room service crew were amazing and always so quiet so long lies in the morning were possible when needed!! They could lose the chaise lounge from the room to make the bed accessible from both sides but in general the room is decent enough sized if you can make the most of the space available. Would recommend this hotel.

Booked studio double and the room and bathroom was spacious and modern. We were allowed to leave our luggages before our stay (3days in advance) and the hotel staff were all very professional and friendly. Email correspondences with hotel were very prompt and responsive, thumbs up! Breakfast from 7am to 10am (weekends 10.30am) and choices were just nice. Great location with many eateries and convenience stores. Golden-gai is just behind the hotel and walkable distance to many transport hubs. Staff was nice to allow check-out time extended to 12pm if you are Ascott member.

Hotel was well situated to experience the colour and vibrancy of Shinjuku. Staff were friendly and helpful. Room was on the small side but as expected for Japan. Breakfast buffet was good value with great variety.

I spent a week here in May. I was worried about the area after reading many reviews here but I stayed there without any problems. I wasn’t there to drink and party so would eat my dinner out and make my way to the hotel for the evening. The room was clean and well equipped. Iwas on the 4th floor and only had noise from the ground level once Breakfast was awesome. It was always wellstocked and the staff were always so friendly. The breakfast room was spacious and well set up The front reception staff were friendly and helpful.I can not fault this hotel at all. It is well located near the station. Once you workOut the exits, there is one very close to the hotel. Plenty of places to eat and shop nearby. Close to the Robot restaurant too.

Stayed here for 1 night while in transit. Room size was ok. Cleanliness was decent and location was good. Don’t bother to get the breakfast included - not worth it for what is offered (although convenient). No food on site in off hours. Staff spoke English reasonably.

After a lot of research trying to find a hotel right in the centre of Shinjuku, I finally stumbled across Citidines Central Shinjuku. This hotel was in an amazing central location, just walk for a few minutes any way from the hotel and you’re right near all the alleyways full of food and entertainment. There’s a convenience store on the bottom floor of the hotel which was perfect! There’s even a small temple just around the corner which I was not expecting. There were a couple of different subway/train station entrances quite close to the hotel which was amazing!The room itself was small but I was expecting that as I read all the reviews before I booked and by the sounds of it that is the standard in Tokyo. The room was big enough to fit mine and my partners large suitcases. The only thing I didn’t like about our stay was the bed! Hard as a rock and so were the pillows. Luckily there was one large firm pillow and one extremely thin pillow each (I had to request 2 more thin pillows and stacked them instead of using the large firm pillow).We stayed for 6 nights but I think that was too long to be staying in this hotel (only because of how uncomfortable the bed was). In hindsight I wish we split our time between Shinjuku and Shibuya.The reception staff were very friendly and we used the laundry once while we were here.

I like the location which nearby to many restaurants and shopping. Also within walking distance to the train station. There is a Lawson right below. Helpful staffs, fuss free check in and check out. Pretty decent in size.

The best part about this property is the location. Restaurants and the train station are within walking distance. It is in the heart of the red light district so there are a lot of host and hostess bars but it still felt safe and the police station is just across the street. The room was very comfortable and clean. Check in was super fast and easy. The only thing we were not quite satisfied with was the WiFi was spotty in the room especially when we were streaming videos on two different devices but it is free!

Perfectly located in the heart of Shinjuku, round the corner from Golden Gai and well connected by the metro line. The Lawson downstairs adds to the convenience for an early morning/late night snack. The room was clean, good bathroom and a decent size for Tokyo. Staff were friendly and professional. Would happily stay here again.

TA & B.com review: Great location beside Golden Gai. Clean, very comfortable. Would stay again. Convenient location, near one of the 200 entrances to the labyrinthine Shinjuku station. Fantastic buffet breakfast, with everything you want (Japanese, Chinese & Western). There's a discount for pre-paying breakfast the day before at reception (if your room rate didn't include it). I made a booking for 3 nights with Booking.com (no pre-payment), then later added another night with Agoda (pre-paid). They managed to combine the bookings seamlessly, so I didn't have to check out & in again, or change rooms. No problem paying the final bill. Spotlessly clean and pleasant staff. Nice view from my 10th floor window of Golden Gai down below.

I agree with all the reviews saying this hotel is well located, clean and close to plenty of restaurants, the metro and a Lawsons store for all your needs. But the room is small with a hard double bed pressed up against a wall and terrible pillows. Jet lag will help you sleep anywhere but was glad our stay was only short.The staff were very friendly andhelpful with good local maps available. They are certainly an asset. Not sure what accommodation is like all through Tokyo, but would probably look for something bigger in the future.

This was our first trip to Tokyo and we choose the Citadines based on its proximity to Shinjuku Station.We were pleasantly surprised by the friendliness of the staff and the peacefulness of the hotel despite its central location.Check in was efficient and super friendly, our room clean and cool. Breakfast was a bit boring, as there is only a small buffet, but the food was delicious and even the coffee tasted great.On the second day, one of us had a birthday and upon returning to the room, she found a beautiful message, origami and small gift from the hotel. Thank you for that! It made our stay even more special :)One night, the fire alarm went off around midnight and in true Japanese professionalism, a voice message calmed everyone down. The problem was solved within five minutes and luckily, no fire was detected. Even though the alarm frightened us, we felt safer afterwards knowing, the there is a system in place to keep guests informed about potential dangers. Overall, the hotel is excellent value for money. When returning to Tokyo, we look forward to stay at Citadines again.

Very well located, only a short walk to the station, restaurants and shopping. Very friendly and helpful English speaking staff. Room was very clean and well serviced each day. Breakfast was generous with a good variety of foods. Would definitely stay again. Thanks for a great stay!

I was expecting a small hotel room and it is small to the a average westerner however we found it worked fine for us. It provides a lot of little extras that may be normal in Japan but you won't get in a 3 star UK hotel eg slippers, bathrobe, fresh bottled water every day and plentiful toiletries. The location is perfect, right in the centre of Shinjuku and an easy 10 minute walk from the station. We had breakfast on our last day only and it was pleasant with both Japanese and western staples. We got it at a discount rate of 12000 yen each, which we felt was fine for the food on offer. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Well to start this hotel is I a great location. Only a few minutes walk from the train station and even a easy walk with luggage. Although the room was small we spent very little time there (to much to do in Tokyo). Every night when we got back at night our room was lovely and clean with fresh bottled water ready for the next day. All the staff where excellent and very helpful with everything we wanted. We will certainly be back to stay when we come back to Tokyo ⛩

Good value for 3 star hotel. Great location about 7 minutes walk from Shinjuku station, and 2 minutes from all the night life of Shinjuku ie robot restuarant, food venues (many), bars, arcades galore. Buffet breaky bit expensive for what it is but the food was very nice and decent amount of options. Room was well presented and bathroom was beautiful. Staff very polite, friendly and approachable. Small smoking area available.

I was a bit hesitant staying in Kabukicho since I know the area but we were traveling with friends who stayed close by. I wouldn't stay here with my family but this trip was just with my spouse so it was suitable. If you're not familiar, just don't go too much past the hotel and you'll stay out of the heart of night clubs. It's not dangerous, just trashy and drunk at night time. Location itself was actually really convenient. Close to shopping and many eateries. Fairly close to the JR Shinjuku station (10 min) and closer to the Minami Shinjuku Metro station (3-5 min). There's a Lawson right outside which is fully stocked. Close to Isetan, Marui, and Lumine. You can also access the underground mall all the way to the station as well from close by. Stayed 2 nights in the standard double room the 4th floor on the back side so it was quiet from street noise. I didn't have any issues with noise. Amenities were basic but adequate. Bed was satisfactory, nothing luxury about it. Halls and room didn't smell like smoke which was good. Price point was very affordable.

We spent our first 3 nights of our 2 week trip to Japan here. Like all hotels in Japan it was very clean and had all the amenities that you could possibly need in your room. The room and bed was a little small to what we are used to in the UK, but by Japan standards is was relatively large- with enough space for a couch and desk! (not something you always get in other Japanese hotel rooms).However the main selling point for this hotel in our opinion is its fantastic location- right next to Golden Gain (a network of alleyways with small bars). This is a great place to go for a drink and meet both locals and tourists. There was also a Lawson convenience store located on the bottom floor of the hotel which was perfect for breakfast on the go (onigiri!) and late night snacks (fried chicken!) It's about a 5 minute walk to Shinjuku station and the view from our room was also great.Excellent place to stay and we would definitely go back!

We recently spent two weeks in Japan, five nights of which were in this property. We searched online for the best price versus room size in the Shinjuku area and Citadines was one of the best results. Rooms were nicely designed, very clean, well appointed and quite spacious (for Tokyo) with a bunch of helpful staff at all hours. In fact, we had to find an English-speaking doctor during our stay and they helpfully not only directed us to an International medical centre, but also made an appointment for us, which was great.The breakfast was also excellent with a good mix of Western options and an even better range of Japanese items, including fish, rice, miso soup and pickles (my favourite).It's a ten minute walk from Shinjuku's central exit to the hotel. It's surrounded by restaurants, bars and shops, all buzzing with a lot of people, from 10:30 till very late. Shinjuku is the busiest station in the world connecting multiple subway and rail lines, including the Narita Express (NEX), so it's a perfect location from which to see the city in all directions.It's certainly one of the better hotels on offer at a good price.

Stayed here with for 2 nights with a family of 5 , had to book 2 rooms to accomodate one of the room was a studio premier twin which was quite a large room as i requested for an extra bed. Location wise, would say it is located in the heart of Shinjuku with access to the JR train station about 10mins walk. There is a convenience store located just downstairs the building, the surrounding area has quite a number of restaurants which makes looking for food a breeze. It can get a bit crowded in the evenings and nights which I am guessing there is some sort of a anime theater nearby as each time I walk past there were queues. My like was there was a Mister Donut at the end of the street which was a good place to grab a snack or breakfast. Also, its walking distance to Don Quijote which is like a place where you can find almost everything and anything.Overall, had a pleasant stay

Excellent hotel at walking distance from Shinjuku JR rail station (and Yamanote JR line) in addition to metro stations. Very comfortable room (we booked a double executive room that was fairly large, with the double bed detached from wall on both sides, which is not always so in Japan). Modern, large bathroom. Spotless clean, very quite. Very good breakfast with eggs cooked at the moment, fruits, yogurt cocked items and a lot more. Absolutelly recommended.

400metres from Shinjuku jr room and amenities great buffet breakfast is the way to start the daystaff excellent with any problem . allowed us late checkout 7/11 store just below hotel 50 metres from main shopping and restaurant areawould stay here again

We stayed here for total of 3 nights. The hotel location is good as it is within walking distance to many shopping spots, restaurants. The reception service was average. The rooms are small, but clean.

My husband and myself travel to Tokyo every year. This time we decided to bring the kids again. We decided to stay here than Sunroute Plaza bec we had to get 2 rooms. My kids are 13 and 10. It's convenient to have Lawson right at the ground level. i love that we get our rooms serviced everyday. The cleaners are lovely. Breakfast is nothing fancy but good enough to keep us full the whole day. After walking about 20k a day, it was good to go back to the hotel and lie down. It's great how clean it is, as long as you dont look at the carpet because they look a bit worn out. You need to take 2 lift to get to our room level. We were lucky to get the last room at the end of the hall so it was more spacious. The pillows were smaller than what Im used to but comfortable. I slept well on the bed which is really great for a light sleeper like me.

Citadines Central Shinjuku Tokyo had the very best service and facilities... It can make all the guests feels like home... Citadines Central Shinjuku Tokyo is very recommendation for all the type of trip in Tokyo...

Booked this hotel because it offered better value than the nearby Hotel Gracery. The latter has Godzilla climbing on the roof, but the Citadines Central was perfectly nice. Clean, comfortable and good breakfasts. The real plus point was the location. Shinjuku is VERY lively and the transport links to the rest of the city are brilliant.

Chose the Citadines after much research and was happy with our choice. The location was ideal for us, ten minutes walk to Shinjuku Station and surrounded by places to eat and drink yet quiet at night. Our standard twin room was functional with enough space to place a large suitcase in the room without it invading our space. The twin beds were very comfortable and more like small doubles which was a pleasant surprise. Bathroom was really good sized with the slightly curious bath/wet room setup that seems common in Japan, and very modern.The staff were excellent, especially when my daughter took ill and they quickly arranged a doctors appointment for us. I would definitely return here the next time we visit Tokyo

The hotel staff are so friendly and helpful. The hotel is very clean and close to Shinjuku station. One of the best hotels we stayed in Japan. I would definitely come come back and recommend this hotel to other travellers.

My family and I stayed at the Citadines Central Shinjuku for a few days. Here's a breakdown of what we like and don't like about the establishment:LIKES:1. Location. It's really at the heart of Shinjuku. It's a bit far from the train station but it's in the center of all the action. 2. Lawson Convenience Store. There's a convenience store at the ground floor. This means that we didn't need to avail of the hotel buffet breakfast as it offers a wide selection at a cheaper price.3. The front desk and cleaning staff. They are all very nice and accommodating.4. Money changing machine at the lobby. Insert your US Dollars and get Japanese Yen. Really convenient!DISLIKES:1. The pillows are too small and too firm. I couldn't get a good sleep that I was thinking of buying a new one from Bicqlo.2. Slow internet. No problem with the signal, but I had to rely on my mobile internet if I want to stream my content.3. Room is small (as expected)

My wife and I stayed for four nights. The hotel was great and the staff was very helpful whenever we needed something. The room was smallish, but not as small as I was expecting based on other people's reviews. It's just a few minutes walk from Shinjuku station and right above a Lawson and 7-11.

For a Tokyo hotel, my room at the Citadines Central Shinjuku was downright spacious. I accessed the hotel thru its front entrance for the first few days, and then found the back entrance that communicates through a lovely walkway - I used that entrance from then on. Note: this area of Shinjuku has a number of (non-Japanese) street hawkers that can be extremely aggressive. One of them grabbed a friend of mine roughly by the arm when he tried to say 'No thank you.' This is the only place in Tokyo where I saw this - I felt extremely safe in Tokyo as a general rule.

I recommend this hotel, because it is close to the subway and has convenient transportation. Counter staffs' service is very sweet and house keeping is very well. Downstairs has the Lawson convenience store. Breakfirst is very dicilious.

We stayed in this hotel at the start of our Japan trip. Based on previous reviews I worried the room would be really small. Yes it wasn’t massive but we certainly had enough room for the 5 nights we were there. Location was great, in the heart of Shinjuku. We never felt unsafe despite other reviewers comments. I would stay here again.

The hotel is in a great location, shopping and entertainment all downstairs. However the rooms are tiny (smaller than tokyo standards), beds uncomfortable and amenities lacking in the room. Bathroom was ok. I would try to stay at other hotels if possible. Staff were providing good service.
user_name:
fauzay
Bandar Seri Begawan, Brunei Darussalam

review_body: Godzilla is my landmark every time I visit the area of Shinjuku. I was surprised to see how close this hotel is to the area of Godzilla. I love the fact that there's Lawson's on the Ground Floor plus a 7-Eleven about 20 meters away from the hotel. Being in close proximity to the shopping area, going back and forth from the shops to the hotel to drop off everything that we've shopped wasn't a hassle at all.For the room, I love that it was very clean and complete with room amenities. The most important of all, I love their soft bed, pillows and sheets and the availability of wall sockets in different areas of the room.

Excellent room, service and magnificent breakfast in the heart of Tokyo. Convenient to many local amenities, restaurants, and cultural icons within walking distance. Also convenient to pickup locations of excellent tours such as the excellent tour to Mt. Fuji.

Disappointed. Booked non smoking room and they put us on 10th floor. Smelled smoke all night. Went to lobby next morning and they said oh that’s because upper floors are smoking. Doesn’t make sense. Had to pack everything up and move to fourth floor. All four nights, could hear shouting outside our room at 1am.

This place was in the heart of shinjuku close to every thing. The hotel was very clean and the staff were pleasant and helpful. Free coffee machine and conference room on level 13. Laundry facility are provided as well.

great location, very close to train station, close to the robot restaurant. staff were very friendly and check in /out was a breeze. Rooms were bigger than expected and the breakfast buffet is good. Overall a very nice place

great service, good ambience, the location very strategic..near to kabukicho, golden gai, shinjuku station..walking distance..the room is very clean and comfortable..too bad i didnt try rhe food..it must be good too..

We found this hotel in a web search, looking for a place within easy walking distance of Shinjuku station. We were not quite sure what "ApartHotel" meant, but, in fact, it was just like a hotel. Room was well kept up, compact but very comfortable with a good bed and excellent shower/bath. View over Kabukicho rooftops and streets, but, on the 8th floor, there was no issue with street noise. Breakfast buffet was extensive and very good (great scrambled eggs!). Location is fantastic, right next to an area of old 2 story pubs and tiny restaurants, and in the thick of the nightlife that Shinjuku offers. Only slight negative was that the wireless internet was slow.

We chose this hotel as it was called Central, but that meant central Shinjuku which is a busy commercial area of Tokyo rather than Tokyo itself. Nonetheless it is interesting to see this very busy area.The hotel is close to the station, and in the daytime we would have walked but at night, with cases, and not really knowing where we were going we opted for a taxi, which wasn’t really a decent fare for the taxi driver.The reception staff were very helpful in resolving a difficulty at checkin.As for the room, my wife felt the bed linen looked a bit old. We had a small fridge that was useful when we bought a snack for breakfast from a local convenience store. The double room was ¥14,000 a night for the room and ¥1,300 for breakfast p.p. This was probably ok for the room we had in that location.

Location: the very HEART of Shinjuku, right by the Golden Gai. Golden Gai is literally on your doorstep, and the famous Landmarks of Shinjuku such as the Godzilla statue (3 minutes) and the Robot Restaurent (1 minute) are so close. The nice thing is when going shopping you can quickly nip back into the hotel to drop off your bags and then go out again to buy some more. For a tourist who wants to be in the middle of the hussle and bussle this is a great location. If anything, the location was a bit TOO good on the Friday night - as we were by Golden Gai I could hear a lot of drunk people singing at around 3-4am whilst trying to sleep. But if you're a deep sleeper or are going to be out until that time yourself then this shouldn't bother you. Note, there are two Citadines in Shinjuku, if you want to be at the heart of Shinjuku stay in this one - the other one takes about 10 minutes walk. The room itself felt dark and slightly dingy, had no charm to it. It was merely ok. Size wise it was a little small, but considering this is Tokyo it was actually bigger than I had expected. Check-in wasn't smooth, arrived from my Ginza hotel at 11am and instead of just saying "sorry, room isn't available until 2pm" they kept on saying "10 more minutes, 10 more minutes" so I ended up sitting there for an hour wasting my time so managing expectations isn't their strong point. Additionally the lobby ALWAYS felt busy, always had to wait to speak to the staff as people were constantly checking in and out of the hotel all day.
user_name:
elf19872018
Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

review_body: Very comfortable room, very good bathroom. Helpful staff. Great location close to Shinjuku train station and good restaurants. Good value buffet breakfast available at extra cost. Would stay here again.

Convenient location, clean and spacious! Very easy check-in and checkout! Very helpful and polite staff! Spend my birthday there, got surprise card and cherry blossoms sweets! Really thankful for it! Highly recommended if you wants to stay at Shinjuku

Convenient located and good customer service. Reasonable room size compared to the hotels I stayed in Osaka and Asakusa. However, it would have been better if the wifi network is improved and if there were gym facility in the hotel.Overall am happy with the hotel and will definitely revisit.

Location is quite convenient, about 8-10 mins walk to subway station. There is a Lawson right at the hotel ground floor. Hotel lobby on 3/F. Lots of restaurants around the area. Double room is spacious as compared to other hotels in Tokyo. Amenities were standard and good enough for daily usage. Stayed for 3 nights in total.

This hotel is perfectly located between Shinjuku Station and Shinjuku nightlife..easy walk to either area. Again, spacious for this part of Tokyo and reasonably priced..Clean and very up to date bathrooms...And, again, if shinjuku is your destination, Citadines Central is ideally situated

We stayed at this hotel for five nights I think this is the hotel you stay at for two nights three at max. The area is in central Shinjuku however there are lots of dodgy things going on at night and I was also robbed in front of the hotel at night. In the daytime is totally fine there’s lots of tourists around however once the night hits there are a lot of people standing around trying to get you to Into clubs or hook you up with a hooker. The room was very small and the bed was super Uncomfortable so were the pillows. I would just only recommend this hotel as I said just for a couple nights if you want to drink and party, not for a long stay. The subway is not that close so if you have a lot of luggage it might be difficult we have a lot of luggage so we had to just take cabs to the airport.Not sure about the breakfast they charged about ¥1900, For that money I would just get breakfast somewhere else.

We stayed here from 15.03.2019 to 18.03.2019. The double deluxe rooms were quite spacious for Tokyo and big enough for me as a single traveller. Most of the rooms in other hotels were smaller than this hotel. Location and the room size was was the main reason why we choose the hotel. The staff was friendly and helpful. It was easy to check in and check out. The hotel is located quite near the station. It took us only 6-7 minutes to walk to the hotel. Right next to the hotel you get popular tourist attractions in Shinjuku. It was a very comfortable stay.

This was my first trip to Japan and all of my research had indicated that rooms were typically on the smaller side so I purchased the slightly larger Deluxe Double room. I found that this was very suitable for me (though mind I was just one person and I do think that if there were two people it could have been cosy).The room was tastefully decorated and I really loved the bathroom. I liked that it had the traditional Japanese style bath with separate showering area to use before soaking in the tub.
