I found the bathroom accessories to be plentiful and you could take additional items (such as shaver etc) from the reception on check in.I could not quite get the room at the right temperature - it was always too hot or too cold - thought this could well have been user error.I had read that Shinjuku area was intimidating and that there were a lot of unsavoury characters around the hotel. Although I was expecting the worst, I did not at any time feel unsafe and yes I was approached once or twice but a firm 'No thank you' was all that was needed - they certainly didn't persist. They are just people trying to advertise their clubs - they are not out to mug you. So I would not let that put you off.It was quite noisy during the night due to sirens and the surrounding nightlife but you are going to have to contend with this regardless of where you stay in this area I would say. I always like a quiet room and can happily say that after a full day of sightseeing I was out like a light each day regardless of the surrounding noise. I am also happy to say that you do not hear any noises in the outside corridors - the guest floors themselves are as quiet as a mouse. So that is a big plus!It is very close to the Golden Gai bar district and also the LGBT area as well - if these are areas you wish to explore.The reception staff could all speak English well which made things easier for us and they assisted us with luggage forwarding to our next hotel which was very helpful.I will definitely consider staying here again the next time I visit Shinjuku.

Staff were wonderful, room was very comfortable modern and clean. Location was excellent close to public transport, we had a wonderful week staying here. Staff could not have been more friendly or helpful.

The room is very cozy and comfortable. The staffs were very well mannered and pleasant to speak to. However, the room was pretty small and the heater can get pretty stuffy.It is also located in the middle of pretty sleazy neighbourhood, hence when I wanted to go to nearby Lawson or 711 in the middle of the night, I was consistently hassled by sleazy club promoters. Nonetheless during the day, there were so many good food options around. The breakfast provided was very decent too, expecially loved their scrambled eggs.Will definitely book here again in about 3months time!

I booked a studio room here a month in advance and paid around 18000+ yen (not including tax), the day before we were due to stay, I noticed that the rate had dropped to 16000 yen and there was no way we could cancel without incurring a night's penalty. Understand that rates fluctuate but this still left a bad taste in my mouth nonetheless. Looked at the website for directions to the hotel but they were vague so had to depend on google maps. I was surprised that the hotel staff insist you pay upon arrival even though there was a credit card guarantee. Rooms are v.small, insufficient space to open your suitcase which I understand is not unusual in Tokyo but I'm not sure why you would put in furniture (sofa) in such a small room? Location is convenient, about a 5-10 min walk to the metro or JR line. Hotel is located in Kabukicho which is Tokyo's red light district so it feels a bit dodgy particularly on weekend nights. Maybe not a good choice if you have kids. There are other hotels in better neighbourhoods around the same price or slightly more(shinjuku washington, sunroute shinjuku) that would be a good option. All in, what with the neighbourhood and options of better hotels around the same price, I will not choose to stay here again.

This hotel really disappointed me with rooms and service.We booked a "Studio Deluxe Double" with a flexible reservation. We arrived late at night, the receptionist spoke decent English and demanded we pay for all 4 nights before checking in. Stupidly enough I agreed. He gave us a room that is neither Studio, nor Deluxe, nor Double. The room was so small, that we could not be inside with our 2 large and 2 small suitcases, let alone open them. I immediately went to the reception again and asked why was our deluxe studio so small, to which he responded that this is what we booked. He said he can upgrade us for about $60 per night to a "much larger" room. I agreed and he gave me the new key. Went back upstairs to my fiancee, took all the luggage and moved to the "much larger" room. Surprise surprise, the room was sure maybe 20% larger, but 20% increase of the smallest room I've seen in my life is still very, very small. I said OK we'll have to deal with it, I took some furniture (!) out of the room in order to lay down our suitcases, and they wouldn't open again, because of the lack of any space. Extremely annoyed at this point, I went back to the reception and requested a refund on the remaining 3 nights, as it was already 2 AM and I couldn't change hotels right away. The same receptionist asked if we're gonna stay if he moves us to a "really large room" for no additional cost ($60 increase still on), which I said would consider if I see it first, not moving any luggage anymore. He showed us the room, which was still bad, but I decided it's acceptable at this point. The pictures that I'm uploading are from the "largest" room, as I didn't even take pictures of the smaller ones.The room was with below average furniture, but clean enough and with some amenities inside. The bed wasn't one large bed but two 1.5 beds instead. Nothing else to say, wasn't terrible but wasn't good as well. Bathroom is OK.The location of the hotel is somewhat convenient, as it's close to a metro station and a few key areas. However, it's in the middle of, what I can only describe as, "funny neighborhood", with many many weird clubs and weird people around. We didn't feel very good there, nor we felt safe. I know it's safe in Japan, but there were some questionable people on the street who were not Japanese at all. And they were quite pushy trying to get us in a club or whatever.Not only I advise everyone reading this to find another hotel, but please consider staying in a different area altogether.Disclaimer: I'm aware hotels in Tokyo are small. This, however, was too small for the price they demanded. When I book "deluxe studio" or whatever, I expect at least space to open my suitcase. They only reason I'm rating it 2/5 and not 1/5 is because after all we did get a human-sized room, so I guess it could be worse.

Citadines Central Shinjuku is a hotel with a great location. The direct surroundings are dynamic and interesting. And it's easy to reach other areas of Tokyo.The staff provides great service. The rooms are clean and decorated nicely. Tokyo is very dynamic, so it's great to have this hotel to return to every evening. It felt like a relaxing haven where I could relax, recharge and make plans for the next day.

We stayed here recently for 3 nights. I found it to be a very good option. The price was excellent because we booked a few months ahead. It is in the middle of Shinjuku but we were close to so many restaurants. We never felt unsafe on the streets at night. Its less then 10 minutes walk from the station. The walk is uphill back to the station so you should keep that in mind if you have mobility issues. The staff were very helpful. They answered any question we asked. It is right next door to a Lawson convenience store which was rally helpful. The room was a fair size and the bathroom was great.

No expectation at all before my stay but surprised with the service, room, cleanliness, amenities, space, bed, etc....Definetly not a bad place for the price. Since the hotel is in central shijunki area at night it's little noisy but didn't bother me at all.

This hotel is in a very good position, great to visit Shinjuku, this area is very popular for nights and restaurant but I never had fear, neither after dinner.Our room was clean and even big (compared between Tokyo's standards).Very friendly staff, they were so kind and they speak a very good English. We had also breakfast buffet included and it was perfect, various and good for all nationality.

Ingresamos hoy 03-03-2019, nos equivocamos al hacer la reserva la hicimos por una habitacion con cama matrimonial y aclaramos en comentarios que queriamos camas separadas. Nos dieron la habitacion matrimonial, pedimos el cambio y nos dicen que tenemos que pagar mas de 20000 ¥ para poder realizar el cambio. Nos sentimos estafados por un hotel que quiere sacar provecho en lugar de brindar soluciones.We entered today 03-03-2019, we were wrong to make the reservation we did it for a room with a double bed and we clarified in comments that we wanted separate beds. They gave us the matrimonial room, we asked for the change and they told us that we have to pay more than 20,000 ¥ to be able to make the change. We feel cheated by a hotel that wants to take advantage instead of providing solutions.

We stayed here for the Tokyo Marathon and found the hotel to be a great value for the price. The room is small but comfy and clean - we also had a fridge, safe, ketttle, pants press, blow dryer and good pressure in the shower. It is less than 10 minutes fron Shinkjuki Station so it has great access when visiting Tokyo. It is a busy area, always people about and it felt very safe. We arrived early to check in and they easily accepted our luggage so we could enjoy our day. The pillows were quite hard but a quick request at the front desk and we had softer pillows when we returned that evening. The 24 hour mart downstairs is also very handy, plenty of bars and resturants all around.

Citadines Central Kabukicho are great place to stay in Tokyo where you want to experience the great shopping and nightlife of the city. Centrally located and very close to Kabukicho and Shinjuku station made this a very good place to stay.

I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in a double room in Feb 2019. The hotel staff seems to be more interested in serving Caucasian customers than Asian customers. The room is reasonably sized for Japan standards, but the design of the room and walkways looked tired. It is about 12-15 mins walk from the hotel to JR Shinjuku station, and there's a convenient store located on the 1st level of the hotel should you need to grab anything. I would say that you would be better off staying at other hotels around Shinjuku if you wanted better hospitality.

Very conveniently located, friendly service and we appreciated that we could leave our luggage for storage before check in whilst we explored the area. Although located in the red light district, the area felt very safe and family friendly and very close by to many shops and great places to eat. The room was very clean and quiet.

Meh. Nope. Paid $150 a night with all taxes for solo occupancy no breakfast. Think it was a bit overpriced. Place was a total let down considering the high ratings and definitely better in pictures. I only stayed one night and wasn't too thrilled. Usually Tripadvisor ratings give some validation, but in this case nope. Furnishing were overly scuffed up and things didn't work in the room. It needs a refresh or better maintenance; looks worn. The bed didn't even have a bed skirt/covering. There is no separate concierge and the front desk people only had two people working there; They don't consider that other guests may be running late. The only pro was that it was close to the Shinjuku action and the train station. You are paying for it's location. Don't really recommend. I think you can find better.

The location was great, a bit of a walk from Shinjuku station, but nearer to Shinjuku-3-chome, which gives you access to the main touristy areas. The room was also decently sized but it was a bit dusty. The hotel is located in Kabukicho, so lots of nightlife and it's super easy to look for food (Lawson on first floor)

The hotel service was great. They had very nice staffs. Two things to point out (finding the dot on the white page). Internet speed and using two elevators to leave from your room to lobby then lobby to go outdoors. 속도랑 엘베 빼곤 다 좋았어요. 가성비 굿! 위치도 정말 좋아요~

Hotel is great. Rooms are small, like every hotel in Japan, but modern and comfortable with everything you might need. Location is great, in the vibrant part of Shinjuku just a few blocks from the station and with lot of bars and restaurants just a few meters away. Hotel is in a 3rs floor so it's not very noisy. Breakfast is good so if you plan on using it but it beforehand. Staff is not the most friendly but they speak English. Would definitely stay again next time. For a 4 star hotel it's probably the best.

Well appointed rooms with kitchen facilities and personally controlled airconditioning. Location ideal walking distance to many restaurants and subway stations. Shinjuku central bus station also close. Staff very welcoming with exceptional service. (Our adult son disappointed that Gym was very basic.) Totally recommend to anyone

We stayed at Citadines for four nights it was well located in the middle of night life , shopping and transport I would definitely stay here again. The rooms are small but this is consistent with all Japanese hotels.

Lovely hotel situated in quiet street in the busy Shinjuku area of Tokyo. The hotel staff are very attentive. The room was lovely with 2 double beds, table and chairs. Great bathroom with the obligatory japanese toilet. Shower was excellent with plenty of hot water. The room itself was very quiet. Our room was on the 14th floor and overlooked a shrine. Breakfast was a buffet style and had the usual cereal, juice, pastry and bread. With a hot selection included bacon and scrambled egg, curry, rice porridge and fish soup - also sald. All in all a great stay. we would definitely stay there again.

As we all know hotel rooms in Japan are really small but Citadines Central Shinjuku Tokyo was a well comfortable of a space. 2 of us fit comfortably on the bed and there even was a couch with still loads of walking space around the room. The bathroom was such a relief in size compared to previous/other hotels I’ve stayed in Japan. Service upon check in was fantastic.. definitely recommend & will return!

The rooms are a bit stuffy and small which is normal for Tokyo but the bathroomAnd bathtub was a nice surprise. The location is nice although you have people right outside the hotel asking you if you want to solicit a Japanese girls..... staff is friendly , no issues.

No complaints. Was on 9th floor and it was quiet at night. Staff speak very food English. They helped me getting my stuff that got left behind in the room. I just had to pay for shipping and handling.I wasn't sure if i was supposed to leave tip for housekeepers.

Good location in the city and near amenities, and service staff were wonderful! Pleasant stay in the very nice room which was very well made up and cleaned daily. Proximity to Golden Gai which was easy for us to get a drink at night before bedtime. Will choose to stay here again the next trip.

We chose this hotel for a 2 days stay in Tokyo that kicked off our stay in Japan. The location was perfect, just round the corner from the business of Shinjuku (and the robot restaurant) yet in a quieter part of the area which meant you could get a good night's sleep. The hotel is between the two stations, Shinjuku being the bigger one and having direct connection to the airport. It is about a 10-15 minute walk from the station. We walked but I struggled with my big bag. We went for a bigger room, knowing how small the single rooms in Japan might be this seemed to be a better option. It was nice and spacious and the bed was very comfortable. I had the most amazing sleep. My judgment might be clouded though as after 12 hours of travelling, no sleep and then half a day of sightseeing the jetlag took its toll. The breakfast was good as well, it was a gentle introduction to Japanese cuisine meaning you had a mix of what the locals would eat and what he tourists might find an acceptable breakfast choice. There are numerous restaurants in the area and there are several little alleys full of traditional 'pubs' just behind the hotel. Overall a very good stay.

Can’t really say much more than the review title. Convenient location to the metro station. But the room we got was teeny tiny to the point that one of us had to sit so the other could pass. Not really an issue since we only spent time in the room to sleep at night. Would recommend for a solo traveler or if they have larger rooms available.

Citadines Central Shinjuku is conveniently located in Kabukicho. Lots of amenities around, Lawson is just downstairs, restaurants all around, Golden Gai is behind the hotel, and it's also pretty close to the Shinjuku JR station (5~10 mins walking). I tried the APA hotel in Kabukicho a year prior and found the room size at Citadines to be much better. I can actually open my large luggage flat, whereas it was not possible in the APA. Very good stay, it's clean, staff are helpful, no complaints about the hotel. I'd probably stay again the next time I'm in Tokyo.

The hotel is situated in Shinjuku area and near to many restaurants, convenient stores and shopping malls.Check in process was very efficient, staffs were all very friendly and helpful. The room has a decent size, comfortable bed and decent size of bathroom. Definitely one of the better room size for Japan standard.Overall this hotel is really good value for money. Highly recommended.

Lovely and super central stay in Shinjuku, Japan. The hotel is walking distance to the shops, restaurants, nightclubs, public transport and the famous Robot Restaurant. Convenience store is also on the ground floor if you need to stock up on snacks. (no mini bar in the rooms) English speaking reception, complimentary bottled water and complementary wifi throughout the hotel. Housekeeping did a great job cleaning our rooms and despite everyone telling us the rooms in Japan are very small, ours was larger than expected. There was no iron or ironing board in the room, however you can hire these for free from reception. I will definitely recommend this hotel to all my friends and family. Thank you

Good location it is near in the station.Easy to access just walk around like your touring the place and then that's it you find your hotel with having fun with the location and the site. Good location

The hotel is the same as Citadines in Kyoto, but the staff was less helpful, also the hotel was in worse condition that the one in Kyoto. Location was quite good. The best thing was a small kitchen and a washing machines. Next time I would choose another hotel in Tokyo.

A very good location in Shinjuku, convenient access to food and shopping, location led to some late night noise from nearby bars but family never felt unsafe here, we rate the Hotel staff highly. Rooms were what you'd expect for Tokyo size wise but functional.

Great location in the lively Shinjuku area. The station is on the Yamanote line and is about a 10 minute easy walk. Room was on the smaller side, which is common in Tokyo. The toilet had a heated seat and temperature controlled spray - wish I had it at home! The location is great. Golden Gai is right behind the hotel. Numerous other restaurants, bars and shops within walking distance. The Lawsons on the ground floor is very convenient for groceries, snacks and water (though the hotel has signs stating tap water is drinkable). The street in front of the hotel is buzzing with activity all through the night. But the room was pretty quiet. Breakfast was the standard fare - eggs, sausage, juice, bread. I would stay again

So we stayed here for 8 days on our first trip to Japan. We got the limousine bus from Haneda Airport to the Shinjuku Bus Expressway, then jumped in a taxi to the hotel ( we could have walked with our suitcases as it’s only a 10 minute walk but we were tired after the flight). Our room was 18sqm had a double bed and small chaise longue, which we used to place our suitcase on. Room was a bit tight on space but standard for Japan I think. The room and corridors that I saw were looking a little bit tired and could probably do with a re furb, nothing major though the carpet on the 7 Th floor corridor where the laundry room is was stretched and rucked up, could have been a tripping hazard). However the rooms and hotel were clean and staff very friendly and helpful. As others have said the hotel is in Kabukicho and about a 10 minute walk to Shinjuku Train Station and is tight next to Golden Gai. We were on the 7th floor facing the street but didn’t have any problem noise. Would I stay here again? Yes I would.

Citadines central shinjuku is located at a very strategic location, easy to access to everywhere and not far from train station. The only thing we find it’s difficult is they’re at the 3rd floor of the building and next to main road so there’re no parking or waiting lane for cars. Customers who have many luggages might find it a little challenging to bring your own luggages up by yourselves.

Stayed here for 6 nights. A conveniently located hotel within walking distance from the Shinjuku station. The hotel is also next to 7-11 and Lawson convenience store where you can grab quick and convenient breakfast.Room and washroom are clean. Room is on the smaller side but comfortable.Staff was helpful and speak good English. Overall a pleasant stay here. :)

Great central spot - we had a studio apartment which was great, having a complete kitchen - so nice to be able to buy and cook our own meals for a couple of days. Very limited storage space, hardly any hanging, and the bed was almost on the floor. Slept well so must have been ok. Basin outside of bathroom, in sitting area - some good points for that, some negative. Very clean and neat and the staff were so friendly and helpful. Great free WiFi.

Stayed 5 nights on level 8 in deluxe double room and found the room very clean and comfortable. Was small but was typical size for Tokyo. Also nice toiletries supplied. Staff was friendly and helpful. Location was excellent with:- 5 mins walk from shinjuku station- back entrance leads into the Golden Gai alleyway / small bars area - Lawson and 7-eleven downstairs - surrounded by eateries and not far from shops (muji, uniqlo, etc) but still a quiet areaWould recommend staying here again.

The hotel is easy to find near the Shinjuku railway just a 10 minute or less stroll. Access from Narita airport is straight forward just take the JR East NEX which is the Narita Express Train. If you buy a JR Railpass this train is covered in the price.The rooms were clean and serviced daily although a little small they were ok. It is an older hotel with tired decor but the location was perfect and has a 7 /11 just outside. The price for rooms vary considerably we stayed for the New Year and paid a premium but it is less expensive at other times. Never had the breakfast so cannot comment as you have to travel to Tokyo station or Ueno Station to use the JR Shinkansen Trains and breakfast on the run was available everywhere. Day trips to the snow monkey park in Nagano are super easy to do as was day trip to Mt Fuji Lake Kawaguchi area also Echigo Yugaza all easy to do in a day hastle free.All in all a good place to stay for travel, eats, nightlife, and Tokyo experience.

The hotel is located within walking distance from shinkuju station. The room is neat and tidy but on the smaller side. I don't like the bed against the wall, the bed was also very uncomfortable for my back. The cleaners changed the bedsheets everyday I think. We were there for 9 nights, the staff all speak good English

A pretty basic but nice room, what you'd expect in Tokyo I suppose. The room was quite small but spacious I suppose by Tokyo standards. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the breakfast was good too. The best thing about the hotel was the location, right in the heart of where its all at and only a few minutes walk from the famous robot bar. The hardest thing about Tokyo is getting around, all the trains and buses have different operators so you cant buy a ticket for all as you can in most major cities of the world. The trip to from the airport was a bit of an ordeal and a woukld cost a mint. That said nice hotel, we would recommend!!

Love the location. See the location and manage your expectation. surely not an (Asian) family oriented hotel and more for youngsters who want to experience the other side of Tokyo. I am 35 and my partner 45 and we both love the location. See more Caucasian than Asian guest here. The room is definitely bigger than usual Japan hotel. Modern and self-sufficient hotel. One of the best hotel i have stayed in japan. Will recommend and be back.

We have always stayed in Citadines or other Ascott brand serviced apartment for our family vacation. Unfortunately, this Citadines is a disappointment. It is a hotel and not family friendly. The toilet door is almost transparent (even though it is partially frosted) and cannot be locked. Imagine trying to use it with a number of kids in the room. This kind of setting is more for honeymoon couple than a family with kids.The wifi is also very slow and almost unusable.Shinjuku is a nightlife area and our room is facing the street. Sound insulation of the room is not good and we were disturbed the whole night by the noise from the street (till 7 am).

Stayed here 5 nights. Located a short walk from Metro & a little further on to Shinjuku Station. Robot Restaurant is about 300m away. Plenty of restaurants to choose from. Beware of cover charge though. What you think is a $50 meal could easily turn into over $100. Best value meals we saw in our short time there were a soup & noodle place where you ordered outside at a vending machine & then walked in with a ticket (about$10 a meal). Don’t let all the men put you off. It’s about 200m further on from robot restaurant. Another place was a sushi train restaurant couldn’t get the exact address but I’m sure it was Sushi Restaurant Shion. Wife & myself had our fill & was about $18 for around 9 and plates. The staff at Citadines all speak English and were very helpful.

This hotel is conveniently located about a five minute walk from Shinjuku station, giving you easy access to Tokyo. Plenty of food and nightlife options close by the hotel, but being located in the red light district, there will be some hawkers out the front hassling you. They are easily discouraged and don't let them put you off.The staff were very helpful, allowing us to leave our bags early and they received a package delivered to us without incident.The rooms are small but serviceable, exactly what you would hope for given the price and location.

I was caught up with the HotelQuickly scam and your staff, Naoki had been very patient to help us. Our hotel booking was cancelled on 16 Nov 2018 after he checked for us when we checked-in on 18 Nov 2018, 7am. He tried to help to call the call center but failed. He checked that there were two rooms available and reserved for us till we resolved the issues as soon as possible since we had to pay the rooms again first. He asked us to think through. So, after lunch, we decided to take the two reserved rooms and we managed to check in earlier to rest. It was a drama day but Naoki had helped us alot that day to prevent us to find other hotels at the last minute and he mentioned that we had to fight and get back the refund. Luckily, we managed to get the refund while we know most others don't. I would like to compliment Naoki for his outstanding service.The only sad thing is the bed is rather hard and pillow is abit soft.

Backs on to the Golden Gai for those looking for a boozy night out and a short stumble home. Close to Robot Restaurant, VR Zone and Samurai Museum. Easy walk to train station and Shinjuku Gyoen as well. By Tokyo standards the room was a decent size, we never sat on the couch once as that is where we kept our luggage, but at least we had a spot for the luggage without having to walk over it every day. Ask for a room on the 7th floor - it's where the laundry is which was a great feature. Breakfast buffet was the same everyday but good enough. Very solid option at a good price point for Shinjuku.

Excellent for all ; service, staffs, room. If you ask for speciak requests before arrival. They will try to make it for you as much as possible. Staffs are very respondtive for your e-mail, quedtions or any enquirues.

We chose this hotel as the location is great. Its situated in the mid of the city and the whole surrounding area is very safe, well lighted and many food place and shopping for you to attend to. Halal food might be scarce but if you are not wary there are alot of seafood and chicken for you to eat.

It's nice to see hotels in Tokyo finally upping their game. It used to be that your only option aside from high-end hotels were run-down, smoke-scented "business" hotels. I've seen this hotel pop up in my searches and thought I'd try it for one night out of several. I was very pleasantly surprised.For the extra I spent here, I got a modern-ish room I could actually move around in, air-conditioning that "cools" in what the Japanese consider "winter", (a blessing since the windows don't open at this hotel and most hotels are very hot and stuffy in winter here)Nice staff that spoke English and were very accommodating. The location is great, not too far into Kabukicho and very convenient to where I wanted to go. Shinjuku station was maybe a 7 minute walk. Would definitely stay here again.

The hotel staff are helpful and speak fluent English, which makes communicating an ease. The room was very clean and comfortable. Location is great, with some restaurants that are opened 24 hrs on the street along the hotel. Street is bustling, especially during the weekends but safe to walk around. Really satisfied with my stay this trip and would definitely return on my next visit to Tokyo.

Staffs are nice and speak english fluently. Location in the central of everything. Lawson at the 1st floor. Room and bed size are big for Japanese standard.There is bathup in the bathroom. Amenities are complete.

A warm welcome greeting makes me flattered. Thank you mr Eljiro for your hospitality. Strategic location makes it easy for us to take a walk. Friendly staffs made us feeling at home. Many attractive places for sight seeing around hotel.

We were in for an overnight (on a two day trip). Quiet interior room with no view. Clean and comfortable. A bit of delamination on the cabinet in the kitchen. Good HVAC -- quiet. Standard Citadines kitchette. Very helpful staff. Tasty breakfast with Western and local offerings (extra). Lots of eateries as we headed west. The Isetan store (10-15 minute walk) has the usual excellent food floor, including an Anderson's and an Eric Kayser (bread and pastry). Nearest subway is south via the neighborhood lanes about 5 to 10 minutes. We would stay again when we are next in Tokyo.

My husband and I stayed here for four nights while in Tokyo. We were extremely happy with this hotel. The hotel was clean and modern with free WiFi and all the standard amenities you would expect. The hotel staff was polite and spoke good English. Our room was spotlessly cleaned everyday. Space in room/bathroom is tight, but this is typical of Japanese hotels. We had breakfast included in our hotel package, and the breakfast buffet provided was excellent — a great selection of Western food and traditional Japanese fare. The location was great — within short walking distance to the Shinjuku shopping areas, Samurai Museum, Golden Gai, Robot Show, etc. — and only a 10-minute walk to the Shinjuku station. Pretty much everything comes into/leaves from the Shinjuku station (subway, JR lines, Shinkansen, Odakyu lines if taking a day trip to Hakone, etc.), so this is a great perk. Word to the wise: The Shinjuku station itself is huge and a bit of a maze, so give yourself time to explore and figure out the layout. There are east and west entrances to the station and certain things are only accessible on one side of the station (i.e. the subway is on the east side and the Odakyu lines are on the west side).The only con I can think of is the comfort of the hotel bed — mattress and pillows were a bit thin/firm by Western standards. However, compared to the other two places we stayed during our trip, this was probably the most comfortable bed, so the mattress design could just be typical of Japan.Overall we were pleased and would stay here again if returning to Tokyo.

You would have to struggle to find a better location than this hotel. Shinjuku is a vibrant part of Tokyo. I'd looked at hotels nearby in quieter areas. I'm so pleased I didn't stay in them.It's a short walk to Shinjuku station and this allows access to the rest of Tokyo. The rooms are absolutely fine and the breakfast good. There is a store next on the ground floor of the hotel where all basics can be purchased.I met a couple from New Zealand for whom this was their third visit. Says it all really.

I don’t have much time to review hotels but this hotel is excepythus i decided to give a review. I really like the location of this hotel, the space is also big, the price is also very valuable. I am a very happy customer. Thank you.

Super friendly staff, highly efficient. So close to Golden Gai (my favourite drinking area) - it is literally just behind my room window. A little away from the metro station (Shinjuku Station), about 10 mins walk, but it's fine.

We chose this hotel because of its proximity to Shinjuku Station, which made it very convenient for exploring Tokyo. It is located in the very vibrant Kabuchiko, but we didn't find it noisy despite all that was going on outside. Front desk staff spoke excellent English, and were very friendly and helpful.Our room was clean and had all the usual amenities. You can pick up other amenities like showercap, etc at the front desk. Wifi was strong. Our only complaint was the double bed which we found very uncomfortable. It was also pushed against a wall which made climbing into bed for the other person rather awkward as you couldn't just slide in.

This hotel is in very well located a short stroll from shinjuku train station. From the station use google maps to easily navigate around Tokyo on your own. Enter your location in which you wish to go and google maps works out the trains to take and platforms etc. The hotel has a few undesirable individuals hanging around who have nothing whatever to do with the hotel, it just happens to be in the Tokyo red light area. They approach you with a friendly welcome only to rip you off in the club that invite you into. A person I know got a bill of €1,000 euro (one thousand euro) an absolute rip off. Do not acknowledge these persons most of whom are of Nigerian decent. Completely ignore them. This hotel does warn you about these individuals what they call 'street hawkers' also the police issue verbal warnings owner a tannoy system on the street. So with simple precautions you should have no worries. The hotel staff are excellent, very helpful in every way possible. And the room are cleaned spotlessly every day with great precision. The staff cleaning the rooms have a pleasant demeanour and the breakfast has a good choice of Wastern and Japanese fair. If visiting Tokyo I do recommend a stay I this hotel.

The Citadines Central Shinjuku was a short walk from Shinjuku Station for transport and close to many Tokyo icons such as the Samurai Museum, shops, restaurants, Golden Gai, the Robot Show, and Kabukicho. ProsThe hotel had:- friendly front desk staff- good, efficient housekeeping staff- 5 washing machine/dryers at reasonable rates- credit card facilities- a Lawsons store next door- 20% reduction for breakfast rates for guests- basic breakfast buffet (American/Continetal/Japanese) cuisine provided at reasonable rates- close to restaurants, bars and Shinjuku Station (entrance 15)- restaurants on site for lunch and dinner- lots of informational pamphlets in the lobbyRoom had:- TV with some programs in English plus paid channels- tea/coffee making facilities- electronic safe- telephone- lounge chair- comfortable bed- air conditioning- chair and desk with two power points- other power points in room- alarm clock- hanging space for clothes- a few drawers available- bar fridge- luggage rack- trouser press- clothes drying line over bath- large mirror- hair dryer- electronic bidet toilet- complimentary toiletries- LAN connection for laptops- free WiFi (measured at Download: 10.6Mbps, Upload: 1.2Mbps)- shower/bath combinationCons- some people may find it hard to get into and out of the shower over the bath rim- I found the pillows provided either too firm, or soft, but too thin.All in all, a good hotel for a comfortable stay in Tokyo.

Citadines Central Shinjuku is a fine place to stay in vibrant Shinjuku. Its location is almost perfect. While in the middle of Shinjuku, it was also close to a number of subway stations and to the Shinjuku Train Station.Interaction with Reception was professional, smooth and helpful. Our Studio Deluxe Double was cosy but ‘did the job’. The double bed was pushed into a corner. Having to crawl over each other to get into bed was a new experience for us. Could have been a bit of fun once! We didn’t find the bed particularly comfortable and found the pillows were small and felt grainy. Others may find all this just fine. Bed comfort’s nearly always a fairly subjective issue. Linen used was a bit thin but clean and fresh.As tourists, we were ‘out-and-about’ most of the time. There’s heaps to see and do. The bathroom was fine but a bit odd. A creative attempt had been made to update the bathroom by placing glass screening around the bath enabling you to shower next to the bath rather than needing to stand in it. Good thinking but it was all a bit different and not particularly practical. Water pressure and water temperature though, were excellent.Breakfast was included within our tariff. The spread was broad and more than adequate.Wi-Fi was also included. It was reliable and consistently strong. This was so good. It was good to have a small bar fridge too. Bottled water each day was appreciated.Be aware that there are two Citadines in Shinjuku. Although a big hotel, the Citadines Central has little street presence in amongst the hyperactivity and the flashing neons. Taxi drivers didn’t seem particularly familiar with it, but we found that having the address written in Japanese ready for any taxi drivers was particularly helpful.Citadines Central Shinjuku was fine for a few days in Tokyo. Make sure though, that you get out-and-about.

We stayed at the Citadines Central Shinjuku for 4 nights pre cruise. The hotel is in a great location if you like to be in the thick of the action and a bit of hustle and bustle. The hotel is clean. The staff are pleasant book in process smooth and breakfast is available daily. There are a lot of eating places close by and a short walk to the trains. Great udon restaurant next door and if you want a coffee Starbucks is about a block away

The hotel is more three star style than anything above. I had a Studio Deluxe room and this room type is even tiny. There was actually no reasonable space for putting a large piece of baggage. The interior has seen better days. The bathtub is too small for a typical european person. The Wifi is slow and flaky, almost unusable. The breakfast is average, the service is pretty poor...have seen much better places in a similar price range than the Citadines.

Stayed here for 4 nights. Location is in the heart of Shinjuku, it is right next to Golden Gai and it is within the famous red light area so be aware of that before booking. In saying that it is a very safe red light area with restaurants, cinemas, etc. But you definitely notice trades people of the illegal variety, whatever you do, do not let them take you anywhere. I stayed on one of the lowest levels and the windows had very poor sound insulation, was woken up on multiple nights by loud 'police siren like' noise and loudspeakers. It was so loud that I thought it was coming from within my room. A hotel in such a loud location should invest in quality windows.Other than that the room was good, clean and well stocked.

It was a nice home away from home :) Cleaners do a good job, Nice staff and great central location. Many Many touts on the street, Without being racist they are all black so thats how youll recognise them and the fact theyll ask you if you want to go for a drink... Dont do it. Google will tell you that you wont end up in a good situation if you go with them and Id agree. Sometimes theres about 10 on either side of the street right by the hotel.Staff was really wonderful letting us weigh our bags for the flight and letting us keep our bags there after check out.If you want to experience night life golden gai is right behind the hotel and Omiode Yokocho is just a short walk away apart from that kabukicho is full of nightlife.. Mostly seedy entertainment but its the redlight district.Id 100% recommend this place to anyone and Id 100% stay again and it will be the place I book next time I come to Tokyo.

Stayed here during my Tokyo trip.There is breakfast (for a fee) available within this hotel (or apartment)?The location of this property is 10mins walk to Shinjuku station.You can book direct shuttle bus services with the property in advance for a fee of 5000Yen per pax. (Better than dragging luggage to the station)The property is located nearby to a few bars etc. It gets reallyreally noisy on Fridays & Saturdays even if you're staying high up.

We stayed for 3 nights on our return to Tokyo at the end of our Japan holiday. The hotel was perfectly located for the main area of Shinjuku and train stations, subways, etc.The room was GREAT! It was the largest we had during our 15 day trip and gave us lots of space for cases and moving around, which felt like a treat after a lot of smaller rooms. The hotel feels very modern and very well maintained, with lovely staff. We had a great view of the Golden Gai which is less than five minute walk from the hotel. The bed was really comfortable, and traditional Japanese bedwear was available in the room as well. It was also the only hotel that had TV channels in English, although we enjoyed watching Japanese channels and trying to work out what was going on!The only thing to note is that there are a few seedier bars around this street. It made no impact on us but was our first experience of trying be touted into places, which we declined, and we noticed a lot more girl bars being touted. Again, I stress it made no impact at all and the area still felt totally safe - you'd have to walk by this way to get to the main eating and bar area anyway - it's just something to be aware of!We'd 100% stay here again when we return to Tokyo.

Good location in Shinjuku. Short walk to Shinjuku station. There were tons of restaurants and a Lawson’s downstairs. Clean room, which was a little bit tight, but doable. Hotel staff is very responsive to emails prior to arriving when we had questions.

This hotel is perfect location wise only 10 mins walk from Shinjuku station with plenty of restaurants and shops in a close vicinity, as well as the golden Gai district right next to it. The staff were friendly and considerate as we requested an early check in and were able to check in 2 hours before actual check in time, so good! Room was cleaned every day with pretty ample room space wise considering it’s Tokyo.

We recently stayed here for around 6 days. Pros:• The hotel is in a really central location and is quite convenient to get to the train station (10 mins walk) and lots of attractions within Shinjuku.• It was cleaned daily and to a good standard. • wide range of cuisines for breakfast• good service, staff were always friendly and polite. • Omelette bar was good at breakfast. Cons:• really really thin walls. • bed was awful. Hardest mattress I’ve ever slept on, pillows were really uncomfortable too, they seemed to be bean bags and had loads of little balls in?! Honestly the worst nights sleep I’ve ever had in a hotel and it left you aching throughout the trip!! • people hanging outside the hotel at all hours trying to get you into overpriced bars. • food at breakfast, although was varied, really wasn’t that nice, but I guess it depends what you like. • although the rooms were cleaned well each day, we’d often come back to a horrendous sweaty smell in the room that we struggled to get rid of. Overall, location was great but quality of hotel wasn’t great so don’t go with high expectations. Make sure you avoid the people on the streets trying to get you into bars too!

The hotel located in the center of shinjuku, very convenient to walk around, and near shinjuku JR Station (around 700m).Hotel room is a bit small, with 150 double bed, but bathroom is more spacious compare to other similar hotel.Overall, we enjoy our stay here, and will consider this hotel if staying in Shinjuku area.

Hotel very centrally situated - a ten minute walk to Shinjuku JR station. Hotel in the midst of plenty of restaurants,leading department stores, entertainment etc, neon lights. Has a 24 hour convenience store nearby, rooms were small but very comfortable with TV, small lounge and clean linen each day, tea & coffee also and 2 bottles of water each day. The reception very helpful, can get map in English to tourist sites etc. Taxis easy to get outside hotel - staff would write down in Japanese for us where we wanted to go. Breakfast was good selection of food including western. So can recommend a good stay away from home.

We stayed at the Citadines half a block from the lights and crowded streets in the shinjuku district. A few blocks away from the subway entrance and JR train lines the Citadines has a fantastic location. We had breakfasts included so had a noice choice of western style eggs, bacon and sausage or More Asian congi and condiments. The rooms are a little small and once the suitcases are in you have enough space to get around the bed but the hotel is very clean, the bathroom is spacious and there is a convenience store right out the entrance. Would stay there again.

We stayed at this hotel twice during our Honeymoon. We stayed in a Studio Deluxe Double on the sixth floor for four nights at the start of the trip, and one night at the end of the trip in a Studio Double on the fifth floor. Both rooms are cozy, but we didn't find them too tight for two people with a suitcase and backpack each (we are also used to city living though). There were not many noticeable differences between the two, both rooms were non-smoking and clean. The Studio Deluxe Double had a larger bathroom with a large tub and separate shower, but the bedroom was a little tighter. The Studio Double had a smaller bathroom with a shower/tub combo and more walking room in the bedroom. I didn't notice much street-noise from the sixth floor, but could hear it on the fifth (this didn't bother us as we live in the city and are used to this type of noise). The bedding is down, but the hotel staff will switch it out with hypoallergenic bedding if you request it. The hotel staff is very friendly and multi-lingual. They are very accommodating, polite, and helpful. We also arranged an airport shuttle to and from the hotel, and they stored our luggage on-site while we were our exploring after check-out. Breakfast was fantastic, definitely recommend it. They have a wide range of foods to satisfy many tastes. We enjoyed a filling meal here every day before exploring Tokyo. Location is great. It's in the heart of Shinjuku and a few minute's walk from the metro station, making it the perfect base to explore the city. There's also a Lawson's convenience store on the first floor of the building. Do note that there are two Citadines hotels in Shinjuku, this one is Citadines Central - don't mix it up with the other.

The location is amazing, not the most luxurious though. I went with my family and the stay was amazing. We didn't try the breakfast. Very clean and staff super friendly ! Also found the sweetest surprise card and cookies for my birthday! ***NOT ADVERTISING*** Try the restaurant in front of the hotel Pasela Resorts Shinjuku and Monster Hunter Bar.
user_name:
Andreana G
Greater London, United Kingdom

review_body: The hotel was brilliantly placed for a visit to Shinjuku. The staff were really flexible and friendly and helped us with earlier check ins and later check outs. Breakfast here is great too - it’s a little expensive but lots of choice!

This was my first trip to Tokyo so I relied heavily on sources like Trip Advisor and Yelp to find the best locations for hotels. The Citidines Central Tokyo didn't really live up to the reviews.The area:First, I will start by saying, my husband & I chose Shinjuku to stay based on the different attractions we wanted to see. It is true that Shinjuku is a great city in Tokyo and is pretty safe. However, you must keep in mind that this particular hotel is located in the heart of the Red Light District. This location is good for those that want to bar hop (Golden Gai), see casinos, etc. Central Shinjuku is a lot like Vegas. With that comes smoking in hotel rooms and bars. If you don't mind this, you will probably like this hotel a bit more.One annoyance of staying in Central Shinjuku is the people who come up to you on the street with solicitation. You will hear announcements that this is illegal in Tokyo but people still do it. There are men that try to coax you into bars which you should always say no to. We did see some women going into a bar with 2 of them and we read that this is when you get solicited to pay more for food/drink and they won't allow you to leave until you pay for the escalated costs. It is true that the area is pretty safe. I will say the business district on the other side of the train station is much better, more serene, and friendly. The room:The hotel room was small and was dirty. We booked a double-bed room for our last night in Tokyo. (We did stay at the Hyatt Tokyo our first 3 days and then went to Kyoto for a few days and this was our last stop.) The bed was against a wall which was ok however, there were liquid marks on the wallpaper close to where your head hits the pillow which was kind of gross. Second, the carpet was dirty and the showerhead in the bathroom had black mold on the head. The room also smelled very heavily of smoke and we were in what was a non-smoking area. The room is very small if you book a standard. Both of use barely had room to move and there was limited room for our suitcases. If you are use to traveling to Europe, this may not bother you as much. Overall, I rated this room a 2 based on the fact it isn't a true 4 star property and the reviews are a little misleading as to what you get. This is purely based on our stay and our experience. This may be a good choice for you but do your research first before booking.

We had a Studio Deluxe Double overlooking the Golden Gai and found the room tighter than normal western standards, but comfortable to use a base for exploring. Location is great with plenty to do, see, eat and drink within the precinct and not that far from the train/subway station to get to the rest of Tokyo. There is a convenience store at the ground floor for additional convenience alsoThe only thing that we found a little weird was the bed on one side next to the wall, but we where able to adjust to it without any issues, but this is just Tokyo. Bathroom was roomy and had everything required.

I have stayed at the nearby other Citadines and thought I would try this one. Reasonably sized rooms and great reception staff, this location is central to everything. Very close to the subway, very very close to a hundred bars in Golden Gai. Walk out the back to the bars or across the street to a myriad of eateries and entertainment. 5 minutes walk to great shopping. My only negative comment, typical very hard Japanese pillows. Have found that in a number of places. Had a great stay.

Located away from the hectic hustle and bustle around Shinjuku station in a much quieter area, I found this hotel to be about a 4 minute walk to the closest subway station. On the way you pass by many bars and dining places with several convenience stores close by.The hotel service was excellent with very friendly and efficient staff. The breakfast was filling and a fine way to start the day exporing Tokyo.

I chose this hotel based on the convenient location to the Shinjuku, it was easy to get to other areas of Tokyo and to take the train back to the airport. We had a very comfortable stay and the housekeeping return the room to brand new every morning. Great location if you want to enjoy the nightlife and shopping nearby.

We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights and we found the room far too small for two people. The bathroom was tiny making it impossible to go to the toilet without having to do yoga just to close the door.

My partner and I stayed at Citadines Central during the first and last leg of our trip. The hotel is only about a 10 minute walk from Shinjuku station and the staff are super friendly and accomodating. We stayed in a studio room which was big enough for the both of us and was also very well kept and provided all the amenities we needed. I highly rate the location as Shinjuku is a central station to get to wherever you need in Tokyo! There are also tons of places nearby the hotel such as Golden Gai, Piss Alley and Robot Restaurant which will keep you entertained. I'd definately stay here again next time I'm in Tokyo!

Everything is GREAT! good location with lots of restaurants surrounded. Members of the hotel group are able to get late check out which is a PLUS! Room is consider quite reasonable spacious as compare to other hotels.

Stayed 3 nights at this hotel. Location- Very convenient and central to Shinkunju. Close to lots and lots of restaurants and bars( Golden Gai, Robot restaurants). 10 mins walk to train station.Front Desk- Very professional, helpful and adequate level of English. Room: Small, very clean with lots of amenities but pillows hard as a big rock.Value for money: Definitely..

We stayed four nights here in late August. The best reason to stay at this hotel, bar none, is the location. It's just steps from some awesome spots like Golden Gai and Kabukicho, which are some of the most fun places for touristy nightlife.It's also maybe a 10 minute walk from Shinjuku station. Be forewarned! It's pretty easy to get lost coming from the airport. Shinjuku is the busiest train station in the world, and accordingly there are several exits that will put you farther from the hotel than you want to be.But in any case.... the room was small, but about right for Tokyo. The bathrooms were clean and on the larger side. View was nothing to write home about. Staff super friendly and helpful. And the breakfast buffet had a nice mix of Japanese and Western food to suit any pallet.Oh, and don't forget the all-important Lawson's located right downstairs for all of your snack/ATM/adult beverage needs.
user_name:
chesterworks
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The hotel is located in the absolute center of Shinjuku. Across the street you have the Golden Gai with wonderfull restaurants, 5 minute walk away the subway that connects to any place in Tokyo, 10 minute walk away all the shops with shopping for any interest. Highly recommended hotel with the perfect location. The rooms were clean and the size adequate considering the location. Service-minded staff available 24 hours and very helpful. Book this hotel, get a subway card at the airport, buy internet access for you stay and I promise you'll fall in love with Tokyo like I did.

our room was very clean and tidy bathroom was very small.but most places I believe are small in japan.the tea and coffee were good the bed was very comfy . the shower and all the toiletries were really very good.Basic breakfast was downstairs in the small cafe area . it had what you needed for -breakfast. there is a 7-11 close buy that sells the most amazing green tea ice cream and snacks. the staff were friendly.and politethe only downside was our room was close to elevators  a little noise but not for too long.Very good.

We're here for 7 nights to have our anniversary vacation in Tokyo and today is the 4th day of staying here in room 718. Location is great as it's near to metro station and dining areas. There is also one convenience store on the ground floor. Receptionists are mostly friendly. Housekeeping make up room cut off time is at 3pm, which is weird. Also, housekeeping is not available at night time. There is a currency exchange machine at lobby and self laundry service at 7th floor which are very convenient for tourists. However, the housekeeping is terrible. Out of four days here, bathrobes are not replaced for two days. As for today, our room key was taken away from the key card holder. We have no ideas who was the one and why it happened. My partner is working during the trip and there are alot of confidential documents in the room. We just feel very insecure when it happened. Furthermore, we were charging our work devices' battery when we were away from the room and it wasn't charged at all due to the key card was taken away. It indirectly affected the work and caused some delays on it.

My partner and I stayed for our first 2 nights in Tokyo. Short walk from the main Shinjuku station, great location close to the hustle and bustle of Shinjuku. Plenty of bars, dining options and attractions nearby if you're not looking at wandering too far or taking a train to a different location. Convenient store located on the ground floor as well with ATM if you need it.

Good position and staff very kind. Room small but very nice. The staff is kind and does everything possible to help you. Many options for breakfast and all the food was tasty and fresh. A nice option for staying in Tokyo.

We stayed for two weeks in this holiday receiving excellent service from all the staff including reception, the restaurant and cleaners. On a number of occasions we needed help and information and they would go beyond what we are used to in order to help us. They always had a smile. The food for breakfast and lunch was also good.The hotel is close to Shinjuku Station and there is a grocery store next door.

We had a great 6 nights here in August. The staff cannot do enough to help you and are all so friendly it makes you feel very wanted. Rooms are small, but that is no different to any big city anywhere in the world unless you pay a huge premium. We were not in Tokyo to sit in our hotel, so was no big deal for us. Laundry facilites are great (can get very busy at times). Rooms exceptionally clean ad tidy and very good showers. Here you are at the heart of Shinjuku, various station entrances between 5-10 mins away, right next tothe Golden Gai (worth a an hour or two of an evening at least), Memory Lane (better known as something else, easy to check) a few mins away. The heart of Shinjuku a few mins walk. When we come back to Tokyo, this will be our first choice of places to stay.

The hotels amenities and the size of the room is much bigger than I expected. The staff are incredibly friendly and helpful. The bathroom was a good size and very clean. The breakfast is average, I would recommend you venture out to one of the stores nearby instead. This hotel is about a 10 minute walk from the station and fairly easy to find. The best part about it is the location, however the only negative is that there are African men along the street that do try to talk to you, they ask where your staying, for a kiss or if you’d like to go to a club and this was a regular occurrence every night. You can ignore them and they usually leave you alone.That being said, we never felt unsafe as two young females in Shinjuku or any other part of Tokyo. I wouldn’t recommend this location for families, but for young travellers in their 20’s this is a great hotel in a busy and entertaining location - lots of arcades, restaurants and shopping malls close by. The 7/11 and Lawson’s next door are definitely handy. I would definitely stay here again and will recommend this hotel to anyone looking for great value for money.

We had a lovely stay at citadines. staff were very friendly and nothing was too much trouble. Walking distance to shopping and train . Very clean rooms. Convenience store located just under apartments, also ramen restaurent.

Very good hotel in the center of Shinjuku.Good cleaning, beautiful rooms and very kind personnel.Located in a perfect place to see Shinjuku and Tokyo in general.Just 10 minutes from the station.Good choice for everyone

My stay here was good. Good location and friendly staffs. About 10 min away from the metro lines and central city and good night life. Rooms are clean and space is ok for Japan standards. Very comfortable and price is good!

This hotel is in a great location (don't be concerned that it is in the red light district). A short 10 minute walk from Shinjuku station. The staff are lovely and very helpful.There is also a 24 hour convenience store downstairs from the hotel, which is good when you get peckish. However the bed in the double room was very hard as well as the pillows and was pushed up against the side wall so only one of us could get in/out easily.

Our first impressions weren't great the hotel is located in the local red light district, however this is easily brushed off as it connects the Shinjuku's Main Street in 40 seconds. However, we arrived and our air con was broken despite staff telling us it wasn't. We arrived at 3 am and were shattered this was stressful to deal with, eventually we were moved to a room with air-con. The rooms are nice they are basic, and very very small, but this is typical Japanese Standard. I would stay here again purely for the central location. However service could be slightly better, it didn't;t seem to meet Japanese Standards.

Staff were polite and very helpful with translating for us. Room was spacious for Japan, clean and comfortable. The wifi was a little slow but still loaded Netflix for us. The hotel is about a 10 minute walk from the station. It is very difficult to find the right exit in Shinjuku station to be near the hotel. It's a block away from the Robot Restaurant and Godzilla. Plenty of restaurants around but vegetarians will find it difficult.

We stayed here for four nights and found the hotel to be very comfortable. Room was clean and quiet, although a little small it was adequate. All the staff were very helpful and friendly. Breakfast was very good with plenty of choice. The hotel is located in a busy area with plenty of night life and bars. It is about 10 mins walk to the railway station giving easy access to the rest of Tokyo and the surrounding area. Would be happy to stay here again.

The location is fantastic, it’s right next door to the Golden Gai and Shinjuku nightlife. Having said that, it’s very quiet - you cannot hear the street from the room, and the hotel is very clean. ..I will remember this hotel for next time I’m in Tokyo, and would definitely recommend this to someone!

As many reviewers have noted, the rooms are quite tiny. This is our second trip to Japan and the first time we stayed at the other Citadines in Shinjuku which was not as central but the rooms were a tad bigger and more comfortable. I wouldn't spend the extra money on the Studio Deluxe Double as that's what we did and got a tiny room on the 7th floor. Literally only one big suitcase can fit in the room. The room itself was clean but the mattress is uncomfortable. Clean bathroom with all the amenities. Definitely need more English channels on the tv. Can't beat the location though!!

Recently stayed here for 3 nights with my wife on a anniversary trip and i have to stay that the staff,hotel and breakfast were fantastic and would recommend it to anyone.i will be travelling to tokyo again and will be using this hotel again.

Stayed at Central Citadines for the second time. The staff are very friendly and nice - with excellent English. Check-in and check-out very easy. The rooms are decent sized for Japan standards. The hotel has a self-service laundry which is easy to use. If you need adapters, just request when checking in. You will need to place down a deposit and will get it back when checking out. Close to convenient stores. We enjoyed our stay for the second time round as much as the first. Simple and clean. Close access to stations. Would happily stay here again and recommend to friends.

Location is good, it has 24 hrs open convenience store on ground level. Close to exit from underground shopping area, which leads you to Shinjuku station. This hotel looks newly renovated. Outlook, interior and facility are all fine except mattress. Mattress spring is very soft and seems to be quite cheep. If you have backache or need proper mattress for good sleep, be careful before booking. For me, I had trouble with my back when I woke up.

We picked this hotel based on other good reviews and the location. The Golden Gai district can be seen from the back of the apartments, just a short stroll away. Yet the location of the hotel was very quiet. It is within an easy walk to the Shinjuku train station, even with luggage. There are a lot of restaurants and bars close by, although they are more expensive than others in other areas of Tokyo. The area itself can be a bit seedy at night & considering the age of most people in the streets, would definitely recommend to stay here if you’re younger. Being in our early 50’s...we’ve been there, done that, so probably wouldn’t pick this area again. The hotel didn’t disappoint.

We visited in June 2018. The staff in this hotel were outstanding. A couple of examples:1. My wife needed seek medical attention 2am. The staff at the hotel rang a Hospital and advised them we were coming. They then got a Taxi to take us there, The staff at the Hospital were fabulous (and inexpensive)2. When we needed to get a Taxi to the Bus Station and a Taxi refused to take us a man on the front desk came down to help. As Taxis were scarce he dragged my wife's bags up to a main road, got us a cab, and instructed the taxi where to go.Breakfast is inexpensive and has a great selection.These things among others made our stay so pleasant.The rooms may be a bit small for some but we found them more than adequateStay at This Hotel!!!!

Did plenty of research before venturing to Tokyo for the first time, Citadines ticked all the boxes on paper and did not disappoint in person. When we arrived we were greeted by very friendly staff, spoke English well (made it easier for us which was much appreciated), very smooth check-in process. Really nice, clean room, of course it's a little bit on the small side, but that's pretty standard. I was actually pleasantly surprised considering what I'd heard about the size of hotel rooms in Japan. The bathroom had plenty of space for what you need, was very nice and had a little clothesline if needed. Was all very well appointed in the room. The hotel itself is nice and modern with a long dining area for the buffet breakfast and a view out onto the street below. A variety of Western style and Japanese options available at the buffet. All the staff were so helpful and friendly no matter what you were after.The hotel is located in a bit of a busy area, which is great, so many things to see and do right out the door. The famed Robot Restaurant is just around the corner, as is the Samurai Museum which is well worth a visit. It is considered to be in the Red Light District, but it does not feel suss at all, you don't feel unsafe and nothing raunchy is shoved in your face whatsoever. It really just makes for a buzzing atmosphere. Close to a couple of different train stations too. There's also a convenience store, Lawson, below the hotel which is great for snacks, drinks and even proper meals, especially when you've had a long day.Would HAPPILY stay here again.

we booked 2 rooms for a family with two teenagers.Likes1. Great Location! Right in the heart of Kabukicho, Shinjuku.10m to Golden Gai. 200m to Isetan Shinjuku and the subway 500m to Shinjuku Central station2. Reasonable price. Paid JPY13000 each room.3. Great food and bars all around the hotel. Lawsons just downstairs. But hotel provides toiletries/ amenities on teh front desk. There is a laundry room. Dislikes1. Bed sizeIt is a double bed, which is smaller than a Queen. It must be 4' wide (140cm). There is a small 2 seater sofa & a desk. 2. No connecting or adjoining room.probably the only dislikes given the reasonable price and location.

This was booked due to laundry on site. When you travel a lot, this is a plus. The location is convenient (about 10 minutes walk to a subway stations). Lots of shops around and restaurants not far. The staff is very nice and helpful. However, we had some very inconsiderate neighbors on the floor who were yelling at 1 am and another had a crying baby all night. When I spoke up, the hotel moved me to another floor, acknowledging that the group was noisy. The room has most what you need and is compact (as with most places in Japan). Good for families.

We booked this hotel based on the pictures they have on Expedia and once we got to our room it was very small and nothing like the picture. Our mistake for not reading a full description of the room. The room was small but it had everything that we could possibly need. We were surrounded by restaurants and mini mark next to it. Very convenient! Downside, they are a few places around the hotel promoting show girls... the problem is the “pimp” guys. They are loud!!! I could hear them all they way to our room at 6am in the morning. However, I would still stay at this hotel. Great deal and location for the price.

My family and I recently had a holiday in Tokyo. We had originally booked into an AirBnB apartment that has a nice view of Mt Fuji. Unfortunately, there was a clamp down on AirBnB wef 15 Jun.. Although our booking was for a period prior to 15 Jun, we were unable to contact the Host for almost 24 hours. We tried getting AirBnB to contact to confirm that we would still have a place to stay in upon arrival. Up to the day we were supposed to take off, we rec'd no response from the host. IMagine our anxiety. AirBnB was very helpful and wanted to replace with another apartment. Unfortunately, most host had delisted their apartments and the few left did not have good reviews. Thus, AirBnB agreed to give us a full refund. With little hours before take off, we randomly booked a hotel in Shinjuku. This was the Citadines Central Shinjuku.The trip from Narita airport to the hotel was quite smooth. It was about a 10 mins walk from the JR station to the hotel, with luggage. Wasn't too difficult to find with a GPS on hand. We were pleasantly greeted by the hotel staff. The male staff was very helpful and polite. We asked for a late check-out 6 days later and he advised that we signed up for a online member and could then check out at 2pm. We did that over the counter. The whole check in process was very pleasant and welcoming. Although the official check in time was 4pm, the room was available for us at 1pm. It was a relief after a tiring flight where a couple of kids cried throughout the night onboard the flight. Breakfast was simple but sufficient. There was a variety and even and omelette station. Selection of bread and juices were good though I wish the breakfast could start earlier instead of at 7am. There were 2 days where we were rushing for an early train ride to Kyoto and Osaka and couldn't have breakfast.The lobby is on the 3rd floor. Take the lift up is the easiest if you have luggages with you.Just on the ground floor, there is Lawsons, selling nice rice balls, drinks and cup noodles. Just a few steps away, you will find 711, where there is a wider selection of bentos, ready to cook meals and fabulous rice balls. At the corner of the street, there is donut cafe if you need a quick bite. The hotel is situated near uniqlo, isetan and shops where you could get your duty free cosmestics...like watsons. A very convenient place indeed.Room was cozy and very clean. Housekeeping everday and they have a laundry area if you need to wash and dry your clothes (7th floor). Room was a bit small but sufficient for 2 luggages. Most importantly was, it was very clean and everything you need can be found either in the room or the bathroom eg. toileteries, towels.Though the hotel is situated in Shinjuku, it is relatively safe to walk the streets at night. Though there were 'bouncers' situated outside some joints, they usually don't harress you if you are in a group or with a partner. Overall a very pleasant stay. Wish it was nearer to the JR station but no complains. Service is good, rooms are clean and eateries/shopping are just around the corner.

Close to either train station, Shinjuku or Shinjuku Sanchome this hotel is in a great location! Approx 5 min walk to the robot restaurant or Samurai museum as well. Our stay was comfortable and staff were generally helpful! A small supermarket at the bottom of the hotel too!

Have the same good experience as last stay but studio double room is a bit small for 2 adults. Amenities are appropriate and thoughtfully provided. My favourite is the kettle which makes it easy to consume hot water when needed.

We stayed here for 4 nights in all at the start and then again at the end of our trip. The room was overall comfortable , clean and fresh. It was quiet so we slept well. However with the couch and desk in the compact rooms they felt a little cramped at times. OK for a couple of nights. We enjoyed the buffet breakfasts in a very pleasant dining room. Easy walk to the station and restaurants etc.

My husband and I stayed here recently for 5 nights. This was our first time in Japan and to be honest we really liked the location of this hotel. It was central to absolute everything: shopping, station, food and parks. Pros: Good location Good value for money Breakfast is only $15AUDpp if you wish to pay at the property and it’s pretty good Check in was at 3pm but we arrived at 7am, they had no rooms available for us to pay for to get earlier however did what they could to get us in the next room (not until midday) but we didn’t have to pay the extra Bathroom modern Local family mart under resort Cons: 2 x English TV channels (CNN and discovery) all others in Japanese No gymRoom was extremely small, with the amount of luggage we had we had minimal room to move however this is the normal in Japan. Overall I would recommend this place, it is in the red light district however we had no issues what so ever with anyone.

Stayed here for 2 nights at the start of our mammoth 10 day tour of Japan. This hotel was about a 5-10 minute walk from Shinjuku Station positioned near many places to eat. It was also about a 15 minute walk away from Shinjuku Gyoen and 45 minutes walk to Shibuya. The hotel itself was fairly clean with decent furnishings and there is a 7 eleven literally next door. It can be a bit noisy at night because of its location but that didn’t bother us. We didn’t use the hotel restaurant for breakfast but we did eat at the udon restaurant on the floor below reception and it was one of our favourite meals during our stay so I would recommend eating there. Overall we were happy with everything, nothing to complain about and the location is very good but perhaps a few extra amenities such as a gym would have been great.

This is our second visit to Tokyo and also our second stay at Citadines Central Shinjuku Hotel. This hotel has become our default hotel in Tokyo mainly because of the location and it's good value for money. Service is good. Staffs were courteous and respectful and they speak good English. I will definitely book this hotel again in my next visit to Tokyo.

Good hotel in the heart of Shinjuku. Only a 5 - 10 minute walk from the main station. Rooms are well equipped and slightly larger than the average hotel room in Tokyo. Staff were very friendly. I would stay again.

The location is excellent, 7 minutes walking distance from the station. The service is very efficient - Japanese style. The twin room was US standard in terms of dimensions, the bathroom was large, with hot tub and shower together. The beds were comfortable and the A/C worked properly. Nothing wrong at all. We didn't try the breakfast, but it looked correct and not very pricy ($12).It is very recommendable. We were there on Friday/Saturday and it cost around $200 each.

Hotel the location is very convenient. Very close to all the restaurants and JR station. The room very clean, all the staffs are polit. Only problem is the WiFi very slow. I only can use my own data plan.

- ease of access- shopping and food area around the hotel however, it can get quite rowdy during the night time because it is near the red light districts. - May not be so suitable for family with young children

A bit of a struggle to get suitcases from nearest station but it wasn't too far away. Check-in was efficient and received an upgrade so first impression was very good. Room was spacious and the large deep bath was great. Laundry facilities - coin operated washing machines and dryers - were appreciated especially after a week of travel. The area is a little rough but we (females) never felt unsafe even returning late at night and security at the apartments was good. Convenience store next door was, dare I say, very convenient for snacks and quick meals.

For the most part I enjoyed the hotel. It's definitely an older hotel and it shows in the carpet but the rooms were nice. Checking in you have to go to the third floor of the building, there is an elevator and stairs that will get you there. Exiting the hotel you have to take the elevator from the third floor to the first. I had no problem checking in or out as all of the desk personnel spoke English and explained everything thoroughly. As far as the room, it was a decent size for one person but as other guests have mentioned the size is small by American standards. I kept my suitcase on the couch so it wasn't in the way. The only things lacking were the T.V. and mini-fridge. The channels on the T.V. weren't really an assortment of things to watch and the only English speaking channels were news and discovery channel. I didn't spend much time in the room but it would've been nice to watch something interesting on the evening it rained or while settling in for the night. The mini-fridge also didn't seem to get cold at all. The bathroom did it's job completely and I had no issues with it. Every once in a while I'd get whiffs of cigarette smoke out the a/c vent from another room in the hotel but it wasn't enough to really inconvenience me.The location is perfect if planning on going to the Golden Gai and it's right on the edge of the red light district and the train station is about a 10 minute walk away.

My husband and I had a great stay here. Well sized rooms for Tokyo, and they provide most of the toiletries you will need including fresh slippers and Japanese night gowns every night! Everything was so clean, and they cleaned our room thoroughly every day. Location was also great for walking around, and was close to everything including transit stations. We tried the breakfast buffet one morning of our stay, which was quite good —- lots of variety for all with a mix of western style foods and Japanese breakfast foods.
