During our stay, our shower tube popped off late at night but the front desk was very quick in having someone fix it first thing in the morning. They also offered a change of rooms if we wanted, but for us it was just easier to stay put (we had already finished showering for the day).Also the beds are a little firm, not the comfiest. But I was so tired at the end of the day that I could have fallen asleep on anything. Overall it was a great stay!

Stayed 4 nights in this hotel. Our room was large. Bigger than I expected. Included a couch, fridge, and a hot plate . A mini kitchen . The bathroom was small but clean . Beds low to the ground . The reception staff were very friendly and helpful . Good location . It included a small gym/work out area and laundry . It is near restaurants. Close to a 7 eleven. Very quiet.

The location was central to shopping locations, food and the train station in Shinjuku. Staff were friendly and efficient, spoke english, I would definitely stay here when visiting Tokyo in the future. Very happy to recommend. When you walk out the front, turn right so your walking behind the building (the opposite way from the street) and you will find yourself in old Japan.

This was our kick-off hotel for a trek around Japan and it was a great starting point. A 10 min walk to the nearest station is handy. Small rooms but comfortable bed. L (one side against the wall). Decent bathroom, good toiletries. Location is great for exploring and being in the thick of it. Would definitely stay here again. Wifi not great.

We stayed in this hotel six years ago (when it belonged to Best Western) and decided to stay there again because of the good location in Shinjuku (walking distance to train/metro station and Airport Limousine bus stop, next door to Golden Gai). It's still an excellent choice. Hotel rooms tend to be very small in Japan, especially at this price, but this one is large enough for two people to put their suitcases and move around without bumping into each other. The staff are very friendly and speak English well. We decided on breakfast for one morning because of a special offer: the buffet offers a good selection, incl. fresh made-to-order omelettes.

Quite a walk from Shinjuku station if u are lugging luggages around. A lawson covenient store right downstairs. Restaurants n many food eateries nearby.Room is decent and clean.Staff is very friendly. Overall a pleasant trip & experience! =)

Stayed in this hotel for 4 nights, rooms were nice and compact and very clean. Bath and shower facilities which were great, shower gel, shampoo and conditioner provided as well as toothbrushes and toothpaste. Heated toilet seat in typical Japanese fashion. Rooms come with a kitchen area microwave iron kettle toaster and hairdryer. Nice and stylish hotel

My partner and I came from Australia on our first trip ever to Japan. Once we arrived we were welcomed by very friendly and customer service orientated staff who were prompt to take our bags and check us in. We arrived quite early before the usual 14:00 check in time, there was no issue what soever with the language barrier. Once they we're able to find a room, they were quick to accommodate us.Breakfast was served daily, no complaints here as it is a standard buffet breakfast with coffee, tea and juices. The floor staff were very efficient when it came to clearing tables and providing fresh new food for the guests. Overall, the Citadines was a very good stay and I would highly recommend it for any young couple or family traveling to Japan for the first time as you have the beautiful vibrant city of Shinjuku and your door step, along with Japans superb subway system. Cheers!
user_name:
aarone561
Canberra, Australian Capital Territory, Australia

review_body: Location is fantastic! Out of our room window we over looked Golden Gai. Litteraly a 30 second stumble home from the small amazing bars. Less than a 10 minute walk to Shinjuku east side entrance through the main drag of shinjuku which never gets old. Or 2 min walk from exit 15?? I think which is an underground entrance to Shinjuku station.Rooms small but modern and clean. I sorely miss the heated toilet seat and the water jet that cleans your bum after you have finished your business. Staff had the best level of English of any establishment I entered in Japan for my entire stay and seemed happy to help. Ridiculous amount of places to eat, things to do and stuff to see all within a 30 second walk from hotel.The pillows are AWFUL not really something I usually comment on but they where like little bean bags filled with little balls and not a nice fluffy pillow you would expect. I know that's picky but it did disturb my sleep on numerous occasions.One thing that is not the hotels fault and please don't let this put you off but lots of African fellas line the street it's located on asking if I wanted to go to see some girls. It got funny actually as I would play a little game. I would walk 10 foot or so in front of my girlfriend and let them approach me for her to then catch up and see their faces! One was cheeky enough to say to me ahh how about just a little dance then once they spied my girlfriend!If you want to be in the centre of the action in a good place from the station then this is your best bet in Tokyo. Would happily stay here again and again and again.

Service and language ability( English) was comparable to other 5 star establishments like Hyatt. Staff was automatically inclined to help with packages coming from delivery service like Ta Q bin and allowed storage of baggage prior to arrival.Night shift staff was such a darling when he went out of his desk to physically help push the trolley after seeing a a female traveller had to load own belongings and cargo ( food ingredients related to work), Staff even delivered the trolley with a smile right to the room.Special shout out to the spectacle male staff name that starts with an E.Also the another night male staff who recommended a great salon just nearby almost in time for a great look for an important dinner.The ladies during day shift were just as good speaking clearly and smiling and greeting everyone .Having a great team simply meant that the management practice and enforce it down the line. And Well done keep it up.So Management and Staff can work as a team and offer this wonderful experience to the guests.Some reviewers mentioned that some were treated with priority and others not. I disagree on that cos Im Asian and my friends were American and French and were treated equally well. I guess we all just have to be nice and friendly and ask for assistance when we need.It was raining and umbrellas ( with a smile) can be had but please return them once you return so others can borrow it too.Yes location is along the happening stretch of night entertainment. But it's a great location near subways and 17 minutes to the bus terminals that connects cities and everything else is walkable ...especially shopping,sight seeing eating.I would recommend this aparthotel.I would have stayed more than the 2 nights if time had permitted.

Location is fantastic! It's in the middle of Shinjuku, right next to Golden Gai and close to the metro. The staff was friendly and the rooms were very clean and spacious! it was such a breath of fresh air to have a room where we could actually open both of our suitcases! The only issue I had was that the pillow was extremely uncomfortable and too hard and grainy.The breakfast was also good - there's a mixture of western and Japanese breakfast so there's something for everyone.

Although the rooms are tiny they are certainly adequate. Comfortable beds. Clean. Small bathrooms. Excellent service from the front desk - special thanks to the delightful Lee who went out of her way to look after us when we arrived tired and grumpy after a very long flight

Generally, the hotel is situated in somewhat a "redlight" district but not sure if it is. Had lots of massage parlours and karaoke bars around the area and gets too noisy even at 4 a.m. Not suitable for middle aged couple but I think would be perfect for single, adventurous people. They had free breakfast which was okay, we tried it once but decided to have breakfast at different places during out entire stay in Tokyo. It was a bit of a walking distance to the train station as well but I didn't mind the walking as walking is better as you tend to discover interesting stuff in odd corners when travelling to new places. The room we were in was a bit tiny but I have been told that most hotels in Japan have tiny rooms anyway. Interestingly, we were in another hotel after this one (which did not differ much in price) but the room was spacious in that other hotel. The bed was against the wall so one of us (who was sleeping on the side against the wall) had to crawl to the end of the bed if you want to use the toilet in the middle of the night. Service was so-so, I felt a subtle discrimination (Asian but not Japanese) when I would ask something from the reception (they sort of ignored me initially everytime) but they were pretty quick to talk with my husband (European). The husband who would just wait for me at a distance would notice that I get ignored and would often step in. Overall, will not stay there again as because the noise only seems to subside after 4 in the morning. The streets in the morning also gets a little messy and entertainingly you get to see a couple of young people walking around the area that looked like they just finished partying (oh to be young again lol).

Our bedroom wall was delightfully placed the other side of the coin laundry so it was a pleasure to go to sleep listening to the thud of a washer dryer. Toilet seat wonky, bathroom door didn’t close and the fridge didn’t work. In fairness when I complained they said we could move room, but it was nearly 11pm and we were in bed, our suitcases and contents scattered everywhere, so we declined spending an hour dressing, packing, unpacking...etc. On the good side, the room was cleaned very well and a chap on the reception was very sweet. They must know this room is a curse so feel a little put out they would even try to get away with it. We didn’t get an apology. Our ONLY bad experience in Japan travels.

Have been staying at this hotel for a number of years since it was a Best Western. The location is excellent and the hotel is clean and comfortable with helpful and friendly staff. Our only criticism on this occasion was the mattress on our bed, which was probably the firmest mattress I've ever slept on. Usually I can sleep absolutely anywhere, but this one beat even me! Haven't had this issue at this hotel before so perhaps it was just this particular room or maybe the beds have recently been changed, but something to bear in mind if hard mattresses bother you. Everything else was ideal.

This hotel is in the best location possible for Shinjuku - near the best food/bars, close to the station etc. And walking distance to everywhere you'd need. Hotel itself has small but functional rooms, friendly staff and great service. Free booties of water each day and a small fridge in the room (ours wasn't much cooler than the room though). There is a restaurant/breakfast but we didn't use, looked like topical western food. Situated above a Lawson shop for good breakfast options anyway.

Closest station is the Shinjuku sanchrome.Will stay at this hotel again if Shinjuku is where we want to be .Room is small expected for Japan hotels. Everything you need is within reach. Efficient staff. Our 4day stay went smoothly.

Although on the edge of the bustling night entertainment district, it is a quiet sanctuary. Clean, spacious for Japan and fully serviced. No problems at all. It is a 10 minute walk to the subway, which again was clean and not as busy as we expected, most commuters use the main Shinjuku station so the nearest one is less busy, we were able to work things out easily as everything is in English. If you’re coming to Tokyo and don’t want to be fully down town or midtown, Shinjuku is ideal giving the best if both worlds. Only warning I would give, is that smoking is still allowed in restaurants and bars, although this is slowly changing. So be prepared for that cloying smokey smell when you leave a restaurant.

Staff was amazing! They helped to get us a reservation at a very popular exclusive Kaiseki restaurant. They also helped recieve out pocket Wi-Fi before our arrival so that we would be able to pick it up as soon as we flew into tokyo. Location was wonderful as well! 3 min walk from golden gai area and close to a lot of other popular attractions. Overall great stay!

Location is fine,but it's nightstop area at Shinjuku . Lucky that ,other residents there is standard. Rooms' photo from website looks bigger then actual .Bed is too soft to sleep well.Not any special for this stay.

Tucked between the raucous golden gai and red light districts, Citadines provides a first class experience amid the “festive” mood of the neighborhood. Catering mostly to a western clientele, all staff speak English and the included breakfast buffet sides with familiar fare. Just a 10 minute walk from shinjuku station, it’s a very good location to launch sightseeing journeys of east Tokyo. Also, since the Narita Express services shinjuku station, it’s a natural option for first or last stays upon Japan arrival or before heading home. Rooms are quiet, modern and comfortable.

I appreciate the you allowed us stay in the room until 14:00 and the fact that you helped us to print the documents. It was very helpful. The things we did not like is the overall aspect of the room and the toilet which clogged up a few times. We have been to 2 hotels with only 3 stars in Japan(one in Ginza and one in Osaka) before our stay to Citadines and I can tell you honestly that they are better then Citadines which is 4 stars and they are half the price.

spacious room with well equipped kitchen and close to the stunning Shinjuku Japanese gardens and the hectic Shuinjuku rail/metro station. Airport bus station at Shinjuku is about a 1000 (10 min) yen taxi away; buses to airport are frequent. Wonderful helpful staff.

I should really be writing two reviews for Citadines Central. That’s because we stayed here twice: 5 nights and then 3 nights with a week in between.The things is... we had a ‘Deluxe Double’ the first time we were here and by accident, a ‘Standard Double’ the second time, which we much preferred.To explain...The floor space is the same, but because the ‘Deluxe’ has an upgraded and separate shower recess (not over the bath) the bathroom space eats into the bedroom. Result: the bedroom in the ‘Deluxe’ is about 800 mil shorter than in the ‘standard’ and when the room is a compact size to begin with (as Japanese hotel rooms tend to be) you really feel the difference. The ‘standard’ room has an expanded desk and bedside table - and hence more ‘livable’ space. I guess it’s a matter of personal choice: modern shower or more space.In all other regards, it’s hard to fault Citadines Central. The location is superb. Right in the heart of Shinjuku... eateries and department stores all around - and about 8 mins walk to the massive Shinjuku station.The staff are very obliging and the housekeeping standards are first rate. There’s a guest laundry on the 7th floor (coin in the slot) and they offer a pretty good breakfast for about 1300 yen. Rooms are also stocked with quality toiletries, bath robes, coffee and tea, and a small fridge. I recommend a high floor with a city view, as opposed to Shinjuku street view.

This hotel was very close to the Shinjuku train station. It was exactly what we needed and a great value. I would definitely stay here again. Reccemend for anyone looking for a comfortable stay in Shinjuku.

Just like its name implies, Citadines Central Shinjuku is in fact very central and walking distance to everything! After doing extensive research on hotels, I chose this hotel for our last 2 nights in Tokyo. It is about a 10 minute walk from the JR station which wasn't a problem at all even with all of our luggages. I booked through Hotels.com and paid $400 for a total of 2 nights which isn't bad considering we went during cherry blossoms. There are laundry machines, breakfast buffet, and I believe a gym at this hotel. There is a Lawson located right below the hotel which is so convenient for any basic needs.There is a big Citadines sign that you won't miss from the street. From there you will take an elevator up to the 3rd floor for the hotel lobby. Upon arrival,we were warmly greeted by the staff. I had requested to get a room on a higher floor when I made the reservations. They happily accommodated us! I believe we were 12th floor. We never felt unsafe even though our hotel is located right by Golden Gai and because our room was located so high up we barely heard any of the noises. On our last day the hotel happily stored our luggages even after we've checked out so we could explore the city for a couple more hours before our flight.Our deluxe double room, while small compared by Western standards, is normal for Japanese standards and actually perfect for both my boyfriend and I. I'm a fan of the bathroom which was bigger than I expected. The room is also extremely CLEAN! Housekeeping does an excellent job daily. 2 water bottles are restocked daily. I would definitely recommend this hotel!

Great location. Value for money. Helpful and friendly staff. We had a double room and it was adequate but this was our first trip to Japan, I have since learnt the rooms are small but I don’t understand why you would push the double bed up against the wall. Making it difficult for one person to get in.

We stayed 4 nights at this perfectly located hotel in Tokyo. Not far from a wonderfull park with lots of blooming cherry trees. Close to a huge train station. And (if interested) at the edge of Red light district ;-) ).Very kind and helpfull staff

Convenient location to transport and many eateries, friendly staff, clean rooms. For the high season, the price was reasonable compared to other surrounding hotels. This was our second stay and we would return in the future.

This is a lovely convenient hotel for lots of local attractions and transport links. The rooms aren’t huge and maybe a little tired, but I never spend a huge amount of time in a hotel room.There are loads of bars restaurants and mini markets nearby as well as shops.The staff at the hotel were mostly brilliant. One guy helped with a problem but was grumpy doing it.The breakfast was good and there was a discounted rate on arrival. The bathroom was clean- always a hit with me.The hotel was quiet too and no smoking. I would recommend this hotel.

This is a very central hotel in the Shinjuku district so you are right in the middle of the action. The hotel is right next to the Golden Gai bar area if that is your thing but also infinitely many other bars and restaurants. It is also walkable to the Shinjuku Goen park area.Rooms are small and functional. Only one of you has side access to the bed - the other will have to climb to the end or over their partner. Staff are helpful and spoke reasonable English. The hotel has a restaurant serving buffet breakfast and lunch.A good choice on a budget.

My wife and I stayed here for a week in April and we could not have been happier with the hotel. The rooms are not huge and it is a standard hotel, but it was excellent. The rooms are spotless and had everything we needed (including a laundry on the 7th floor), with a great view of Shinjuku. The staff are very polite, friendly and helpful. For the price this is an amazing hotel and it’s location could not be better, right in the heart of Shinjuku, with its shops, neon and nightlife. Only a couple of blocks from Shinjuku Station (which is mayhem) and the metro to reach anywhere in Tokyo. We would certainly stay here again and will be sorry to leave. Cheers Citadines.

The location was central to shopping locations, food and the train station in Shinjuku. Staff were friendly and efficient. I would definitely stay here when visiting Tokyo in the future. Happy to recommend.

Overall a very satisfactory stay. Location is the best part. Close to Shinjuku station and in walking distance to the park and the party zone - Golden gai is literally right behind the hotel. Easy to get to other parts of the city and their main attractions. Our room was clean and reasonable size (for Tokyo). Oh and silent! Which is important in this part of town! We didnt choose the morning buffet, opting to eat out while exploring. Can very much recommend.

This hotel is situated near Golden Gai. There are many mini bars, robot restaurants, ramen noodles, restaurants and cafes nearby. You will not miss any nightlife actions staying here. The room is clean and we love the bathroom! The bathroom size is big and clean. We stayed here with a toddler and we didnt feel too cramp which is a good thing.There is a udon restaurant and lawson right below the hotel. We tried a restaurant specialised in blowfish ( eg puffer fish) right across the hotel and it was really nice!The Shinjuku train station is just 5-10 mins walk. There is a cinema nearby and you can find a good gyoza restaurant there.Overall we enjoyed our stay here as it is very convenient to go anywhere or get anything staying here. The shopping centre (Lumine Est, Isetan) is just walking distance from the hotel.

This is a good hotel but I can't agree with those who like the location. You have to walk a gauntlet of crowds and hawkers to get to the main entrance. Twice we were solicited on the hotel's street. (It did not happen to us any other time during 8 days in Tokyo.) Once was by a pimp and another time it was either for drugs or sex. So it's a seamy walk on that street. Fortunately there is a back path into the hotel entrance that is quite calm and charming. So that is quite preferable. We asked for a room on an upper floor and we had no problem with street noise and had a good view. The Lawson's on the ground floor was quite convenient. You have close access to a lot of shopping nearby. But again, it is not the most serene part of Tokyo. The staff were helpful and the room clean and comfortable.

One of the best hotels I stayed in especially for its location. In the heart of shinjuku where all the restaurants are located. It's a small room but it's so clean so I give it five stars for that. It's small but cozy and when the window is opened you have a lovely view of the city. It's definitely worth your money and the employees were so accommodating. By far, the easiest check out as well. Also, you are so close to the stations hat you can get anywhere!!

This is our first time staying at Citadines Shinjuku because it has a kitchen, it’s Shinjuku location, and a great price for the 3 of us sharing same room. We booked very early, about 11 months before arrival and got a great rate. About CAD$290 a night all service charge and taxes included for 3 adults without breakfast. The room was large enough for 3 adults with a king bed that was absolutely comfortable on the form side with an European duvet. Crisp linen and everything smelling fresh and clean. Our adult son slept on the sofa bed with 2 extra mattress toppers and duvet which he didn’t seem to find too uncomfortable.The kitchen with a bar fridge, one stove top, kettle, toaster, and microwave came in so handy for making breakfast or nuking up bento boxes. There were 3 of everything from plates to wine glasses along with dish soap and rags given. The air conditioning is fantastic as it can provide both AC or heat and was very quiet.there was also enough lighting g and outlets for charging our devices. There was a tub along with shower and the Toto toilet with its washlet like bidet and heated toilet seat are a plus.Despite some people criticizing the location, we actually loved its location and here is why:1. 2 minute walk to 7/11 convenience store that sells fantastic meals, hot croquettes, desserts, and coffees that is excellent for 100 yen or 150yen for a large. The ATM machine also worked well without any problems using our Canadian bank card. The food quality of their meals are good and great selection.2. 3 minute walk to a Lawson’s 100 where almost everything is 100 yen before 8% tax. Here, the selection and quality of prepared meals are not as high as 7/11, but buying non meals are great. Small butter 100 yen, jam 100 yen, soba shout 100 yen, eggs and fresh bread 100 yen, chubby European wieners at 284 yen for 8 of them. It is so convenient buying small sized everything here for just 100 yen like salt/pepper, and small bottle of Japanese mayo and wasabi.There is no need to go to a super market and pay more money for the same items and they only have large portions.3. 5 minute walk to a very large and new western type super market that has very high quality of cooked meals, cheeses, bakery, meats, and produce, they open at 10am and closes late at 11 pm.4. 2. minute walk across the hotel to a take out restaurant called ORIGINS that sell many Japanese and Chinese deli items by weight and fresh to make bento boxes at very reasonable prices.5. many great little restaurants nearby like Yatsunoya chain, little soba joints, and cafes.6. 10minute walk to the nearest metro station, Shinjuku Gyoemmae, and a 15 mi Ute walk to another station called Shinjuku Sanchome.7. 20 minute walk to the main Shinjuku Station.The staff here all speak English and everyone is so helpful and polite.We used the washer which it automatically includes detergent for 300 yen a wash and the dryer does not dry clothes enough despite putting in 200 yen for one hour. Replacing the dryers with more efficient and more powerful ones would be perfect.There is a tiny gym with new treadmills but we did t use it because after having walked 6 to 8 hours a day, my feet were already killing me.There is a flat screen TV with many Chan else but only with limited English channels but there are movie channels in English.The room is extremely functional with many shelves, closets, and it is designed so that there are many places to put all your amenities. We love the Citadines Shinjuku and we will certainly return here to this property and we highly recommend it to all those who want a great value and a little kitchen.Thank you so much for an awesome stay Citadines,

We returned to the Citadines after our week in the snow as we had such a good experience last year. The hotel was the same and did not disappoint. We managed to get a better room rate this year through Booking.com and I think our room was smaller. Maybe that was why? In any event, I have no complaints. I did report to staff that the internet signal in our room was poor and they responded by providing a portable router in our room for our stay. Our son and partner stayed a a couple of nights longer than us and became ill. The hotel kindly allowed a late check out ahead of their flight. Shinjuku is a really good, central location for getting around Tokyo. Citadines is near the rather tame "red light" area. While we believe this is not a safety issue, there is a lot of the hustle and hassle which I found to be unpleasant this year. Easy to avoid and lots of nicer options if that offends you.

Easy access and convenient. The staffs are very helpful and friendly. Bed is a little low but still quite comfortable. As our room is near the lift, so it will be a little noise when the rest of the guest are walking pass.

Temper expectations on hotel room size, since a lot of Tokyo hotel rooms are small. The main benefits, close walking distance to the Shinjuku bus terminal/subway, and to a lot of restaurants make it ideal to visit places around Tokyo. Overall a pretty centrally located place that is good for the price.Coming from Narita airport there is accessibility via train and bus which is much cheaper than taxi.

Centrally located in the red light district (very safe), good service, they helped on boarding pass, bus to airport, restaurants reservations.The only down side that I had on this hotel is the wifi is less than stellar which they have advised post check-out that there are other ways to go around it. Will check it out next time.

I'm struggling how to review this hotel, I am fussy. When checking in they will ask you if you would like to take the breakfast offer at a discount. I asked if we could go to the room first and come back down so we could work out our days but we couldn't, we had to take the offer at check in. Hence we took the offer and realize we were heading off early one day for tour and were checking out early so miss out two days. We gave two breakfast token to a young couple who didn't take the offer - Good karma :) So make sure you work out what you need before you check in.Location ? Mmmm We are in our 50's so not into the party nightlife and the area is a bit red-light / drinking area? Saying that up the road shopping was good and transport was easy. We definitely didn't feel unsafe tho.Room ? We booked a standard Twin room non-smoking, The room smelt musty and stale smoke. Very small. Went down to reception and told then our concerns, They did offer another same type room but we decided to pay the $100 difference for 4 nights for the next size room. Bathroom was the same but just had that bit more room to move and felt more comfortable. Beds average Pillows shocking - one was a size of a child's pillow and the other felt like it was filled with rice.Breakfast - lovely restaurant and breakfast Staff - Very nice Overall - Not bad, felt clean which is the main thing.

Hotel is close to everything, JR station, Golden Gai, Kabukicho and shopping. The rooms although small by western standards are good size by Tokyo standards. The rooms are quiet and very clean with modern bathrooms I would stay again next time.

I stayed here for a few days in March 2018. The room was brilliant. I liked the shower and bath combination. The bed was very comfy. Plenty of space to put my suitcase. Lots of charger points to charge phones/ipads. You could hire an adapter for the sockets if you didn't have the correct one. The hotel was very clean.On arrival I was greeted by a friendly face. As part of your information you are given Japanese to English translations for the air-con which is really useful! The wi-fi works perfectly.The hotel is located about 10 minutes walk from both stations which is handy.I really enjoyed my stay and would highly recommend.

Location is great, just right behind Shinjuku Golden Gai and walking distance to metro. Staffs are definitely commendable (professional, friendly, helpful, thoughtful). We were upgraded to executive room upon late arrival with a toddler. Thank you to Citadines Central Shinjuku for making our stay in Tokyo a comfort one.

This was a convenient hotel since it’s located close to the main JR station via a 15 minute walk. It’s also located in close proximity to the shops. The staff are very helpful. The room itself is a bit small but comfortable.

This hotel was in an excellent central location to get around Tokyo. Right outside the hotel are the bright lights of Shinjuku with plenty of restaurants to go to. Golden Gai is also right behind the hotel, so plenty of little bars to drink at.We were lucky enough to be upgraded to a room with 2 double beds put together, rather than the one double bed. This room was large enough to not feel cramped, and the bathroom was perfect. We had a great view of the city from our room as well. The rooms were clean, and you are provided with 2 complimentary bottles of water every day. The front desk staff were lovely. We had a package arriving the second day and they ensured that we were called as soon as it arrived. Check in was easy and straightforward.Would definitely recommend staying herein you want something that is close to the main streets of Shinjuku and is only approx a 5-8 minute walk to Shinjuku station.

We stay for 5 nights in this hotel and had wonderful stay there.The location is good with many shops around but it was noisy at night. The room are of good size but the bed is kind of soft. Will return to this hotel again next time.

I stayed here for Tokyo Marathon. The location is really great and the staff is helpful. feel free to ask for help from the staff. you will find your journey much easier... You can take the JR train from NRT airport to the Shinjuku station directly with around 90 mins. after that, just 10 mins walk way from the Shinjinku station to the hotel. the reception is at 3rd floor nearby the Lawson.

Clean hotel that is typical of the Citadines brand with standard amenities. Great location, close to metro, shopping, food and nightlife. There’s no airport shuttle service available though. You will have to use the airport bus shuttle or the airport express.

We stayed here for 4 nights which was a great location to explore Shinjuku, Shibuya and surrounding areas from. The room is a bit small but still comfortable. The location is walking distance from great shopping, restaurants and the train station.

7 mins walk to shinjuku stn. Hotel looks fairly nee & clean. The double bed for 2 pax is alittle small so do suggest to get bigget rooms if you hv big lugg. Easy to walk around & many shoppings and eateties around too. Right below there's a lawson so easy to grab last kin snacks & drinks.

The hotel was really central to many of the sights we wanted to visit and was a short walk from a main train station for easy travel elsewhere. The hotel is great value for the money and staff were excellent at the front desk!

A 5 minute walk from the Maranouchi line side of Shinjuku Station. Also on the edge of Kabukicho so very central for food, shops and the entertainment areas without being at all noisy either.We chose the hotel as it was a 20 minute walk to the start of the Tokyo Marathon and it is a perfect location for that along with being near the station with Narita Express connections.Very clean and tidy. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff and our 7 night stay was flawless.

Citadines central shinjuku is a very good hotel, very clean and have a very helpful employee, location is pretty good too, will definitely come back again when i go to Tokyo and will recommend this to my colleague

We stayed five nights and will stay there again. Yes the room was small but we found a way to accommodate us and our luggage. The staff were friendly and the room was cleaned and serviced daily. Location is a big plus. We were minutes walk from the metro and JR lines, Shinjuku Gyoen National Gardens with cherry blossom appearing, the bright lights of Kabukicho and across the lane way at the rear of the hotel the Golden Gai with the Hanazono-ninja Shrine. Lawson convenience store and eatery on the ground floor is open 24 hours. The coin operated laundry is on the 7th floor. We could not ask for more. We ate twice at a little Thai restaurant across the street Bangkok because the food was so good and cheap. A Japanese thermal spa is along the lane way. We will definitely stay there again when next we visit Tokyo.

Clean rooms and great location right near the Shinjuku station (~5 min walk). The rooms are small, perfect for a solo traveler but may be a tight squeeze with two people plus luggage. Only other downside was that they charge a fee to book a taxi for you (~10% of the taxi cost).

I spent three nights here with my boyfriend in mid-February. We reserved and paid for the rooms in full months before we arrived. When we got to the hotel (after a transcontinental flight) they told us they had overbooked and were sending us to their other location, which was further away. They tried to compensate us with a breakfast voucher, even though the other location was cheaper than what we'd actually already paid for. I put my foot down for over an hour and suddenly there happened to be an extra room available at the original location, once I demanded they send us to their 4.5 star location instead. The staff were lovely and it wasn't their fault; they were trying their hardest to rectify the situation, but it wasn't a nice start to our trip, particularly when it also happened to be my birthday. The hotel itself is in a perfect location - steps out into the Golden Gai bar district, but the rooms, halls and lobby feel tired and dirty, I wouldn't recommend, especially when there are many other options in the area.

This hotel is located in the central area of Shinjuku, close to the main train station. Trade and services in ambundance in the region. The Kabukicho neighborhood is full of restaurants, bars and nightclubs.

room quite spacious, bathroom also large.. friendly english speaking staff. Right in the middle of hot spot where lots of things going on at night. Can be a little noisy in the middle of the night during weekends if staying below 10th floor. A bit far from Shin juku station. Overall i love the place!

I visited Tokyo for the first time, and the Central Citadines Shinjuku was in great location, with the 24 hr store at the bottom floor, lots of food places nearby, close to the metro/subway stations and of course shopping. The hotel itself is very comfortable. On the 3rd night, our shower would not turn on and altho’ we made the frontdesk aware of the problem, the shower was still not working after a long day that we were out. The front desk staff immediately gave us another room, smaller than the one we had ( a little amount of space means a lot when you have suitcases, besides they did not give us the $ difference of what we paid for.) one staff was profusely apologetic and helped us move all our belongings from the 8th floor to the 12th floor. I would recommend this hotel still.

Friendly staff, comfortable room and a great location - just what you want in a hotel. From the minute we arrived we were made to feel welcome. The staff were happy to help with directions. Definitely staying again when we're back in Tokyo

The hotel is located in Kabukicho Shinjuku , about five minutes from Shinjuku Station, very lively near many tourists, but the high floor room is very quiet, from the room you can see the Tokyo Skytree and the Tokyo Tower, the hotel is recommended.

Ventured to Japan this year to go snow skiing at Madarao and then back to Tokyo Shinjuku for three nights. Was unsure what to expect from my travel agent booking but the stay at the Citadines Central Shinjuku exceeded all my expectations. Will be booking here again next year.

This hotel was a perfect oasis in a busy, vibrant area. The room was spacious, the bathroom was large and check in, check out was simple. The Kubikucho location is a feast for the senses. Lights, good restaurants, wild nightlife. The hotel was directly in front of the Golden Gai, a series of historic tiny bars (well worth checking out) Hotel stored our luggage after check out which made the rest of our trip easier. I would recommend this hotel.

Only stayed for one night, but found this hotel to be in a very good location close to shops, restaurants and train station. The rooms were clean with enough room for 3 people, bathroom a good size. Breakfast we paid for, everything you would need maybe a little expensive , but gets you going for the day.

We stayed at Citadines Central Shinjuku for 5 days over Christmas. We had a great stay. Rooms are small, but we booked a deluxe double room which i think were a little bigger than the standard, and with some strategic placement of suitcases, the room size is completely manageable. The bathrooms are really well designed, so enough room for 2 people.  The breakfast was really good. Big enough variety that we didn't get bored in our 5 day stay, and all of the food supplied was delicious. The beds are hard (but we found that in all hotels we stayed at in Japan). My partner loves hard beds, so he loved it and thought they were comfortable!Hotel staff were very helpful and English was good. They supply you with the usual town map with all the sightseeing areas but they also supply a restaurant map with their recommendations for restaurants around the hotel area, which i thought was a really good idea.The hotel is in walking distance to the JR station, although we found it a little hard to find the hotel on the day we arrived (because my google maps wouldn't load and we had just arrived from Australia at 6am), as we were a little disorientated! Once we got our bearings, the station is in easy walking distance and easy to find. The subway is also very close.The hotel itself is in a great area. I read a lot of reviews before going about it being in the "red light district", but i can say that we NEVER had an issue with anyone harassing us, and did not see anyone trying to harass any other tourist either. We thought the location was great! There are so many food and drink options and it is just a lively happening spot. Loved it!Overall we did have a great stay and would stay here again if/when we come back to Tokyo. Highly recommend.

Very welcoming staff. Good quality & clean rooms. Well located to easily visit some great parts of Shinjuku. Short walk to Shinjuku Central Station. Really enjoyed our stay here and definitely will stay again if in Tokyo.

You have aptly placed the hotel at 7th Rank in 87 hotels in the area. We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights and felt like at home.  Location is good . Staff is polite and ever helpful. We were strangers at Tokyo. The reception and other staff helped us in visit of sightseeing by guiding and booking taxis. One day there was heavy snowfall in Tokyo and we from tropical area are not used to.  Rooms were nice and clean. Location close to stations. Food was good.  We were totally satisfied for the cost we paid.

Location is not bad. Not very far to station. Convenient store is right downstairs the hotel.Comfortable room and bed. Rather big than normal shinjuku hotels. Staff is nice. however, it costs 200yen to keep a luggage.

Location was good. Easy to access from Shinjuku main area. Comfort and clean service. Convenient store on the 1st floor is useful. Staffs are kind and supportive. It was good memory to spend days in this hotel.

The location is good, 7-mins walk from JR station, and 5-mins walk from metro. There are many restaurant nearby! But the room condition is just fair, not clean and dusty. The bathroom is newly renovated, so it's good!

The hotel was excellent. We stayed for 2 weeks. The rooms were extremely clean, the bed sheets were changed every day! Staff were helpful in booking restaurant reservations and helping us for trips around Tokyo! Amazing.

This is my second stay at Citidines. It is located close to Shinjuku station, shops and restaurants and is very convenient. Rooms are a reasonable size but the pillows this time were quite uncomfortable. A little more tea/coffee would also be nice. However, the staff are very friendly and helpful and these are only minor things.

The location is very good. For several-minutes-walking, it can reach the main business locations. The front-desk is friendly and helpful. My booked room is not very small considering the actual condition of Tokyo city. And the breakfast is OK.

Our room was on the 7th floor so had a bit of a view. The room was fairly small but it was to be expected in Tokyo, it was very clean and tidy, nice deep bath and shower and had the fancy japanese butt washing toilet too! It was air conditioned and the bottles of water each day were also a nice touch as it was very hot outside in September.Breakfast was good also, something for both western and japanese tastes and was all you can eat so no risk of going hungry.The laundry facilities were also very useful, they were only 300 Yen to wash and then 300 Yen for 30 mins of drying. It also felt safe to leave the clothes washing and come back to get them when they were done. There are a few machine but the washer and dryer counts down so I was sure to be back on time to get my stuff just as it finished so as not to be rude.Great location, easy to get to from the station, just a ten minute walk (if that) in pretty much a stright line. Lots of interesting things around too, there is a the Golden Gai literally just behind the hotel and just beyond that is a the beautiful Hanazono Shrine which you can see from the hotel. Lots of shops and restaurants along the street too, something for everyone from Japanese food to Mister Donut. There is also a convience store underneath the hotel and another about three doors up. Could not fault it. Would stay here again if we return to Tokyo.

Value for money and comfortable stay. The internet is available but somehow little bit slow. In overall, the accommodation is good and room is well maintained by the management. Staff also friendly and able to speak English.

I am so happy to stay at Gitadines, they are such good location at Shinjuku,, convenient to go shop and many restaurant around us. Lawson is a good convenience store just right downstairs, I love their steam chicken bun, must try.

Yes, this hotel is in the red light district, however I never felt unsafe while I was there. If you do not engage with the touts and promoters (who stand outside the bars, etc), they will leave you completely alone. We liked the location because it meant that we did not have to walk far to shop and eat good food. Ramen Nagi and Ramen Ichiran (both are open 24/7) is close by, as well as various types of different restaurants serving different types of cuisine. The Samurai museum (which we really enjoyed) is also a few minutes walk away, and there is a Lawsons convenience store next to the entry to the hotel. For the price and the fact that we were in Tokyo, the hotel room was a good size and the staff was always very helpful whenever we needed anything. I recommend that if you have a lot of luggage you should just take a taxi to the hotel when you arrive and when you leave. It is about 12 minutes from the nearest entrance to Shinjuku station but it can be hard to drag your luggage through the narrower sidewalks or the crowds when it is busy. Even though the hotel is in a lively location, it is very quiet and peaceful in the hotel itself. This place is not for people who are looking for a 4 or 5 star hotel and who have an issue staying in a red light district, but if you are looking for a clean, safe and good sized boutique hotel in a lively location, it should suit you.

1km walk to JR lines but close to subway. Kitchenette is great. Good room size. Staff are very helpful. Breakfast is average. Lots of restaurants nearby and a few shops near the subway. Free Wifi works well.

It's kinda in the red light district, not recommend for female travelers went back at night. The wifi is very slow. It's a bit far from JR station. The overall is okay, but because of the location in specific area, I won't stay here again.

10 minute walk to Shinjuku station. Busy area with sometimes narrower sidewalks so dragging bigger luggage through was a little bit of a pain. Malls all around. Isetan food basement is one of the best. Lawson's right downstairs. City Hall across the street. Helpful staff. They helped me mail my glasses back to me after I accidentally left them at the hotel. An iron is available at the front desk on first come first serve check out basis. Rooms are a little crammed if you have big luggage since there is a couch but doable. Comfortable and clean by American standards but have had slightly better at other Japanese hotels. Having two free bottles of water a day was very great. Wifi was so so.

This Hotel is very close to shops, entertainment and only a few minutes walk to the train station. It backs onto Golden Gai and there are plenty of restaurants and bars close by too. Our room was serviced daily and the staff at reception were always helpful with a map and directions in English. Laundry for you to use so you are not travelling with heaps of dirty clothes. Breakfast choices not exciting but always fresh and plentiful.

We stayed in room 816 for 5 nights. Our first impression was how small the room was but we quickly learned that it worked ok. The bed [double] was comfortable and the bathroom very good with excellent shower. We took the option to include breakfast. The spread was very good also with all the usual...cereal eggs bacon hash browns toast and jam coffee juice etc.Entry is through a lift on the ground floor up to third floor. Reception was seamless and informative. The hotel offers a laundromat 300yen for wash and dryer 100yen for 30 minutes. Also available is fast WiFi. All in all good value.

Very close to Shinjuku station and shopping staff are helpful but rooms are very small. We upgraded to a slightly larger room for a discount however it had a smoky smellBreakfast was good and it is close to loads of interesting places

Citadines Central Shinjuku is very well located, about 5 minute walk from the train station and very near to the Golden Gai and other sights. The hotel was fairly standard, rooms were clean and the beds comfortable. A reliable place to stay in Shinjuku.

Breakfast had a good selection and was very good from a taste point of view. Room was small which is the norm in Japan, pillows were very uncomfortable. Laundry facilities need updating as things seem to not dry and clothes were full of fluff. Location was perfect and noise was at a minimum.

Great location (15 minutes walking distance to Shinjuku stations and malls).The staff was friendly and always ready to assist. (English speaking staff.Smooth check in & check out - done in few minutes.will consider to stay again in future.

The location is so great.It's not only close to Shinjuku station but also Golden street where small and fancy bars gathered. I did enjoy staying at this hotel.The price is also reasonable when it considering that it is located in central of Tokyo.Staff is also kind and the room is small but tidy.I recommend you to stay this hotel.

We stayed at the hotel for 6 nights. It was conveniently located to Shinjuku station (metro and JR), numerous eateries (casual and formal), retailers (uniqlo, GU, zara, h&m many more), and convenience stores. Rooms were clean and large. Staff were friendly and helpful. Would stay again in the future!

My wife and I stayed here and we loved it. The location is simply superb for doing things. It’s perfectly located in Shinjuku and very lively (can be a bit noisy). It’s easy to get to the Shinjuku station from here. The rooms are great. Tokyo in general has small rooms but this didn’t feel small. The bathroom was very modern and comfortable and we miss it compared to other hotels. Highly recommended.

Great location 10 mins from Shinjuku station and above a convenience shop you'll find this hotel. Rooms are small (standard for Tokyo) and if you have a large bag you'll be living out your suitcase. It is clean, the staff are friendly and breakfast is 3*. This is a good example of a 3.5 star hotel and at a decent cost. We had a problem with the toilet and it was sorted out on the second time of asking and had someone help us move room and we had to pay for an early check in as we arrived at 9am. So bear in mind if you are traveling a long distance (like us from the U.K) after 15 hrs or so of traveling you're going to have to pay to get straight into your room early.If you're looking for space and luxury this is not for you if you're looking for a clean well situated place to stay where you spend minimum time in the room this is a great choice. I'll be back!

Hotel is located at the area where there are lots of bars,massages, restaurants. When we walk bk at night, it was v crowded.not suitable for families with young kids.however right actoss the road there is a huge Isetan store. About 10mins walk to JR station.

Nice hotel, I have been stay there few times, good balance price and location. Breakfast also good. Compare to other hotel around area, room size is "OK". you can open two big baggage. Lawson just under the hotel.

Be mindful when you book your room. Don't look at the floor size alone. The room given has a tiny living and sleeping area. The 'double' bed (which was a single bed queen size) was forced into a corner against the wall, leaving hardly any space for movement and relaxation. The result is a lot of tension, dissatisfaction and claustrophobia.

2nd visit to citadines central shinjuku tokyo. They never let me down. The location of the hotel is just nice if you are about to explore shinjuku area. Is just right behind Golden Gai, few steps away from subnade entrance, and 8 minutes walk from JR east exit. Hotel is surrounded by shopping and restaurant. is a big plus that their staffs can speak fluent English.

Overall very happy with my experience here. Instant hot water in the shower during December in Tokyo cannot be beat! It was 0 degrees outside and I was amazed by the water heater and pressure during my shower. In addition, the rooms for a Standard double was larger than expected, considering this was Tokyo. Bed was very comfortable including the pillows. Slept very well. Almost wanted to sleep in, but the Tsukiji Fish Market being a morning event forced me to get out of bed!

I chose the slightly more expensive room type which gave me another few square footage. If you don’t mind the cost, it’s definitely the better choice, at least you can open up your suite case. The bed is still against the wall, and is just a double bed, so don’t expect a large comfy room. The bathroom is big, with both shower and tub. It’s not a new hotel, and you do feel the age. It’s in a great location, within walking distance to the shinjuku station, where you can take a direct train ride to the airport and the restaurants around the area is great. Definitely won’t mind staying there again.

If you are planning to stay around Shinjuku, I'd recommend this hotel because of its location! It is just a few minutes walk from Shinjuku Station, and you can find a metro station just around the corner. You can find lots of good restaurants, shops, department stores (Seibu, 0101, Lumines, Barneys NY and many more), and bars and lounges.As for the room, it's quite spacious considering other hotel rooms in Japan. The interior is a bit date, a bit of refurbishment would be good, especially the carpet. But the bathroom was equipped with a bathtub - which you may find handy for a soak after a day of busy sightseeing & shopping!The staff were all friendly and helpful - they were eager to help book a restaurant or make recommendation. Considering the location and the room rates, it was a great deal and I couldn't ask for more.

We stayed for 2 nights before proceeding to Osaka, chose this hotel due to its excellent location in Shinjuku. Just less than 5 mins walk from entrance 13/15 of Shinjuku JR station and very close to major stores like Isetan. The room was a comfortable size, very clean with basic amenities. However the double bed was small , perhaps normal by Japanese standard. Room rate was reasonable and will return to stay due to its great location and room rate .

We enjoyed our one night stay. The staff were very efficient at check-in and check-out and stored our bags on check out as we were flying out in the evening. The buffet breakfast was very good, just wished there was more choice of fruit.

Great and convenient location in Shinjuku bustling and noisy area , Only some 10 minutes walk to Shinjuku Station with easy connections to other interesting attractions and parts of Tokyo . The famous Golden Gai and the Hanazono Shrine are right behind the hotel (we were lucky to enjoy the crowded grounds of the shrine during one of the seasonal festivals) . Many restaurants and bars nearby , and even a 24/7 mini market on the ground floor. The Citadines Central is very quiet inside , It's like a cool refuge once you come in from the crowded streets outside . Lobby is very nice . The rooms , though small (1104/1108) - are modern and nicely designed . A small fridge , water bottles , electric kettle + coffee/tea , a small wardrobe , and cleaning service every day . Reception desk service - very friendly , welcoming , attentive and helpful . Good English . Personal thanks to GENEVIEVE and EIJIRO .Mind you : We stayed at the Citadines for seven nights (2 + 5 ) . We did book the least expensive room a few months prior to our arrival . Once entering the room , we realized the double bed (however comfy itself) - was at the corner of room with its length adjacent to the wall : Very uncomfortable if you are a tall/older person(like us) . The photos at the web site are a bit deceiving . They make you feel as if the room is more spacious , even large enough to have the small sofa at the corner . We would let go of the sofa , and have space on both sides of the bed . We tried to upgrade to a bigger room - there were none available . Again - thank you Genevieve for trying .So , again : If you are a taller/older persons - we recommend that you book the larger rooms .The bottom line : We did enjoy our stay at the Citadines Central Shinjuku .

Hotel location is great and just a short walk from Shinjuku station. The room on business floor was great and bigger than the tight size standards in Tokyo. Staff was polite and very efficient. Breakfast should be improved.

VERY close to Shinjuku railway station, and Airport bus terminal, you can walk in 10 minutes from there to the hotel, the rooms are small but convenient, calm und have a nice bathroom - even with a bath tube. Breakfast is good, the price with a 20 % discount for in-guests acceptable

Very good stay as expected with Citadines. Staff remembered my birthday and brought my a small treat which was wonderful. Location was great as well though the touting can be annoying and persistent. Wifi was ok but a bit spotty at times. The beds were comfortable and shower pressure is excellent. I requested for a late checkout, and was granted free of charge, so that was very nice of them as well.

Recommended by our Travel Agent. He told us to expect small rooms and if comparing to other rooms we stayed in he was right. However the room was fine with plenty of room for our bags.The staff were helpful and friendly upon check-in. Our room was clean, well equipped with a great bathroom.The hotel is in a great location. It is very easy to get to the big shops, the railway station and there are plenty of restaurants nearby.

The staff is excellent, the rooms are well-equipped (after each cleaning, you are given toothbrushes, toothpaste, combs, etc). The rooms are very small, when compared to western standards. The hotel is about a 7-10 minute walk to the train station and even closer to shops and restaurants. My biggest complaint is the moment it gets dark, my wife, friend, and I were harassed nightly by some men asking if we want to "have fun for the night." They were obviously referring to strip clubs/prostitution. They were very aggressive and though not the hotel's fault, the police should more closely monitor to prevent.

The name suggest it is a apartment but it not...the room is too small and there is no kitchen. The location is great and staff are friendly friendly and helpful and speak very good english. The view from my room was very nice.

I am always very curious and critical at my visited due my stay in hotels around the globe ( most of my time traveling around the world ) This hotel has a great value with high standards for cleanliness, service and customer care. Rooms are kind of small ( that’s Tokyo), excellent location near shopping streets, restaurants, bars and subway to visit this metropole. 1) Front office : friendly and professional staff. 2) Rooms : small, but with good facilities , cleanliness excellent! 3) Breakfast : friendly staff, with a big range of different breakfast types to start the day. 5) Location : excellent!

Other than tight quarters, this is a functional and decent hotel with good service. I left a pair of sandals behind accidentally, but they found them and shipped them to me at my request (I had to foot the shipping cost). It's in a central albeit somewhat seedy part of Shinjuku.

The staff were very welcolming and veryy helpful . There was plenty of choice for breakfast. Small but adaquet rooms that are very clean and well apointed. Will certainly stay there again. Samuri museum is close by and is a must to see.

We stayed in the hotel recently for 6 nights in a standard double room on the 9th floor, which we found to be exceptionally quiet. The room was, as we now expect in Japan at this price point, very small, but exceptionally clean. The bed was comfortable - note that in standard rooms like ours it is against a wall which can be problematic, as I found, as you get older! The bathroom was immaculately maintained and clean, with a good quality bath and great shower pressure. Free wireless internet in the rooms and a well maintained coin laundry within the hotel were fantastic. The staff at reception are friendly and professional and all we interacted with spoke excellent English (our Japanese is poor). Breakfast (buffet) is reasonably priced in the Hotel restaurant and gives a good selection of both Asian and Western food. Again, the restaurant staff were lovely and friendly, and food is replenished constantly. In terms of location, the Hotel suited us on this trip because we needed to be in Shinjuku for family reasons. The area around the hotel can be seedy at night (as you'd expect in Kabukicho) and surprisingly grubby early morning before the clean up crew arrives - I personally prefer the vibe of other areas in Tokyo.However, Shinjuku does allow quick access by foot/ train to major tourist sites and has endless choices for food /shopping/nightlife and cultural activities. If you are looking for accommodation in this part of Tokyo, I would highly recommend this Hotel and we would return again if we needed to be in Shinjuku.

What's not to love about this fab hotel. The location is excellent, very easy to explore and get around, lots of shopping, restaurants, nightlife, atmosphere. Easy to walk to from the Train station, even with luggage - possibly a bit tricky to find but several other reviews had mentioned how to find the hotel, so wasn't really an issue. The hotel itself is very clean, the rooms are cosy but have everything you need, the beds are really comfortable, the bathrooms are very spacious and very well designed with every amenity you would need. There is a guest laundry on the 7th floor which is very convenient. The staff are so friendly and helpful. There is a restaurant that was open for buffet breakfast, we weren't on a meal plan but had the breakfast there one morning for convenience- reasonably priced and a fair selection, again the staff very friendly and accommodating. I would definitely stay here again and wouldn't even bother looking for anywhere else to stay. Would definitely recommend.

Room was clean and bigger than I had expected. Hotel staff were patient and helpful. Good location! Lots of eateries and shopping nearby.Plus supermarket Lawson just downstairs the hotel.Will definitely stay her again.

I didn't like that the bed was against the wall so I had to climb over my husband to get in and out, I thought they should have invested in a smaller bedside table instead of a huge desk like table and then you could have walked down both sides of the bed. Other than that the amenities were good, the bathroom had a shower over a bath,. the position was an easy walk from 3 different stations. we stayed there just prior to joining a cruise that departed from Yokohoma and we were easily able to take the train on the brown line all the way there without having to change lines, or walk with luggage very far.

We had a fantastic stay here. The room was spacious (byTokyo standards), the bed and pillows were comfortable, everything was clean, and we had access to everything we needed.Reception spoke English and were helpful, and having the Lawson convenience store just next door meant we could enjoy cheap, delicious food and drink whenever we wanted.The only concern is that this hotel is in the red light district. It's pretty tame and I'm not a prude, but there were signs and pictures I would not be comfortable with children seeing.

Stayed here for 3 nights in October with my husband. It was our first time in Tokyo and we loved it. The hotel was in a great location surrounded by great nightlife, robot restaurant is a 2 min walk away and golden gai is next to the hotel. You would expect it to be noisy due to this but it was fine. The hotel was clean and comfortable, we had two large suitcases and we could fit into room without to much trouble ! We didn't have breakfast so can't comment about that but for the price I think you would be better getting something outside the hotel as there are plenty of places to choose from all at a good price. We would stay again if visiting Tokyo.

Reccomended by my Travel Agent - after finding our way from Shinjuku Station ( thanks to comments on TripAdvisor) it was wonderful to arrive there. Staff were helpful and friendly upon check-in. The room was clean and well equipped. The bathroom and amenities provided were top class. The hotel and rooms were spotlessly clean.Location of hotel was excellent- very easy to get around, and although a very lively area with lots of nightlife and entertainment- felt very safe.

We stayed at Citadines Central Shinjuku for our 8 day trip in Toyko, following a recommendation from a friend. Very pleased we did.The hotel is clean, modern with cosy rooms that provided everything we needed. Staff were very friendly and happy to help with bookings and provide advice.On top of that, the hotel is located close to restuarants, bars and nightlife - so nothing is ever to far away.Highly recommended for anyone staying in the area.

Although the room was quite small, this hotel location is very strategic and convenient. A lot of restaurants and shops nearby. It's very convenient for us who are looking for food and shops until midnight. Very near to go the big Department Store like Isetan and Takashimaya. Very near to the train station. Price wise is affordable. Will definitely consider this hotel for our next visit.

I had the pleasure to stay at Citadines in Shinjuku. The rooms are spacious, clean and very comfortable. The staff are polite, friendly and always hepful. The view from my room was beautiful. There are plenty of stores within walking distance. Robot Restaurant is a few ninutes walk away. Plenty of places to eat.

This hotel has a perfect location, it's close to the subway station. When we chose this hotel we we're afraid about Kabukicho zone, but we didn't have any problem. Furthermore, we had breakfast and they have some occidental food (as french toast, coffee,and some croissant) and, of course, japanese breakfast

This hotel ist a nice modern and clean hotel in the middle of Shinjuku. Perfect location to discover Tokyo. The breakfast ist Japanese and western Style. The rooms a small but very nice and suitable for a short stay or business trips. Next to the hotel is Golden Gai an interesting bar district.

Nice and clean hotel. Look out for the Citadines lighted signage. Entrance is on the 3rd floor via a lift. Lawson convenience mart below. Many restaurants nearby. There is a currency exchange machine in the lobby. They gave 2 bottles of mineral water free. Room is clean and comfortable. Service is efficient.

The customer service front desk staffs had helped us to safely kept our luggages in their store and also to on-call cab during heavy rain. The cleaners had checked our "do not disturb" sign outside of door and they had placed a note below our door to inform us that they will not be cleaning our room. Thanks for all the efforts!

Basic hotel, great location. At walking distance of Shinjuku station, which connects to the rest of Tokyo. It's on the edge of Kabukicho - the entertainment district. No issues there, it's super safe, and plenty of restaurants and life in the area.As is custom in Tokyo, the double room we booked was on the smaller side. The bed is a tiny double with one side to the wall. If you prefer more space, best to book a twin room. Bathroom was clean and spacious with bathtub and shower and all the amenities. We didn't use the hotel breakfast, but there's a big convenience store on the ground floor where you can sit at a bar and have a nice bento or noodle soup.It was a great hotel from which you can easily explore Tokyo.

we stayed at this very convenient hotel walking distance to JR station and subway stations, clean, and bigger than expected rooms in Tokyo, highly recommended, seven eleven 10 steps away and Lawson just downstairs, Udon place on second floor also very good, we are there twice

Excellent location. Clean rooms, great service and a very good breakfastAfter we checked out, we left the suitcases and returned to pick them up a week later when we returned to Tokyo.Although the room turned into Main Street, the room was quiet. There are drinks machines, an ATM and money exchange.

Fantastic room, a lot of space especially for such a great location (right inside the nightlife hub of Tokyo), super clean bathroom, great washlet, super modern-looking place with shiny materials and comfortable beds

Great location.Very well situated you can walk to the main shopping area. Close to subway and main line stations enabling you to get around the city easily. Rooms are a Fair size and very well equipped. The Staff are very friendly and helpful and can speak good English.Breakfast is limited but good quality and tasty. Plenty of good shops and restaurants close to the hotel. Hotel is great value for money .Will stay here again

Staff service was excellent, location was also superb. Will definitely stay here again in the future. Even though they say it's in the 'red-light' district but my family and I (I'm with my 5 y/o son) felt so safe walking around the area.

Pleasant, clean, quiet and the room was more spacious than I expected. Not a large room but perfectly adequate. One of our group is vegetarian and was happy with the range of food on offer at the breakfast buffet. A comfortable base to explore Tokyo from.

I didn't have any particular expectations of the hotel, other than expecting the room to be small. It was very much a pleasant surprise - the room was small, but extremely well appointed with a great bathroom. The décor was modern, and housekeeping did a great job. It's very close to many restaurants, and is a relatively short walk to the station.

A lot of choices for restaurants, night life & entertainment in the neighbourhood.Perfect for the party goers. Very easy access by JR & Subway once you checked in and know the surrounding. However, need to provide more English TV channel.

Hotel was clean & quiet even tho placed in central Shinjuku. As already stated, Golden Gai is close by, as is many bars & small eateries & small supermarkt next door. Close also to traIn & subway stations. Breakfast provided plenty of options & worth the dollars. Unfortunately couldnt open window for fresh air. Would recommend.

It was my first time in Japan and wisely chose Citadines for it's location. Most restaurants were within walking distance and the train stations were also nearby. The rooms were small but most hotels in Japan have tiny rooms as well. Everything was clean and well maintained. Beds were comfortable and the bathroom was neat.

Excellent location, the Golden Gai is right out the back entrance. Kabukicho area is right out the front, Shinjuku Station is very close, as well as all the shopping you want. Room was just large enough, a little tight, but so what? Plenty of restaurants, Japanese Barbecue, Yakitori, Tonkatsu, Ramen, even Burger King. A couple Starbucks within short walking distance, convenience store right downstairs. Staff was always helpful and friendly. I would recommend for anyone wanting to experience some Tokyo nightlife.

Very happy with the stay as the hotel was clean and new. Had the restaurant breakfast daily which was a buffet and the food ranged from full cooked to continental with the added touch of Japanese dishes. Both the reception and restaurant staff were all extremely friendly. There is also a convenience store at the bottom of the lift. Laundry facilities are also available. Don’t expect a large room but it was not so small that you feel uncomfortable. The reception, room or restaurant didn’t smell of cigarette smoke like some places in Japan do.

Great location, facilities staff were excellent and breakfast was really nice great variety and plenty of. Breakfast was also very reasonable and discounted for guests.Staff helped us and arranged extra night and phoned to arrange transfer.Would recommend this hotel.

We loved our stay! From the moment we arrived we could leave our luggage to start exploring the area. Location is fabulous & close to many shops, restaurants & bars.. the subway is very close also.The reception staff were excellent & extremely helpful at all times.

We stayed here for two nights in September. The things I like was the location is very central and close to train station (although it is very red light district), staff were helpful and rooms were a decent size for Japan.What really ruined the stay was we ordered a non-smoking room however it stunk of cigarette smoke which I think was coming through the air conditioning vent, we could not open the window and there was hair from someone else in our bed.

Great location! Area is well known for its vibrant night life and although we are not party animals, felt very safe walking at night (3 female travellers) even had a few drinks at a local bar and finished the night with some karaoke. 10 min easy walk to Shinjuku train station, no issues. Lovely staff, very helpful. Clean, comfortable accommodation. Would happily stay again.

Stayed at Citadines Central Shinjuku for 3 nights - based off Trip Advisor reviews. This hotel is located in the center of Tokyo's red light district so at night it can be quite rowdy and a ton of touts out and about. We arrived on a Saturday night so it was VERY busy and crowded. We were approached by touts even though we were a couple. Golden Gai is conveniently located right beside the hotel but it was too busy. Drinks avg. 800yen and some bars charge cover. I would drink elsewhere. The hotel is not on the main st. You must access it from either the escalator or elevator. Hotel also had a musky (old) smell when you first enter. It wasn't pleasant.Front night staff were okay - they asked to see our passports when we arrived and took them to their office for a brief moment. Not too sure for what purpose. If you stay on 11th floor or higher - room key is required for elevator. This was one plus. The rooms and bathrooms were dated. Bathroom was not really clean and it had a tub and a shower. The bed had a long piece of hair and was against the wall. The hotel did not have good sound proofing so we would hear people in the day and outside at night. Although conveniently located near Shinjuku station (second plus) I would not recommend this hotel for anyone staying in Tokyo. The hotel is dated and it gave us this uneasy feeling at night. Stay elsewhere for a better experience. We definitely will not be staying at this hotel again when we visit Tokyo.

Stayed for week with my husband for our honeymoon. The staff prepared a little welcome card for us with some sweets! Very touching indeed! Everything during our stay went smooth, the front desk was really nice, excellent customer service. They speak good english as well. The hotel is strategically located near the train station and bus station and a good walking distance away from everything. Lawson Convenience Store is located on the 1st floor of the hotel. Although it is near the red light district, the place is really safe.

I recently stayed at Citadines Central Shinjuku Tokyo for 4 nights during the middle of September. The hotel is located approximately a 5 minute walk from Shinjuku Metro Train Station. The hotel staff can speak fluent English which is a massive bonus when in Japan. The hotel also has a self serve laundromat with approximately 5 - 6 washing machines & dryers. I stayed in a Studio Double Room which I found extremely small. It was only myself & my partner staying in the room but we both found it slightly claustrophobic at times. There is also a lot of nose & light coming off the street throughout the night as there are many bars surrounding the hotel. Overall the hotel wasn’t bad value for money in comparison to the price of other hotels in the same area.

We had two rooms on level 13 as we were traveling with sons 17 and 15yrs. Rooms were decent size considering it's Japan. Clean, modern with all the usual amenities. Bonus there is a laundry on level 7 as we were staying one week. You could get CNN on TV - only English station. Yes it is on the border of the red light district BUT we found a fairly direct route from Shinjuku station to the hotel which cut most of it out. It's an area that never shuts down, gaming, arcades, restaurant, bars etc. would recommend it for our situation with teenagers.

Where to start, its very central to everything in Shinjuku. Now if you've looked into booking here, you'll of no doubt seen some reviews already, and if you haven't looked into some reviews, allow me to break it down.First the bad, but to be totally honest I didn't find it any trouble. Multiple reviews I've read list groups of black men hanging near the hotel, trying to get you into bars or what ever. Nobody approached me or my partner once, or even attempted to. Whilst I did notice the men, and a certain older lady who was hanging around the area every night, we had absolutely no trouble or ever felt in danger.Now the good. The hotel is very easy to find from the main Shinjuku station. (Look up the video on YouTube) Its very clean with no disturbances even with it being central to everything including Golden Gai. Fresh sheets, towel's, robe's and slippers every day. Tea, coffee and water replenished everyday also. Lawson's is literally on the doorstep!A little bonus tip when staying here and becoming more confident with the subway. Get off at Shinjuku Sanchome. If you come out Exit E2, or B2 I can't remember which but one brings you out next to the shrine. Its closer and easier to get back to the hotel than the main Shinjuku station. Overall when I return to Tokyo, I wouldn't think twice about rebooking. Great hotel, friendly staff and over all made the stay amazing. Also they somehow found out it was my birthday and left a little note and present. Great stay, more than I expected. Safe secure and enjoyable. Great breakfast options with Japanese mannerisms you'd expect in Japan. STAY HERE!!!! An no I'm not receiving anything for this long review, I just really enjoyed my stay and the hotel was so nice.

Hotel is about a 10 minute walk from Shinjuku station. Located right next to the busy restaurant / red light district. We felt safe and amused. Hotel is clean and well located. We didn't eat at the restaurant. Lawson's downstairs , super handy.

Their service is excellent and they able to speak english, great as there wont be any communication break down. Easy to more around from the hotel...nearby subway train station,shopping mall,bus terminal and for halal food also quite near to find.
