We stayed at this hotel three times during a trip to Japan and found it to be clean, efficient and very well located, just a short walk from the Shinjuku train station. Besides the hotel's virtues, including an excellent breakfast buffet, the immediate neighbourhood throbs with life.

i stayed 3 nights in august/September, great location (about 10min walk to Shinjuku station). its located in a very lively area near restaurants, shops and bars ( red-light district) and it was not an issue at all, very safe and no one will bother you while walking.welcoming staff with big smile and good english. The room was large compared to other hotel pictures. A/C was good and WIfI was fast and free, bathroom was nice and large with bathtub. i havent use the Hotel restaurant. room service was great and fast.the bed couold be bigger but that was ok for me

We stayed for 4 nights in August and loved the location - approx 10min walk to Shinjuku station and in a lively part of town near heaps of restaurants, shops and bars. The room was very clean but small - our double bed was up against the wall which was a little uncomfortable at times. Air con was good and quiet, bathroom was modern and huge (for Japan) and had a bath (jackpot)! Hotel restaurant does a reasonably priced buffet breakfast and has a nice atmosphere and friendly staff. The main street gets busy Fri-Sun so ask for a room facing the back if you're a light sleeper. Note, being the red light district we saw a few unsavory characters hanging around the shops on the ground floor each night but we never felt unsafe.

The hotel is located in the middle of Shinjuku and is close to everything from the train, restaurants and shopping centres to museums and game centres. Besides having very helpful staff members, the rooms are very clean and modern.

This hotel is within about 800 metres of Shinjuku station and although it's a little hard to find at first in the sea of commercial signs and unmarked local roads, but once there - look for the ground level "Citadines sign and take the elevator to 3F - it is a first class facility. Rooms are comfortable and large by Japanese standards. The breakfast is excellent, so good that lunch is unnecessary when out on the town in Tokyo. Highly recommended.
user_name:
Mike T
Ladysmith, British Columbia, Canada

review_body: We couldn't fault the hotel, comfy beds, helpful staff, good room service. Unfortunately, the location was not so good. Although situated in central Shinjuku it is also on the edge of the red light district. Lots of noise at night, mainly police sirens, we were on the 4th floor and it still woke us up. Going out in the morning we saw the remnants of the nights activities, girls just going home and lots of rubbish on the street. Basically, as long as you turn left out of the hotel and not right you should be ok as did not feel threatened but would think twice if we had children with us.
user_name:
Gail B
Winchester, England, United Kingdom

review_body: Nice, quiet, clean stylish hotel at 10 minutes from Shinjuku station. Very professional and kind staff. The rooms are small, but quite big in comparison with other Japanese hotels. We would recommend it!

Our room is smallOne bed (size 160cm) to share two personMy sister room upgraded about 50$ a nightAnd they got a twin room with a bed size 140 cm eachThe space in the room is not too big tooBut its worthedIts close to train station and lots of restaurants closebyThere are ichiran ramen, gyukatsu motomura, woku tonkatsuDonquijiteLots of drugstoreNightclubsKaraokeEtcAnd most importantLawson is just infront of the lift doorConvenient

Great hotel and lovely service! Close to everything in Shinjuku. Room was comfortable and the bathroom is a good size. I would recommend to anyone for their first stay in Tokyo. Staff were very helpful!

Staff's service& the room's facilities are very good. The room is very cleaned. They refill bottled water everyday which made me very satisfied. Hotel downstairs has a convenient store, the location is very convenient.

Second time that I stay in this hotel. I really recommended for location and services.Staff friendly and competent. Helpful if you need to book any taxis or bus.Breakfast nice and both continental and Japanese style.

Great location in Tokyo for getting around and to the Shijinku Station. And very quiet for a centrally located Hotel. The room is small, like most Tokyo hotels. They will check your baggage if you need a few hours to explore before you leave the hotel. Bed and pillows very hard.

Citadines Central in Shinjuku was a really solid hotel -- both a great value and in a great location. Having never been to Tokyo before - and being super jet lagged - we found it very easily and were checked in and given our room key within 90 seconds of getting there. The bed and pillows were pretty hard, but I've had worse. Everything else about the room was perfect. It was small but we knew that beforehand. I highly recommend the breakfast, especially if you have a long day of tourist activities ahead of you. It was well worth the $12 USD and had a nice mix of western and Asian cuisine. Overall great hotel and I highly recommend.

I always try to look for hotels with great location and the Citadines Central Shinjuku is one of them. It is close to everything - restaurants, shopping, and Shinjuku Station (East Exit) are a couple of blocks away. Although there are bars and nightclubs all over the area, the area is safe as there is a main road infront of the hotel....not just an alleyway. The lobby is on the 3rd Floor so you have to take the elevator to the entrance of Lawson market. Check in was fast and easy. The room ( double) is small as most Japanese room. The small window opens and lets the fresh air in. WIFI is good. The bathtub is short for those hot baths after taking a shower outside the tub which is fully enclosed by glass. Shampoo/Conditioners/Boady soap are in big push down containers. Brew your own coffee packet and tea replenished daily. Staff was very happy to help me purchase some online tickets and even went down to Lawson to help me purchase it online.Check out was also easy. I would come back to this hotel and would highly recommend it.

The hotel is good located, but you should be aware Kabuki-cho night life.It's always nice to have 7-eleven nearby. Also there are some discounts for local cafe if you do not purchase breakfast. You will get what you paid for if you will stay here.Would love to stay hear next time,Also, Shinjuku station is one of NEX stations, so it's an easy access to airport,

good location and convenience. comfortable and helpful. Helpdesk can solve my problem. Lawson convenience store is near this hotel. Many restaurant near this hotel and 24 hrs. near metro station and JR station

Stayed 5 nights during trip to Tokyo (booked by mistake instead of Citadenes which is close and has better review (this is called Citadines central)).Pluses:- location is very good. In the heart of Shinjuku - but a little away. 2 mins walk to Robot restaurant and 3 to Godzilla street;- good service by stuff.Minuses:- horribly slow Internet. Probably one of slowest I had (both laptop and phone);- price is higher then average similar hotel around area (like Apa) 20-30%;Rooms are ok (not very cosy). Cold feeling at reception and breakfast area. Breakfast is ok. Focused on foreigners. Don't recommend and don't do not recommend.... just ok .

We really enjoyed our stay here. As English people, it was nice to be able to get a double room and a breakfast that we were more accustomed to (bacon, sausage, cereal, yogurt, pastries, and cooked eggs).In terms of location, this place has great access. Close to Shinjuku train station and surrounded by loads of shops, bars and restaurants. This does mean that you might get a bit of hassle from promoters while walking to and from the hotel. Staff were helpful and able to communicate easily with our minimal knowledge of the Japanese language.

Location is fab - near to eateries, night spots, JR Shinjuku Station. Service at the hotel is excellent. Staff are friendly and always ready to help. There is no luggage barrier. Will definitely stay here again when I next visit Tokyo.

Easy access to station although not that close but shopping & food is convenient. Location is just off the main street of Shinjuku. Only negative side is that I find the bed to be on the soft side and one side of the queen size bed is against the wall.

great location easy to get around, not far from train station , close to great shopping and bars restaurants, very helpful staff easy to grab a taxi, small rooms better with an upgrade to higher floor

We stayed here for our honeymoon for 5 nights and it's perfect.. Only down thing is you have to pay to watch a movie - $15 Aud...But other then that would total stay here again it is in a prime location the Golden Gai is just behind the hotel.

Location seem so well, but not feel so comfort with those 'GUY" stand around the hotel ground floor, and bars are located around the hotel, so that not feel so safe with the environment. if u are girls trip / Girl self trip by yr own, not so recommend.

We only stayed in this hotel for one night at the end of our holiday but the room was lovely! Very spacious for a central Tokyo hotel. The staff were friendly and helpful and we were able to check in early and check out an hour late with no extra charges. We were also able to leave our luggage at the hotel while we went and explored Shinjuku before leaving for the airport.Location was awesome, right in the centre of Shinjuku and minutes away from countless shops, restaurants and the train stations.I would definitely stay again.

This is a conveniently located hotel close to Metro stations and excellent places to eat. Rooms are small but clean - one side of the bed is against the wall but it is very clean. Amazing local area to walk around and the lights are fascinating.The staff in the hotel were super friendly and couldn't do enough to help or advise.

Good location for Tokyo exploring, five-minute walk to metro lines (although bit of a seedy area); very close to convenience stores and restaurants; English speaking staff; quiet at night; comfy bed and great shower. Room I had on 4F (410) was quite small – OK for a solo traveller but definitely would be a squeeze for two. Would go back.

This little hotel does not look like much from the outside- in fact, you would probably miss it if you weren't looking! However, the interior is lovely. The staff at the front counter were most friendly, and extremely helpful. We had a problem with our bedding configuration, where they had the teens sharing a very small double bed- still unsure whether this was a fault of our agent or the hotel, however, they upgraded the two rooms free of charge! The rooms were tiny, and I didn't like the fact that it was a double bed up against the wall, it did make it a bit squishy, but it is Japan, and we knew their hotels were smaller than what we would be used to. The bed was incredibly comfortable. There is no pool at this hotel, but we were only there for three days, and had heaps of sight seeing to do, so it didn't bother us. I would recommend this hotel, as the location was good, and above all, the staff should be commended by how friendly, efficient and professional they were.

As like other comments, the hotel is in a very convenient location. However, this is Shinjuku, and I will not walk alone in late night by myself. The room is very clean and modern, the size is OK. The bathroom is good except no hanging hooks for the clothes.

The hotels location is so central. Close to the Metro to get around the train system. In the heart of the entertainment district, Robot restaurant & bars. JR Shinjuku station train line to Hakone & Mt Fuji only 10 min walk. Tokyo rooms can be compact our room was acceptable & comfortable. Convenience store & cheap food outlets near by. Shopping within a block from hotel.

Very Excellent location. Very comfortable hotel in everything. So clean room . The bath room is very big. Front reception is very nice and helpful in many things. No car parking but hotel is very near with a branch of Toyota Rent A Car.

The hotel is placed in a convenient area. Not only it offers clean and confortable roolms, but also laundry service, which is crucial if you do not want to spend a fortune sending.all your dirty clothes to the laundry. The sttructure also gives you the chance to iron if you want. The staff is more than kind, gentle, helpful. They are perfect. It was a blessing after a 12 hours.flight, to be hosted in this hotel. My first impression on magic Japan was the best.

Pros: Fantastic location - easy walking distance to everything. Little super market in building handy. Very clean and comfortable, staff pleasant and check in/out quick. Buffet breakfast was extra cost and ok. Cons: Rooms very small but understand this is Japan

Good and central location, a clean and practical hotel. Effective staff. In-house self service laundry possibility is very practical. Some noise from the street.Avoid standard double room if you are a couple - a very small double bed.

The Goods:The location of the hotel near JR Shinjuku station Metro stations, restaurants and shopping malls which is convenient.The staffs are sincere and helpful which you should love it.The room is clean and tidy which you should feel comfortable.Need improved:The internet service is slow as there are many residents staying.The breakfast is getting poorer and poorer year by year. Limited selection, temperature of the hot dishes need to improve. Fruit didn't refill to satisfy the needed for the customers.

At first glance, it seems like a typical business hotel. But inside, it's really clean and nice. Rooms feel more spacious than they look. After a long sweaty day of walking around the city, the high pressure shower is bombLocation can't be beat. Shinjuku is a super fun area. Golden Gai is right next door for drinks in tiny bars with fellow travelers. Train station is a 5-10 minute walk away. Staff is super friendly. They were able to hold our luggage when we checked out for a few days to go explore Kyoto and Osaka for a few days, which was amazingly helpful.

This was our first trip to Japan. We were in touch with hotel personnel in advance to request a room that suited our preferences. In this regard and in every other we were grateful for how friendly and accommodating the staff was! Our room was immaculate, in good repair, and well attended during the course of our stay. We enjoyed the daily breakfast. The hotel was conveniently situated and we enjoyed evening strolls in the brightly lit streets. Also, we enjoyed the view from our room which was on an upper floor as we had requested.We were thoroughly happy with this hotel. We definitely benefited from our advance read of other people's recommendations.

This is our second time staying at this hotel (we stayed 6 nights). It is really well situated and the staff are very helpful! They helped us with all our queries without hesitation. It is only a 5-10 min walk to the metro and the train station and near all kinds of shops and restaurants. The only downside with this hotel is that the rooms and double beds are very small.

The Citadines, originally an apartment hotel concept, has been transposed to Tokyo where it preserved the affordable rates but somehow jettisoned the spacious element of the apartment (which is, after all, quite logical). It's worth mentioning as the web site pictures give an impression of spacious, airy rooms with plenty of natural lights and the reality is just one notch below that. There are two Citadines hotels in Shinjuku so make sure you chose the right one for your own requirements not least in terms of district and proximity to train and subway stations. Kabukicho is a lively district, apparently not enjoying a very good reputation with the locals, but all is relative and we have found it to be entirely safe, plus the presence of touts in the street is not the preserve of Kabukicho, you used to have quite a few in Akasaka as well. The Hotel is very well served in terms of subway, although it can be a nightmare to find the right exit and you will end up using Godzilla as a landmark to guide you. The rooms are generally nice if a bit tiny (but still not as tiny as other places such as the Mitsui City Garden) and the furnishings are a bit more tired that the web pictures would suggest. Rather quiet for the district, good bedding and functional bathroom. Friendly front desk. Final note: Citadines are now part of The Ascott hotel chain and if you register on their web site you will get immediate discounted priced for your stay.

Stayed in another Citadines hotel in Germany which was good therefore considered this one in Tokyo. Booked via official website, good early-bird non-cancellation rate. Good location in Shinjuku busiest area easy to explore and eat around. Take a bit of walk from the station. Staff speak good English. The reception is on 3/F u hv to look for the not very prominent sign and lift taking u to the hotel lobby.Room on 11/F, spacious enough for Tokyo standard, but not as clean and neat as expected, aged room, looked dull and old maybe due to color of the room and bed sheet, which were yellowish. Large bathroom with tub, cleanliness ..... in doubt.Good thing was they have the self-laundry provided at cheap price.Might not go back again, but it s still considerable for others.

I've stay here for 4 nights. The location is pretty good. You can get the public transportation easily. The room is large and clean. Isetan department store is very nearest. Good for shopping. Breakfast is nice.

We stayed here for 6 nights while in Tokyo. The rooms are clean and functional. Small but good for Japan. The double bed was pushed against the wall which meant that one of us had to climb over the other to get in. They gave us one breakfast voucher for each day. You could use them together if you wanted to. The hotel reception is on the 3rd floor with a Lawson on the ground floor. This sells stuff for breakfast and beer etc. very handy. The hotel is a good 10min walk from the main Shinjuku station so if you have luggage get a taxi (cost about Y600) from the East exit of the station. After that you can get the metro that is closer to the hotel on the Maranuchi line. This is called Shinjuku sanchome. Our rooms looked out over the Golden Gai. Worth a walk through at night. There are plenty of restaurants near by. We enjoyed our stay as the staff at reception were very helpful and friendly.

Strategic place for shinjuku area, great service. If just the room is better it would be really nice to stay there. Since the place is close with the tourist area and the shinjuku shopping area is just at the back of the hotel

This hotel is in the middle of amazing Shinjuku. It's a 9 minute walk from the East Exit of Shinjuku Station. The back of the hotel is the Golden Gai with a quiet alleyway. It's a walk to everything. You will never get bored in this area, lots of restaurants and shopping area. ThE staff are amazingly friendly and accommodating. Our room is facing the street, but it's really quiet. The rooms are small and cozy, but comfortable.

We thought that we got a really good deal at the price we got. I didn't expect luxury but still I was shocked at how small our room was. Nevertheless, the room was clean, the bathroom had sufficient amenities (including a hairdryer), we had a safe, coffeemaker, ref and TV. The lobby was spacious and comfortable. There was also free wifi service in the rooms and lobby. We also got our daily allowance of bottled water. We liked the location as it was accessible to shopping and eating areas though not really close to a metro station. There is also a restaurant on the second floor that serves great udon and tempura meals. Having a Lawson's at the ground floor is also a big plus. The staff was pleasant and polite. I will most likely go back to Citadines Central but this time, I'll get a bigger room!

good customer services with good location which is very nice to customer for looking for.strongly recommend people come here to stay but better not only a girl. it is better to have friends to accompany to stay at this place(Shinjuku).

The area itself is a bit complicated. There are a lot of "agents" offering special service. If you are fine with these situations, it is an excellent choice for your stay at the heart of Tokyo given the reasonable price.

Went here with a few friends on the last leg of our tour and we loved the location, facilities and the location. It's pretty central, only a 5min walk to the robot restaurant and about the same for a subway or train. The only 'negative' thing was the white noise at night time. Since it's on a busy district you can still hear the hustle and bustle of the nightlife. It was fine for us but if you want total peace and quiet, maybe try somewhere else.

A good clean and well kept hotel in the heart of all attractions a five to ten minutes walk to Shinjuku Station. Right behind the hotel is the all famous Golden Gai. Rooms are little you shouldn't expect more in Tokyo but good enough for a Solo traveler not sure if they have a better rooms for couples. There is a small Lawson store right below the Hotel which comes in very handy. Staff at reception speaks good English and are more than happy to help you out with your queries. Breakfast is good, not very humongous but have all what you need.

This hotel is fabulous with large clean rooms and great bathroom and amenities. The staff from check in to check out which was two rooms for 5 nights were polite professional and lovely the location is very very good and the pricing of the hot is extremely cost effec for Tokyo. We were on the 10th floor with fabulous views. Will stay here again and will recommend to friends.

This being our first time ever in Tokyo, we wanted to stay in a lively area and this place did not disappoint. The hotel itself is an easy 5-10 minute walk from the Shinjuku train station. The Golden Gai is a couple blocks away, but if you get too claustrophobic there are a ton of other restaurants around. The hotel rooms are small, which I'm pretty sure is standard for hotel rooms in Japan but they offer all the standard amenities. Our booking came with a free breakfast (for 1 person) which was a good value, and they also offered a 20% discount if you wanted to purchase additional breakfast buffet tickets. One great hotel amenity is the automatic currency exchange machine in the lobby. The rate was slightly lower that what we had seen at the train station, but not too big of a difference. The staff was very accommodating and helpful. They even allowed us to store our luggage there for a couple days while we took the train to Kyoto, although we did return and checked back in for our last night in Japan.Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel!

The location is ok and within reasonable walking distant to subway. The hotel area is ok, in the red light district of Shinjuku. The room is self is good, slightly bigger than average hotel. However, the bathroom is really small. Internet also not as fast as the other hotel that I stayed in japan.Overall, it was average stay.

The location is very good to get to Shinjuku JR station and other subway stations nearby. Out of the hotel is the popular Kabukicho area with many delicious food and restaurants and shopping malls. The hotel has very good services in check-in and check-out and the room is clean everyday.The breakfast has a lot of selections in Japanese and western styles. Coffee is very good. A good start in the morning must be from this good breakfast!

Very confortable room, clean and perfect services from the receptionist that helped us to find the train to move on from Tokyo. perfect place to move around shinjuku and Tokyo in general.I absolutely recommend this hotel

This was my third time staying at this hotel and it remains my top choice for Tokyo. The rooms are large and comfortable (for Tokyo), the location is excellent--close to transportation, shopping, restaurants and nightlife, and the staff is always ready to help with anything you need for your stay. The breakfast buffet is good and reasonably priced. Overall, Citadines is a terrific value in this expensive city. I will stay here again on future trips to Tokyo and recommend it without hesitation.

Great service, quality rooms, location. Amazing place for tourists. They accomodate for everyone's needs in a friendly and polite manner. In the future I will be strongly recommending this place to my peers.

Easy to access from subway, many restaurants around hotel, have a Lawson convinience store, located in the 'heart' of Shinjuku, polite staff, the staff care to their guest as they have solution to make us comfortable

Room size and price reasonable and clean. Location near JR/Metro station for only 10 minutes. But the area around the hotel being worse than before. I have been disturb by stranger when I am walking back to hotel with my friend. It was scare me.

Very close to the Subnade which makes for an easy walk to Shinjuku station. We found after a couple of days finding our way around that it was very easy to walk with our luggage to catch the Narita Express out to the airport. The hotel room was small but clean and comfortable, and the shampoo, conditioner etc supplied was excellent quality in big pump action containers!

overall pleasant stay, with very helpful staff. the staff did not hestitate to provide us additional services when enquired. the room was spacious overall and feel very clean, thought the bathroom door there's no locks. however the positive traits outshines the negative part making this trip a successful and memorable one with citadines. would recommend this to others when they are visiting japan.

Western hotel with high standard serving almost entirely occidental guests (only Western rooms available, no Japanese rooms).It is situated right in the middle of busy Shinjuku, next to the huts serving as mini pubs (Shinjuku Golden Gai). Quiet rooms although the occasional siren can be heard. We were at the executive floor, which was tranquil and with ample space at least for Japanese standards.

This hotel is in the heart of Shinjuku. A business hotel so it's very simple but good for spending a few days there. I spent 6 days there and the rooms are on the smaller side but if your close with your partner it's fine to deal with. I think any longer and I would of gone mad. The staff are lovely and couldn't do enough for you with anything you threw there way. There is a shop on the ground floor which is convenient. If you can't read Japanese you will struggle immensely so do some research or look for things that look familiar to you. Reception is on the 3rd floor to get the lift up and it leads straight into reception. Would stay here again.

The quality is match as i paid.1.Location is very convenient, and the staff is kind friendly2.It's near Shinjuku station , far from 10 mins, so there are many Pimp on the street in red - light district3.The bathroom is clear4.It4.

very central to the hustle and bustle of shinjuku. staff were so helpful when we arrived early in the morning. they stored our bags for the day and were very attentive to our then 7 month old.after checking out and heading to kyoto for a few days they stored our bags again to help ease lugging everything on the bullet train and back before heading to the airport.breakfast choices were great.the room was quite small but i feel this is the norm in tokyo.

very nice hotel with variety choices in breakfast, room size is ok, not big but not so tiny, location is good , renovation is quite new , overall very good experience on staying in this hotel. overall good.

i would stay again, all staffs are really nice. they are friendly.room & bath room were clean and good.but i felt little unsafe around hotel in the night because i saw some African Americans solicited openly in the streets. Anyway overall things were good.

Very good service from the staff and they are willing to send the post card for us. Good location and easy to find. And there are 7-11 and lawson just near the hotel. I will recommend this hotel to my friends and family and also book this hotel next time.

Good room size (by Tokyo's standard) and good location (10mins walk 900m from Shinjuku station via Kabukicho). Located at the sleazier side of Kabukicho (just ignore the touts hanging around), we still felt safer than walking along Australia's red light districts. Plenty of restaurants and shops around (feels like Kabukicho doesn't sleep), but no noise in our room.Good breakfast selection, helpful front desk arranged luggage forwarding and rang the next hotel to follow up. Coin laundry available.

Enjoyed a cozy hotel room in great location. Having a shop at the bottom floor was very convenient. The breakfast buffet was really good and staff was very friendly and helpful. Some reviewer said the hotel was in the middle of the red light district and although we did see a lot of guys advertising to enter the clubs, none of them bothered us. Always felt safe and the vibe of shinjuku was electric. Loved the stay and would definitely stay here again!

This hotel is central to lots of places. Friendliness, Cleanliness and Helpfulness all a big . The breakfast was extensive and tasty. The staff were very friendly and when we needed help, they would go out of their way to help.

We enjoyed our stay very much. The location was central, the staff very helpful and the amenities great. Rooms were a fair size for Tokyo and the bath was perfect. The coffee filter bags were a revelation!

This hotel was really conveniently located. It's about a 10 minute walk from Shinjuku station and is surrounded by bars and restaurants. The hotel is pretty standard-nice set up, smaller than the standard US hotel room but that's to be expected pretty much anywhere outside of the US. They also have a pretty good map at the front desk that highlights restaurants, bars and attractions in the area.

Overall is good with good location and easily transport to Shinjuku station. The staffs are quite helpful. No free green tea pack is provide in the roon, that is a little bit disappointed. Toliet is clean and the bed size is enough for couples with a space quite large so we can pack up luggage more comfortable (no need to put the luggage on the bed).

Spent the last two nights of our Japanese trip here and I can't fault this hotel. Tha location is central for everything within Shinjuku and is next to the Golden Gai. All the staff where lovely and the room where clean and had all the amenities you need. A very value for money and would highly recommend this hotel.

Insanely good bang for the buck in one of the most character-filled areas of Shinjuku, right next to the Bladerunner bars of Golden Gai, the sleaziness of Kabukicho, and the great fine dining and hustle + bustle of Shinjuku Sanchome. Citadines was our perfect introduction to Japan. There's even a 24 hour Lawson convenience store downstairs! The only downside is it's a good 8-10 minutes walk from the most useful transfer points in Shinjuku Station, which, if you're super overwhelmed and tired, is not the most relaxing walk. Otherwise, if you're an adventuresome 20-35 year old who'd gladly weather a bit of grit for maximal dose of that unique Tokyo character and charm, this is the place to be. The interiors aren't even gritty at all, as it seems very new inside!

Due to an issue with our return flight our travel agent booked us in to this hotel for our last night in Tokyo.As it was paid for by them I can't be too critical. Good point was the location in the heart of Shinjuku. Bad points were the rooms were small and dated but still clean.Front desk staff were very helpful but overall the experience was a bit disappointing.

I had previously stayed at a Citadines property in London, but this property exceeded all of my expectations. It is about a 9 minute walk from Shinjuku Station. Very easy to get to, even when rolling your luggage. It is surrounded by restaurants, bars and the vibrant energy of Shinjuku. After a day of sight seeing, it was very convenient to have the nightlife right on our door step. The rooms are very comfortable in size and housekeeping keeps them immaculate. We enjoyed the complimentary bottled water that kept getting refilled in our fridge every day. The staff is very attentive, welcoming and speak perfect English. All in all, great place to stay and I would definitely come back.

I would recommend this hotel in almost every way - there is only one slight negative, which I'll get out of the way first: our room (a deluxe double) was very, very small. With two large suitcases, there was only a one-way single-person passageway through the room. However, overall, this is a minor issue.- The room is very well-equipped, with large and comfortable kingsize bed, television, safe, sofa, desk, WiFi, non-smoking (though smoking rooms are available), air conditioner, and all the usual amenities you'd expect to find in a hotel of this kind. Everything was spotlessly clean.- Despite the size of the room, the bathroom was very big (almost equal to the size of the room), with wetroom/bath/shower separated (and well-divided) from toilet/sink area.- The staff were excellent: very friendly, amenable, approachable, and very well-informed (in English). Our cab driver initially dropped us to the wrong Citadines hotel (a 15min walk or 3min cab drive from Citadines Central), the staff in the other hotel called a cab on our behalf and directed the new driver appropriately. I found the same level of helpfulness at Citadines Central.- The location is near-perfect for a hotel in central Tokyo. You're in the middle of the hustle and bustle of Shinjuku. Despite this centrality, we had no issue with noise in our room. The view from the room was a magnificent high-rise cityscape.- Breakfast was very good. Slightly small in its range, but still with a contintental and Japanese style. Overall, well-recommended, would stay here again.

Spent a couple of days here prior to a cruise out of Yokohama. We found the staff to be excellent, with very good English, perfect for those of us who don't speak Japanese. The rooms were smallish but comfortable, after all who spends all day in the room. Breakfast was extremely good with a good choice and lots of it. The hotel sits in the middle of the Shinjuku entertainment area and has lots of inexpensive places to eat nearby serving all types of Japanese or other cuisines. We would consider this hotel if we visit again.

My son and I arrived to this hotel in Tokyo at 6:00am after about 20 hours of travel. I hadn't really thought this through - if I had I would have booked the hotel for the night before and been able to check in when we got there. After trying to summon up the energy to explore for several hours but failing, I pleaded with the front desk staff to let us check into a room early. I even offered to pay for the night before. They were so nice to accommodate us and refused my offer to pay. That was a life saver even before we got into the room! The room itself was larger than expected (standard twin room) and very quiet and comfortable. Be ready for a hard bed though! Walking distance to Shinjuku Station, and close to restaurants,etc. Laundry facilities on site. Convenience store right at the 1st floor. Great stay!
user_name:
Pam W
Anchorage, Alaska, United States

review_body: A nice hotel in shinjuku. The rooms are are OK in size, pretty big by Tokyo standards. Clean, and have what you need.Was able to check in early, which was nice.Hotel buffet was not too bad, pretty normal for this price range.All in all, for the price, location and standard it's a very good hotel in this area. Would stay again.

Stayed in a standard single/double room and liked:-the extra space for the little couch and desk-good wifi -good location-decent water pressure-decent breakfast buffetThe hotel is located close to JR Shinjuku station (15min walk) and surrounding subway stations.5mins away are the relaxing garden of Shinjuku Gyoen.Nightlife is very lively as it is very close to the Kabukicho district, and there is always a nice place to eat or drink to be found close by.The staff was extremely friendly and helpful.Rooms were clean.

Overall of hotel is quite good, nice location, nice staff and nice room. The room is much better as my expectation. I am very satisfied with the room price. I believe I will stay again when I go to Japan next time.

Booked this hotel for 2 nights with friend. A bit far from the JR station especially when carrying big luggage with you. Hotel entrance is hard to find too as it is not on the ground floor.A bit overprice when compare with other hotels that is much closer as the location, service, bed, utilities, cleanliness and food is only average. A lot of night clubs and bar close by if you enjoy night life though but not suitable for family with kids or if you have lots of luggage carrying with you as it is not a easy walk from JR station.

We rate this hotel as very good and worth the money. The location is perfect, naar Sinjuku station and in a lively quarter of Tokio. The room was OK and the backsite is quiet. We did not take a breakfast nut there plenty of breakfast possibilities nearby.

It's pretty nice location (tho beware of all those Nigerian people stalking around the place at night). The staff is friendly, rooms are cozy- but pretty small. Wifi connection is bad. Also much of the dissatisfaction is due to cleaners, who kept on banging at my door and screaming tho i was sleeping and the door was barred. Took them around 10 mins to finally leaveOverall 4/5 or better 7/10

We stayed here for three nights and found it to be enjoyable overall. The hotel is in a good location, close to a JR line and from there it's easy to walk to the hotel. It's a little seedy late at night as it's in the red light district, but we didn't have any trouble. The room and bathroom were a good size and happy with the amenities. We were on the 11th floor so no issues with road noise. We had breakfast included, and although they advertise their breakfast across the hotel we didn't really find it anything spectacular. I didn't like the eggs and my husband didn't like the sausages, so we just had toast and the pastries each morning. Still enough to fill you up, but had better. If we were to return to Tokyo, I would happily stay here again. They laid out a little personal welcome note on arrival and the same again with a few chocolates for my husbands birthday.

The location is unbeatable- between 2-3 metro and JR stations; just a stone throw away from shopping malls with street shopping ranging from electronic goods (BIC camera), to high end retail (Gucci and LV) to Uniqlo and Muji. There are also a lot of restaurants and watering holes around the vicinity. In terms of the hotel, it is quite in need of a renovation. Old carpet, tired sheets, and cleanliness can be improved. Hotel amenities are a little less than what is typically expected of Japan hotels- they only provide soap, shampoo, conditioners... no facial cleanser, no cotton buds and no moisturizer.

Easy check in and check out. Nice, clean room. Except for the lack of room service, everything you need is there. Loved the heated toilet seat and bathroom amenities. There's a Lawson in the building and a 7-11 next door. There's even a coin operated laundromat in the 7th floor. Located in Kabukicho but actually not in the busiest section. Near the train station but use Google maps so you won't get lost in finding the place. Landmarks are Mister Donut and Shinjuku Ward Office. This is our first time in Tokyo and we did not regret booking at this hotel.

Position position position. If coming by Narita express take the east exit. It's about 5-6 minutes walking if u know where u r going. We stayed 3 nights. Had booked a deluxe double room and once we saw the size decided to upgrade to room 1311- Much bigger with two double beds it's a good choice. The hotel gave a discount on the upgrade. The amenities are good shampoo conditioner shower gel hairdryer toothbrushes razors etc etc Hotel staff very obliging. The area is buzzing and very safe and the Golden Gai just behind hotel is a quaint ramshackle couple of very narrow lanes definitely worth a visit.

this hotel located pretty close to station and it was good to travel.and the staffs was very kind and everyone greeted to us.and the convenient store was located in front of the hotels 1F! it was very convinent!

Good choice in Shinjuku Tokyo, not too far from the main station. Staff are nice and efficient. Rooms are nice too, very clean and comfortable. Have been here for several times, and the service quality is well maintained.

In a very interesting and convenient location just 10 mins from JR Shinjuku, right in the heart of Kabuki-cho where all the action of Shinjuku is. But very safe as the reception is at level 3 instead of the usual ground floor so away from the sleaze etc. Room sound proofing is excellent as you can't hear all the noise from the streets at all! Room facilities is good. Very clean and spacious for a Japanese hotel! Had a good soak in the tub. Breakfast was lovely but you are surrounded by so many eateries that I would suggest JUST SKIP the breakfast option. There is a Lawson convenience store just right downstairs at the ground floor and a 7-11 just 2 shops away, should hunger pangs strike you in the middle of the night. But again, many eateries open till dawn. I only disliked the bedsheets, which was a little rough for me and the too-flat pillows. Otherwise, Citadines is a reputable hotel, staff speaks great English, won't go wrong with it!

Friendly staff and also guests staying there. Great rooms and clean. Location is very convenient and there is a convenience store on the Ground floor as well. Very satisfied with the overall experience.

Location was great, about 5 to 10 mins from Shinjuku JR station. Lots of shopping and dining options in the area. Room was of a good size, there was even space for a small sofa in the room, and the bathroom was spacious and well-lit too! :)

We stay at this hotel for more than 5 times. Since the location is good, it always be our first choice if we come to Tokyo.As we always come with our child, clean and tidy envionment is our main concern. Their bathroom is quite spacious (comparing with other hotels in Shinjuku with similar price) when we take shower with my son. Check-in staff is very nice and the staff who make up room are very good.We definitely will choose this hotel for our next visit (very soon)!!!!!

The hotel location is good especially if you are a UFO catcher fan. The hotel room is clean and pleasant. The staffs are nice and service is good. There is also a 24 hour convenience store at the ground floor level.

I was there during 17 to 19 April 2017, room are clean and spaces but only weak point is the staff do not let me check in early, must wait until 1400 then able to check in.overall still the good hotel to stay.

Tiny rooms with no storage space so allow for suitcases to sit on the bed floor or the only small settee. No available drawers to use. Only one person at a time can move around the room because of suitcases. Breakfast is too expensive and not very good. The location is good. Close to railway stations and the main road. Right next door to the Golden Gai which is very interesting. Lots of eateries within walking distance. The Govt buildings are worth a visit. Go to the top (free) and you may see Mt Fuji on a clear day. Gardens, museum, art gallery, are within walking distance. If traveling by train, remember that Shinjuku station is the busiest in Japan. The area is full of overseas tourists. Window was double glazed and our 8th floor was quiet at night. Air con was very quiet also.

That Citadines is a very pleasant local, with confortable rooms and nice staff. it's location is very good near train and metro station. There a lot of restaurants and shops near and also the nice Shinjuku Park. Even the noise of the Kabukicho area we dont't listen from the apartments.

With polite and courteous staff, walking distance from the Shinjuku station and prime location in the Kabukicho area, we highly recommend staying at this hotel. The room size was very good. The reputation the street has for touting wasnt observed, and we felt safe walking around at night. The staff spoke great English and were only too happy to help with any inquiries. Whilst we didnt opt for it, breakfast was available.Will definitely stay again at this excellent hotel.

It was an excellent place to stay. It is in a convenient location despite being in an area of more adult activity. It is close to Golden Gai, Kabukicho, Isetan, Shinjuku Station, Omoide Yokocho. Although the night activity is high the rooms were quiet.

The room size is okay, the service is very good, the location is ease for shopping and travelling to other place. However, the bed is a little bit small. There is a Lawson in the hotel which is very convenient.

Our family of 4 stayed here for 5 days during april. The customer service is exceptional, and everything met our standards. Would willingly recommend to anyone. The only time I would not stay there is if you needed access consistently to the Kyoto Main station where the shinkansens leave from. We made a few day trips to Hiroshima and koyasan with luggage, and it was a trek to get to that station, however if you are staying in Kyoto, a perfect stop.

My second time to stay here and my 5th time for a Citadines property. Location-wise, its excellent. Close to Shinjuku Station, Shinjuku Gyoen and short ride to Shibuya, and other major attractions in central Tokyo.Room is great, always like Citadines room, although not too big but not too small either, just right without compromising the space. I don't usually take their breakfast option, specially in Tokyo where you can get cheap brekky from convenience stores. There's Lawson downstairs when you can eat breakfast, lunch or dinner. Japan's convenience stores has great selection of food and tasty too!Check-in was pretty fast and also had a pocket wifi sent to the hotel ahead of my arrival, able to handle it well with no issues.

We stayed at the Cytidines Central for 3 nights and had a great time....The Hotel is close to metro stations, bus terminals, shopping areas, restaurants and cafes.The breakfast was also excellent. Very clean and the breakfast staff very helpful in proving for my needs.The counter staff were also great. Spoke enough English to assist us with our check in and also with what to see in the area.I certainly would stay here again.

Let's start by check in: it was swift and efficient but not particularly friendly. Not a smile... Robotic receptionist. Nothing like the usual Japanese kindness. The room: very small, cleanish... the bed linen needs to be replaced asap. It is completely yellowed with stains. I guess it's been used in smoking rooms. I complained this morning and hopefully will get clean linen today... Very small double bed. Location: very central and lively. Yet, lots of black guys everywhere around the hotel trying to get you to go to the many whorehouses they have in the area. I don't know why they say touting is illegal, they're everywhere and don't seem to be hiding! Breakfast: comments were true. It's absolutely disgusting. I paid for it once, I won't do it again! All in all, a big disappointment for the price. It's not pricey but for about 130 € I expected higher standards as Japan is praised for its impeccability. Definitely does not reflect well the image of the country.

Staying at the Citadines Shinjuku was a good choice in terms of location. The station is only a short walk away. The area itself had a number of great restaurants and sights. The room was clean and serviced daily even though on the small side. Reasonably priced. Reception Staff were helpful and assisted us in any way they could.

Room is clean and very convenient to travel another station. And they have given us the free breakfast for in one day, it is delicious ~ But the hotel service is not good enough. I maybe recommend my friends to stay here next time.

Excellent location - 10 mins from Shinjuku station. Lots of restaurants, shops and department stores. Close to Shinjuku Park - beautiful cherry blossoms. Good price for a clean, although small room. V good staff. Thanks to them for the courtesies and help they gave us on our rail, restaurant questions. Lovely, and comfortable lobby. Also, very convenient to have convenience stores (Lawson, and 7-11) right at the bottom of hotel. Will stay here again if we come back to Tokyo.

We stayed here as part of our travel package, this was by far the smallest room on our trip! The double bed was pushed against the wall which meant that one person would have to shuffle down to the bottom to use the toilet during the night! We paid an extra £50 per night to upgrade to a twin room, the only one they could offer us, this room was much larger and so were the beds, it was much better and worth it to us! Breakfast was good and the hotel is in an area with lots of restaurants nearby.
user_name:
Debbie C
Worcester Park, United Kingdom

review_body: The location of Citadines Central Shinjuku is conveniently located close to many restaurants and shops, and within walking distance to the Shinjuku train station and Shinjuku park (which is beautiful and not to be missed). It is clean and in good condition, and the staff is very helpful. My only complain is the size of the studio, which is very small compared to other Citadines apartments, but then this is Tokyo. Our bed was pushed right up again the wall on one side, so that every time I get in an out of bed during the night I disturb my husband.

As in the hotel name, this hotel is centrally located within Sinjuku. It is walking distance to the train station, the Gyoen Park, shopping stores/departments and restaurants. A convenience store is on the first floor of the hotel building. We stayed in a Club room with twin beds. It was a nice size with a sitting area, desk, closet and beverage area. The bathroom had 2 sinks, separate shower & tub room and separate toilet. I highly recommend this room. The amenities were also very nice. The only negative comment would be that at night, the red light district comes to life and this hotel is within close proximity. But I always felt safe and the hotel has good security.

Clean room and good staff service.The hotel situated on a night life road but the room is quite hardly hear any sound from outside which is very good. We had a good night sleep. I always had problem with hotel pillow but the pillow here is quite hard for me but I had no problem with the pillow at all sleep well every night.

Great location of the hotel. Within 10mins walk from Shinjuku station. Hotel lobby is located at level 3 of the building. Hotel room is clean and pretty spacious for hotel in Japan. Level 1 has a big 7-11 store which you can get all your convenient meal. Lots of other fnb & shops area the area. Do not need to worry about in or near the red light district. It is very safe. Highly recommend!

Pretty disappointed with this place - rooms very pokey and unwelcoming, air conditioning didn't work, and had to beg to get some device to enable opening of the window. great location, next to the Golden Gai, although pretty noisy. Staff were nice and helpful, but just no atmosphere, and not as well designed or as welcoming as other hotels in the same class. You can definitely do better for the money eg Granbell, Dormy etc are all much better chains for the same money.

The location couldn't be better, pretty close from places of interest, 10 min walking from shinjuku station, the service overall was great. We had our breakfast included, it was delicious, with japanese and western options, very complete. We stayed there for a week, and never got tired of it. The staff is very nice and willing to help. The accomodations are very new, everything very clean. I would definitely stay there again!

A convienent and central location in Shinjuku. Walking distance to Metro station. A convienent mart "Lawson" is just downstairs of the hotel. This hotel is inside clubs area, but nothing to worry as they won't disturb tourist.

My husband and I travelled to Tokyo for vacation in late March. We stay in Citadines Central Shinjuku Hotel for 4 nights. The hotel is about 5 minutes taxi ride from Shinjuku JR Station (Walking takes about 10 minutes but it's not recommended when the weather is poor). The hotel staff are very decent, polite and highly efficient. They speaks very fluent English. The hotel is modern, clean and stylish. Hotel room size is average. The room is quiet and cosy. I like it when there's a convenience store right below the hotel. Hotel management is extremely thoughtful and sweet as they prepared a little surprise on my birthday. However, the only setback I can think of is the size of the pillows which is too tiny and didn't feel comfortable at all. Hope the hotel management can look into it.All in all, I had a pleasant experience in this hotel. I think I much prefer staying in a boutique hotel these days as the service is more attentive and personal. My husband and I will definitely come back again.

great hotel, nice room and near a lot of restaurants. its also near one of the best spas or onsens in tokyo. walking distance to 2 train stations. convenience store at the GF. great service! they allowed to keep our bags for us.

Staff are very helpful, check in and out are smooth and efficient. Location excellent. Value for money. Room are clean (housekeeping staff is excellent) and big enough for the 3 of us; but only minus point is about the pillow. The pillow is too small and soft. But overall the stay was EXCELLENT!!Location - Perfect; safe; Kabukichō (red light district) but totally safe and nothing to worry. Golden gai is behind the hotel. Less than 10mins walk to metro line.Room for 3 pax is big enough for us. 3 single beds and still enough room for 3 big luggages.All of your staff stands up.. They are excellent in their job (from the housekeeping, front office, reservation). Prior to my arrival, my correspondence was handled in a very efficient and fast manner. I was amazed. I would like to highlight the kind gesture that I received from your staff; I check in 3days before my birthday (which I didn't mention), I went for Mt Fuji trip early morning only to be back in the evening and to my surprised I receive a birthday card and cookies which I totally unexpected. Indeed a kind and thoughtful gesture. Good job to all ur staff and keep up the good work. I've always received positive hospitality when I stay in Ascott group. Thank you once again!

Very high quality hotel with a room bigger than others in Japan and nice bathroom. We eere free upgraded to high floor deluxe room and the staff was helpful.We recomment this hotel, as also because at 5min walking from East exit of Shinjuku Station and just behind Golden Gai zone and the center of Shinjuku.We didn't book breakfast because you can find everything in the corner.Best 4 stars hotel in that zone!

We had booked an airbnb but my husband had an asthma attack the moment we arrived. We found this hotel quickly and easily. The reception is lovely and the rooms are serviced, clean and warm. And better value than where we had originally booked and includes breakfast. Love it!

This is my first stay at Citadines Central Shinjuku Tokyo. Middle market hotel, clean and small room but quite comfortable to stay. There are coin laundry and vending machines facilities. The hotel is close to Shinjuku Station, one of the major train station in Tokyo. Easy to travel outside of the city through this station. There are many kind of eating and drinking places, convenient store and not far from shopping area. The staff is very helpful. But something to consider if you travelling with kids because the surrounding area is the famous Tokyo red light district. I would stay here again if we traveling only with adults.

The title says it all. It's not that near a walk from Shinjuku station which could be difficult if you are carrying heavy luggage. I paid for a club room which is on the second highest floor so it was about 2/3 bigger than the normal rooms. It was worth the money as the club room is already small so I can't imagine how small the normal rooms are. Though there isnt much of a view since Tokyo isnt exactly scenic but being on the high floors means I do not have people staring into my room.

Typically I'm not the guest who seeks out a so-called 'efficiency' sort of apartment style hotel when I'm traveling. I get why people do it. Certainly if you have children with you, food allergies or are on a budget, this is likely the best option. It was comfortable enough but very noisy and with hot plates going there were cooking smells wafting around which took away from our enjoyment. One of my fellow guests saw roaches - not surprising with cooking going on. Won't choose to stay here again.
user_name:
david_patridge
New York City, New York

review_body: This hotel is a very good, middle market hotel. Clean, small but comfortable rooms. I spent 3 nights there. The location is close to the Shinjuku station and lots of eating and drinking places. It's also in the middle of the red light district of Tokyo. Lots of unsavory characters at night. This atmosphere doesn't make it into the hotel, but something to consider when traveling with kids. Seems like heat/ac systems in hotels are universally baffling to me. Finally found a way to control it.

A bit of a walk from the bullet train, wheeling a suitcase but we did it both ways so no problem, the expected crowds at the crossings didn't appear and so progress was not hindered. Then an escalator or lift up to reception and we reached our oasis of calm. Friendly receptionists soon processed our booking and accommodated our request for an extra night. Our rooms were well laid out, small but compact and had everything we needed. Nice deep bath and plenty of hot water, air conditioning and very little street noise. Breakfasts were superb, wide ranging choices and refreshed often. Everything was clean and comfortable, hence easy to relax after travelling or site seeing.

A great stay at the Citadines Shinjuku. The rooms aren't the largest however the location is super. Right next to Golden Gai in the heart of Shinjuku. There is a convenient store right below the hotel making it easy to grab a quick snack or drink. Staff was extremely helpful and infact they allowed us an early check in without any extra charge (Shocker for Japan)

The hotel was very nice in a GREAT location in the heart of Shinjuku. The room was pretty spacious for Tokyo, the bed was comfortable, the bathroom had everything we needed. Would definitely stay here again.

I had a business trip in April 2017 during the peak of the cherry blossom season, so all the usual company hotels were already fully booked. The company travel agent got this hotel for a reasonable price (~24k JPY/night) which I thought was pretty reasonable. Since I am familiar with Shinjuku, I said go for it.Location wise, it's located just inside the Kabukicho area, which is the red light district of Shinjuku. Walking down the main street towards the hotel, you pass by many massage parlours and bars with suggestive pictures and names posted. Looks OK during the day, but by night, touts (and pimps) line the streets, looking for customers.For most part, the Japanese touts will ignore tourists. However, the many Nigerian touts are quite active and vocal in coming up to tourists, especially single men or groups of men, and to actively persuade you to try some of several establishments. For most part, I ignore, or shake my head and continue walking. If you engage in conversation, it will be hard to disengage later :)All in all, I still felt it was a fairly safe place, even walking around at night, though my colleagues' reactions when they knew where I was staying ranged from horror to amusement :)On the hotel itself, I would put it right up there with the best popular places in Shinjuku. It's definitely better than the Plaza Sunroute where we usually stay - rooms are huge by Tokyo standards (deluxe room), same with the bathrooms. You don't feel crowded at all here. There are convenient vending machines on most floors, and a set of 5 washing machines and driers on L7. Directly downstars is a Lawson's so it's super convenient to pick up something to eat (a Mister Donut is down the street, which closes at 2am if you're craving coffee and hotdogs).The showers/bath was excellent, the water pressure is one of the best I've experienced in any hotel and unlike the usual shower curtain, this is behind a glass shower door so you get zero splashes in the toilet areas (if you're particular about that).All in all, I love this hotel and will make it my hotel of choice next trip to Shinjuku. It's near all the shopping and food places we love, and a stone's throw from the Shinjuku Station. Will definitely return!

Very clean room, staff extremely friendly and helpful. Located upstairs from a 24 hr convenience store which is VERY convenient. Make sure you use the opportunity to visit some or the bars in the Golden Gai area, easy stumbling distance back to the hotel. Hope to stay here again one day.

Room is reasonably sized and very clean. Love the toilet amenities! A plus point is having a 24-hour convenience store in the same building. Not very near the train station but still within acceptable walking distance. Lotsa eateries around the hotel.

Situated in Shinjuku (Tokyo) and easy to reach by subway and JR trains. Very lively area with lot's of restaurants, bars and shops. A lot of young people around in the evening so there's always something going on. Considering how busy Tokyo is we didn't mind staying in this vibrant part of the city . The hotel is clean, there's everything you need, staff is friendly and helpful. Breakfast in the hotel is reasonable but I would go out for lunch or dinner since there are so many places to eat around the hotel.

We stayed here twice during our Japan trip in which both times we had booked premium rooms. All the staff were extremely helpful, and most spoke at least a small amount of English. Great location, close to Shinjuku train station. Would definitely recommend this hotel to others.

Stayed here for 2 nights in March 2017. It was the end of our holiday so we did 2 nights in Tokyo before heading back home we chose this hotel because of its proximity to Shinjuku station as well as a number of other attractions in the area. The room was small but we both fit in ok, the bathroom was large by Japanese standards. Staff were helpful and the place was very clean. There is a 24/7 Lawson supermarket on the ground floor which is handy. Its very close to the Golden Gai which for those who don't know is an awesome area that is full of narrow lane ways and tiny hole in the wall bars some of which only take 4/5 people. Shinjuki station is a short ten minute walk and its only a 15 minute walk to the Shinjuku Goyen National Garden which is a must see.

Small but very nice. also close to a lot of attractions like the robot restaurant and other restaurant also the gardens when it is cherry blossom season all in walking distance form the hotel. Very good when on a budget

We booked this hotel through Expedia. Last minute (our other rental turned out to be a nightmare). We also showed up at the hotel but they quoted us a room for 300 us a night, we booked online on Expedia for less than half the price. When we returned with our email confirmation the check in was flawless, everyone was very nice and helpful. The room was quite big (for Japan standards) and the bathroom was great with a nice shower. The breakfast was really good and we found the bed very comfortable. Would definitely stay again!

This hotel is great. Extremely clean room, very comfortable bed. Lovely fresh linen. Quick check in. Very good breakfast with friendly and efficient staff. Location is central and although it's in a bit of a dodgy area we felt completely safe. Quick walk to Shinjuku station and Shinjuku Sanchome metro. Lots of choice of restaurants within a few minutes walk. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

We recently stay at this hotel for four nights and found it to be very good in almost every way. The room was a decent size for Japan and the bed was very comfortable and not hard - although it was fairly small. The pillows were not great. The bathroom was excellent especially the shower. The hotel is always hot like almost every place indoors in Japan but we were able to turn off the heating and open the window. The staff were friendly and spoke English. We loved the location and were not at all bothered by any of the touts etc. We would definitely stay here again.

We first visited Citadines 7 years ago, back when tourism was not huge and there were few places with English speakers (or menus!). Since then they have done some interior work and the hotel is even more beautiful than we remembered. The service is impeccable, the amenities what you would expect out of a 4 star hotel AND you get a fresh robe/PJs every day. We were blown away by the value of this hotel and will definitely return again.
user_name:
Kim M
Auckland Central, New Zealand

review_body: Good location, has everything you need for a leisure visit, great breakfast to set you up for the day, a short walk to station and metro, local shops and buzz at night. Rooms clean and bed comfortable, lots of hot water for a good soak in the bath.

Clean, nice hotel with great location. Bring your own pillow if you want to sleep well since they are really hard and weird. Didn't try the breakfast. Location is close to everything. Golden Gai bar area is around the corner which is a lot of fun.

Very clean, comfortable room and nice staff. Price is reasonable. Location is a little bit far away from JR station but still acceptable. Closed to convenience stores and restaurants. Overall is good.

We travelled from Australia, and made our way to the hotel by bus limousine. It was very easy to find and reception staff were very friendly. It had everything we needed for our stay in Tokyo- a short walk to the train stations, great central location in Shinjuku. The staff spoke English well and could help us with queries. We ate breakfast in the restaurant every morning and it was very affordable! They catered to us 'westerners' but also had Japanese cuisine. The selection of food was sufficient and the staff were very friendly. The rooms were very tidy, no faults and had everything we needed. The hotel was very modern, and clean. Would definitely recommend this hotel!

Larger rooms than other accommodation in Shinjuku. Ask reception for softer pillows as you get in as they are hard as a rock. Convenience store downstairs and short walk to the train station, many restaurants and shops.

Very happy with our stay here. Excellent location with plenty of eating options, a convenience store downstairs and golden gai just behind the hotel. Shinjuku station was only a short stroll away with easy to use maps given at the hotel. Wifi was good also, always a bonus when travelling overseas. English speaking reception staff too. Room was small but would expect that in Tokyo!

Location is near Shinjuku-sachome station.. 10mins walk to Shinjuku station. Conveniece store(Lawson) on the 1st floor.Fuss free check in and check out. Room is small/cosy but okay for 2. Too small if u have many luggages or the need to walk around. Not too new but clean. Daily housekeeping was good - changed towels, cleaned beds, topped up mineral water. Pricing is not too bad for a room in Japan...

it's my first japan trip and I am glad i pick this hotel. the location is great and the room size is good enough for couples. especially the bathroom, there is shower and also bath tub. I would like to stay again next time.

A very well l9cated hotel 8n the center of Shinjuku near the subway ...very clean...helpfully staff....rooms were very spacious...bathroom well equiped and towels were changed everyday.....everything was great........most likely to comeback..you were all great...

Good hotel ,very clean,staff are very smart,niceBut the hotel need to all more place to smoking area,the breakfast should be more item ,Overall this hotel is very good,nice place ,nearby to busy street

Location was good. Near many subway stations and attractions. Was a convenient and clean place. Amenities were adequate and check in and out processes were efficient. Lots of 24hr food joints around the area as well.

The hotel is in walking distance to the train station Shinjuku in a very busy quarter, especially at nights. The hotel is surrounded by a lot of restaurants but some "establishements" as well (at least it looks like). At the bottom of the hotel is a small convenience store, on the first level a restaurant and on the second level is the start of the hotel with the lobby and the breakfast and lunch restaurant - please note, this restaurant is not open for dinner. The rooms are small, but compared to other hotels in Tokyo, it is allright. At least there is space to open the suitcase without the need to put it on the bed, so I need to call the room large. The bathroom is comparible spaceious and good to use with everything you need. The personell is very friendly and the breakfast was allright as well. It's not a perfect hotel or anything I would specifically recommend, but for the price, location, size of the room and all over impression I would think about going there again.

The rates is higher for the value you will get from your stay. The location is perfect as it's walking distance from Shinjuku rest and only about 10 minutes walk. Being closed to red light district, Central Citadines still gives you safety, security and comfortable stay in term of noise disturbance. it's good if you stay single or max. couples. Not recommended to stay with family.

Loacation - I was able to ask a very helpful tripadvisor member for tips on how to go to the hotel from Shinjuku station. The hotel is around 10 minutes walk from there. Shopping and foods are abundant in the area. Although the hotel is in the red light district, I don't feel bothered at all. But I don't recommend this hotel to families with kids or single male adults unless you want to be bothered by touts. Hotel - Room is average in size considering Japan is famous for small rooms. Bathroom is huge and it occupies half of the room which I find it weird. Wifi is free but a bit slow. Breakfast is below average and is not recommended. Check out is 11:00am but you can leave your luggage with them.

The hotel is easy to find from Shinjuku station if you are arriving by train. Take the south exit from the station and turn to the left and go down the escalator. You will see a green building with "Green Peas" signage - take the narrow street along the right of this building and walk for about 10 minutes (3 or 4 blocks) to Citadines. The entrance to the hotel is on the right hand side of the street but does not face the street. It is an elevator entrance in a walkway dividing it from a Watsons store (like a 7/11 store). The staff speak English and are very polite and helpful. I found my room to be spotlessly clean, comfortable and quiet. There was enough space for me as I only slept in the room and spent all day out. I loved the breakfast which was a mix of Japanese and western. The location is very good, close to shops, eateries etc. and close enough to subway stations and the bus station (located on the 4th level at the southern end of Shinjuku station) Walking is not a problem for me so I would definitely stay here again.

Good location but street outside hotel is very busy. In evening not so suitable for traveler with kids as this hotel is in the Red Light district of Shinjuku. Parking is not so convenient. Only 1 restaurant in hotel but there are many restaurants near the hotel.

This hotel has some reviews that made me a little nervous, but after staying here for 3nights I have nothing bad to say about this hotel or its location in fact I think it's location is perfect if you want to be in the thick of it all, the rooms were spotless (small but you expect that) and the amenities were great, I would recommend getting a twin room and putting up with separate beds as all the beds at this hotel are a double so we decided two would be best as my husband is quite tall.. the only bad thing about the hotel was that the beds are very hard but I have come to find that beds in all Asian countries are hard - it's just how they do it... we found exit b9 to be the easiest at shinjuku sanchcome, as you exit the b9 exit turn left, cross the Main Street and continue past mister donut for about 100 meters, the sign is hard to see until the last minute... I would stay here agin in a heartbeat!!! Great hotel!!!

Very clean and well located for metro and the throbbing nightlife across the road. Well appointed rooms but, as seems normal in Japan, not big for 2 people and 2 suitcases. Reasonably priced for standard and location.

We booked the deluxe room. The rooms were a little on small side especially for our son and family with a cot in the room. It took us 10 minutes to get to the train station. staff very helpful with our tour bookings. Check out was at 11am. Our luggage was stored while we checked our more sites. We had the use of the baby change area to get changed before we departed. There is a convenience store down on the street level. Breakfast was good value.

Having stayed at the Citadines Suzhou, PRC, it seemed an obvious choice to stay at Citadines Central Shinjuku. We were not disappointed. The hotel were very welcoming, and our twin bed studio room was excellent. We had paid for the breakfast to be included and thought this was good value for money and unlike many medium sized hotels, never had a problem with crowding in the dining area, even at peak hour. The hotel is 10 Minutes walk from Shinjuku station which is the centre of the universe and whilst this was convenient to travel anywhere in Tokyo, locating the East exit on returning was our biggest challenge of the day ! Highly recommend the Samurai Museum , 5 minutes walk from Citadines and make sure you visit the Golden Gai area. We visited most areas of Tokyo, always felt safe, but beware, lots of touristy things and gardens are closed Mondays.

Double standard room was small but not uncomfortable, perfect for a couple. Bathrooms were a good size & hotel was always clean. Great location, however there are a lot of adult bars along the entrance street but that is quite common in Shinjuku. Nonetheless the area was safe & comfortable to walk through at night. The hotel is very quiet considering there is a lot of nightlife. Laundry facility available & the breakfast buffet was simple but fresh. Hotel was warm & friendly. Free wi-fi available, however TV cards are to be purchased if you want TV use. Staff are friendly. Not a large reception & not any common areas. Perfect for a reasonable price & good quality hotel to use as a stop off zone & for a good nights sleep between exploring. Convenience store just downstairs, shopping & restaurants around the block & stations are only a short walk away.

Very wonderful stay. Very unexpected note from the staff for my birthday! But the only thing I was the breakfast wasnt as good as I thought it would be. But everything else was wonderful and very enjoyable.

It is my second time in Tokyo. The first time we stayed at Hundred Stay Shinjuku. And this time my hubby and I decided on Citadines. The room we stayed in is a studio double. It is small but it didn't bother us because we will be spending most of our time outside anyways. And although small it is clean. It has a safe, iron board, mini ref, bathtub. There is however no coffee/tea maker. Housekeeping will tidy up your room daily and replenish your bottled water and toiletries.The best thing about Citadines Central is location. No doubt. Lawson is just on the ground floor of the building. Lots and lots of restaurants around. Drugstores are everywhere (here you will find tons of japanese makeups, masks, chocolates, and goodies that are so kawaii and cheap!). If you want to go shopping you'll find so many department stores around Shinjuku Station. And speaking of Shinjuku station, it is just 10 to 15 mins walk (Remember: East Exit. Follow the signs. Then go up the stairs to an exit that says "Kabukicho"). You can also ride Narita Express from this station going back to Narita airport. It's really convenient. Glad to have chosen Citadines.

I had mixed feelings when I first booked this place because of reviews, which seemed to be mostly negative on other sites and no one was really overjoyed by their stay. I have to say that I was pleasantly surprised. One thing that I did look forward to was the location and the fact that there was a Lawsons convenient store on the street level in front. Oh, that place has some amazing snacks, drinks, and other various goodies. Not to mention the nonstop action of interesting people either sitting in the cafe area or just shopping for their own goodies. I saw a Japanese woman who looked like she was 7 feet tall reading the contents of a microwaveable ramen container. She had on very tall heels but nevertheless she was still super tall without. There's also a nearby 7-11 and this place that makes the best beef udon and also various kinds of Takoyaki right next door to the 7-11. Needless to say we did a lot of eating in Tokyo. The famous alley known as Omoide Yokocho wasn't too faraway. I discovered it while on a walk to see what places were nearby. My wife was resting on our first morning in Tokyo and sent me to scout out what was close by. Everything was close by! Be careful of getting carried away as you eat the yakitori in Omoide Yokocho because we almost didn't have enough to pay for everything we ate. Anyway, this hotel is truly centrally located but Tokyo has the most amazing subway system and thanks to the help of a friend(Nick) who lives there and who also works as a guide he was able to show us a great deal of the city. We were there for 4 nights, which is actually too short of time to take in all that Tokyo has to offer. We hope to return again very soon. The staff at Citadines Central was always very helpful and friendly. I'd heard of the rooms being very small but the size didn't bother me. Yes, they were somewhat small but I've seen much smaller in Europe. We loved our stay here. It was all about the food and culture anyway so a nice and very comfortable hotel was just icing on the cake, so to speak...

We enjoyed the location most - close to the train station and shops and some excitement at night time. The hotel was quick to register and checkout. Didn't try any restaurants but with a 7 11 downstairs and restaurants all around - why would you. the rooms were spacious enough. Some reviews talk about red light area but really its not an issue, actually if no one mentioned it you would not know.

This hotel is located right next to the Golden Gai, 100m from the robot restaurant, if that takes your fancy, and is about a 5 min walk from Shinjuku station.
