The rooms are of a good size with room for your luggage, to sit comfortably, without tripping over things or each other. The room is as well appointed as you may expect from a modern hotel. Fast wifi, desk, small lounge, lots of power points. The reception is upstairs on the 3rd floor and the staff are efficient and helpful. The buffet breakfast was excellent and caters for all tastes from eastern to western. The hotel literally backs onto the Golden Gai area which provides many opportunities for wining, dining, karaoke or general carousing. The Citadines is a great location to explore the livelier parts of Tokyo.

Citadines is a 10 min walk from the JR Shinjuku station, and a shorter walk from Tokyo metro stations. Beware of the cobble stone roads if you have large pieces of luggage with you. It's near/in the red-light district so there are a number of people who call out and ask if you want to enter their restaurant/bar.The staff was very friendly and the room was small but clean. My room had a large modern bathroom. Unfortunately, because of the location, the police sirens were loud and clear on most nights. Otherwise, it was fairly quiet within the room.

The location is very convenient, even it is in Kabukijo area but it was not crowded nor noisy at all. The hotel was surrounded by subway stations, shopping mall and restaurants.Bedroom is normal but the Bathroom is a lot bigger than average comparing with the hotels at the same rate and same location.Staff is well trained and helpful.

Short walk of around 5mins when you are familiar with the place and get out from the right exit. It's a place where nightlife is active and it's convenient with 3 24hr stores just within a min walk. There are small little pubs just next to the area too.

Citadines Central Shinjuku is very reccomended for exploring Shinjuku. It is very near from Shinjuku Station (walk about 8 minutes) and you can find any store you want around you! Food, clothes, reuse stuff, you name it! Very excellent stay to experience in Japan! Very likely to come back!!

We stayed at Citadines Central Shinjuku for one night as part of a road trip around central/northern Honshu and found it to be distinctly average by Tokyo standards but not bad at all. The location is very good, deep in the heart of Kabukicho (Tokyo's red light district), surrounded by many bars and restaurants and close to an entrance to Shinjuku station which is useful. The room was on the 5th floor, and very compact (as with most Tokyo hotels), the bed was comfortable and there was a good view of the street out of our window. The wifi was quite slow compared to most hotels these days, the shower was wonderful though! I'm struggling to find much more to say about it other than it was adequate and served a purpose!

Stayed here for a couple of nights. Was in a good location for the sights of Shinjuku, with about a 20 minute walk to Shinjuku Park. A nice Shinto Shrine directly behind the hotel and the laneway walk was a great way to enter and leave rather than onto the street in front which is much less inviting. Was surprised by Shinjuku since it was pretty much just an area of massage lounges and finding a reasonable place to eat with kids not that easy. The hotel; itself was fine with the room being larger than we expected for Japan. Nice lobby area and they arranged transport for us which was great. View at night is nice with all the lights outside but during the day is pretty dingy looking.

Stayed with a few mates while in Tokyo. Very good location, plenty of pubs, clubs and food places located very close.Rooms on the slightly small side but clean and tidy with what you needed.Would stay here again.

Really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Perfectly located, modern, great customer service. Small rooms, but most are in Japan, it's all part of the fun! Shinjuku is a fantastic place - I highly recommend staying here.

I stayed therefor 1st night then followed by 4 nights consecutively after checking out for Hakone for a night. We left our luggages at then hotel to return the next day, and we lost our luggage tag from the hotel. They had surprisingly did the extra mile to bring our luggage to our new room.Overall, they cleaned the room daily without having to inform them to do so. They replenish the amenities. A pity the room was way too small to fit in 2 huge luggages and 1 small hand carry luggage in the room and the bed was a bit too small than a queen-sized bed. For Asian size for my husband and myself, we were okay but neither of us liked the corner where the bed was next to the wall. I heard Japan rooms were the standard size. All rooms come with bathtub though.

Citadines is a very comfortable stay breakfast offers a huge variety of foods, the rooms are perhaps a little on the small side but comfortable beds and good amenities. Excellent location for train station, golden gia area at rear of hotel these are tiny bars that are very quaint,foodies heaven in local streets and red light district. A great starting point for looking at a great cityGreat value for location.

My husband and I stayed in Tokyo for 4 nights and we needed a centralized hotel close to everything and the subway and this hotel is the place to be. Keep in mind Tokyo is not a cheap city and for the price we paid $200 CDN/night its amazing (vs the hyatt down the street for double the price)Yes the rooms are small, standard for Tokyo but enough space for my husband and I and our luggages. The bathroom is decent size and the heated toilet is amazing. Reception was friendly and helpful but keep in mind they speak very little english so try to plan ahead when it comes to your tours and restaurant choices. With that they are still willing to help with the best of their abilities. The breakfast is decent. But Ichiran a great ramen place close by is open 24hours if you want an alternative. It is near the the red light district but its not seedy and its actually fun to walk around. You see famlies with children, couples etc. And its a fun area to be in. The main subway station is Shinjuku which is a 3 min walk and there are so many good restaurants and shopping right around the hotel if you decide to stay in Shinjuku only. Its is very safe anywhere in Tokyo and we suggest you bring your comfy shoes as there will be a lot of walking involved. Keep in mind Taxis are very expansive so make sure you buy a PASMO card as the subway is the best source of transport. All in all we will definitely recomend this hotel if you are looking for something central, affordable and close to everything. Thank you Citadines

Have stayed here several times when on business in/around Tokyo. Right in neon lighted Shinjuku, more restaurants, bars, shopping and hostess bars that you can count.That said, it's still very quiet in the rooms facing the busy street below. Part of that is a tribute to polite Japanese culture - no honking, no sirens, no yelling, no loud music.The breakfast buffet (included) in excellent, everything is up to date and modern (as you'd expect in Tokyo) and the price is reasonable. That said, I have noticed that the price per night differs from $140/night to $180/night for the same (class) room. Not sure why. The staff are very nice and speak good English. They let me store my snowboard for several days while I was in another city on business.NOTES:1. There is a "Lawson" (pronounce rawson by the Japanese ha ha) next to the hotel which is open 24 hours if you need a snack or other convenience store items.2. Good restaurants all up and down the street - but be aware what is a restaurant or a bar and what is a "hostess bar" where you pay for the company of a woman (or a maid or boy etc - this is Tokyo).3. The excellent Shinjuku Gyoen National Garden is just a 10 min walk away. Well worth a visit.4. The Samurai Museum (which is 50% museum 50% tourist attraction) is just 5 min away. A bit expensive, but very cool.5. The "Robot Restaurant" (dinner show with lots of lights and Vegas style showmanship) is just 5 min away. 6. The "Loft", which is an alternative music venu, is a few minutes away and has some funky bands - see my review.7. 3 floors of nick-nack and souvenir shopping at "Don Quijote" is a few minutes walk away. Tshirts, toys, cosmetics, electronics - all things Japanese.8. Shinjuku Station (train) is 10 min away by taxi and costs 600 yen ($6 US). If you are headed to Narita airport, you catch the train from here. It takes 1 hour 20 min on the Express train and costs $30 US. A taxi to Narita from the hotel is $300. If headed to Haneda airport, a taxi from the hotel is more reasonable at $90.Would stay here again when in Tokyo.

We booked this hotel through Hotels.com. We paid in advance thinking we were going to save money. From the beginning, the staff's attitude was weird and we were waiting at the desk to get someone's attention. The room was adequate although I was expecting a bigger room since we had three people staying in the room. The sofa bed extended out to the walking area from the main bed to the bathroom. The part that I am extremely frustrated about, is that the hotel charged me three times the amount of the published rate on Hotels.com I have disputed the charge with the credit card company and they tried to talk to the hotel directly but the hotel has not budged. I feel that the hotel has fraudulently charged us for a reservation that was for someone else or doesn't exist. Be CAREFUL WITH THIS HOTEL!

The room was tiny, as expected in Japan standards however the Deluxe room, 2nd category higher was advertised as 24sqm. It was definitely not 24sqm. The bathroom was a good size but the bedroom itself was small.The room was clean however, housekeeping needs alot of training. She/he does not throw out stuff from the garbage bin and other trash items which were obviously trash. They only fixed the bed and cleaned the bathroom. The hotel though is centrally located, it is behind the Japanese alley bars called Golden Gai and there are plenty of restaurants surrounding it. One thing i liked the most is there is a convenince store just right below the hotel. It can be a little far to walk to JR Shinjuku station, approximately 15 to 20minutes using the underground right accross Mister Donut. It is however closer if you would use the Tokyo Metro. One more concern is the "FREE" vending machine that comes in when you book an executive deluxe, for 5 days straight there was no coffee in it. When you take coffee from it, it just gives you murky water. Nobody checks it, not in 5 days. Overall, It was really not so much up to our standards given the amount we had to pay. Might as well choose an airbnb condo for a better price.

Very polite employees and quick check in services.Room is clean. Bath tub is much bigger than traditional Japanese hotels. Breakfast settings are quite good and a lot of selections.The location is so great that we can go shopping and dining right away.

10th trip to Tokyo and the first time in this area (Kabukicho)of Shinjuku. Still just minutes walk to Shinjuku or Shinjuku Sanchome stations, but lots more shopping, eating etc very close by. Although considered the red light district, we never felt unsafe although we saw a few interesting sights! Hotel has a pretty good buffet breakfast at a fairly reasonable price if not included in room rate, and a coin laundry and vending on most floors!Staff very helpful managed our super early check in of 5.45am! ( pay for the night before in Japan or most times you will have to wait till at least midday or 2pm to check in) and getting our groups rooms together on one floor. Room is well designed for Tokyo...we have had smaller rooms in better rated hotels. Bathroom well designed with enough ledge space for stuff, retractable clothes lines and good amenities. Small niche wardrobe with shelf above kept our skis out of way too! Tiny fridge and jug and great large drop in safe in bedside table too! Great value and would stay again if we got a good deal! Do a google earth vitual walk around the neighbourhood like we did to check out just how close everything is!

3 friends travelling. We stayed in a 2 separate rooms. My husband and I were in a double room which had plenty of room for our luggage and double bed was more than comfortable. Bathroom was big and clean. You have all the toiletries you need and water in the mini fridge in the room. We didn't get bothered by any street noise. Area around the hotel is safe and can walk back late at night without any issues. Location is very close walk to the JR station and all major metro lines. Very close to the "red light" district of Shinjuku if you choose to walk around but you also have access to top brand names for shopping and great food. The front desk staff were amazing this trip. They helped us to collect our tickets from the 7Eleven downstairs which we could never have done on our own! They are truly the superstars of this hotel. Breakfast is enough to get your day started. We've been here before and would stay again.

Loads to do, hotel is compact but nice , you have the opportunity to swap breakfast for lunch which starts at half eleven and better value, most of the shops don't open until eleven and close at eleven so a late start is better great little place

In the heart of Shinjuku area of Japan, where area is always alive. Walking to the Shinjuku Station, all major shopping, various restaurants and even groceries. Rooms comfortable enough for Japanese standards size. Breakfast is good enough to fill you up till lunch. There is a convenient store, Lawson, beside it, for you to buy snacks when everything else is close, or you have forgotten something like your gloves. Will recommend to anyone visiting Japan. Staff very helpful and will help you navigate the subway and trains. They speak English too.

The location is very good, just few minutes walk from Shinjuku jr station, and the room size is big compare with other hotel in Tokyo as I paid . The services also quit good , the reception counter always have a smiley face

We arrived a little late at night to have an overnight stay in Tokyo. The location is about 3-4 blocks away from JR Train station. The walk is quite interesting as you will find a very busy nightlife. Safety is not a concern as people are so polite and courteous. People we asked for directions are very helpful and even though there might be a little language gap, the people are extremely helpful. The size of the room that we were assigned was decent in size, clean and maybe a little dated but overall it was sufficient. The bathroom is a little small but unless you want to spend a month in the facility and you have a big family, then this might be a concern. Hotel is close to restaurants, malls and easily accessible to all. Overall, we would come back here again and recommend this hotel to our friend who are looking for a decent and clean space to stay.
user_name:
joglen10
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Rooms were a decent size and beds were comfortable. Excellent amenities and bath. Perfect location for exploring Tokyo. Would stay here again. The washing machine and dryers made life easy on the 7th floor. The only English channel was CNN which was somewhat disappointing.

Overall great quality and service. Rooms were clean and comfortable. The location, however, can be misleading. This hotel is marketed to be in central shinjuku but is actually part of kabuki-cho which is a red light district. This could be of concern for families, especially when returning back to the hotel at later hours of the night. The location was the only concern for an otherwise great hotel.

The hotel is ideally located in Kabukicho, Shinjuku. 5 minute walk away from the East Exit of Shinjuku Station. There is a Lawsons convenience store on level 1 of the hotel, which is great for quick access to drinks and meals. The rooms are clean, although very small but that is typical of most hotels in Tokyo.

I am removing stars for a couple of reasons:1. The stench of cigarette smoke in the hallway was awful. Grouping floors as smoking and non-smoking would be better. Fortunately, you could not smell it once in the room.2. At check-in I asked about a twin room (booked a double). Although they had availability (we checked in quite late) they wanted an extra fee. In all my travels around the world, that is the first time that a 2 bed room was more money and that a hotel wouldn't accommodate when it was available.3. Minor annoyance to have to take 2 separate elevators to reach the street level.4. Staff wasn't able to give me directions for how to take the subway to Shibuya station (1 station away). Had to ask 3 people and they didn't know what the cost would be. Thankfully, I was able to catch an English speaking person at the subway station to help us (the ticket machines aren't really helpful, you need to know what the fare is ahead of time).OK...all that aside, our stay was fine. But given all the options in this city, I don't think I would return.Location - It's a great location. 10-15 minute walk from the Shinjuku station. If you have a phone with GPS, you can easily follow the map to navigate yourself. Streets are crowded, but it's Tokyo :) Lots of restaurants and stores around...but I think that no matter where you stay in this part of the city that you will find that.Staff - Interactions were mixed. Friendly, but not helpful re subway use or moving us to twin room.Room - Rooms looked new. The double room was small (bed up against the wall and a bit of room to walk around). They leave PJs on the bed (nice touch). Small, flat screen TV. Wifi was good for Facetime. Bed was comfortable but pillow was really hard. Bathroom - Well appointed. Japanese toilet (I love these!). Shower was a tub/shower combo. Good water pressure and temperature. Shampoo, conditioner, and body wash provided. Decent space to put your bathroom amenities around the sink. I probably wouldn't recommend this hotel for an extended stay for more than 1 person given the small room for the price. That said, I know Tokyo is expensive and I should adjust my expectations :)

Citadines Central Shinjuku is ideally located if one is travelling around Japan as most of the major transport make a stop here. It is also convenient when one need to leave for the airport by Narita Express. It has compact and functional room for rest.

Located in Kabukicho area 8 min walk North east of Shinjuku Station, this hotel has reasonable sized rooms (for Tokyo in this price segment), good free wifi in the rooms and in the lobby, very friendly & helpful front desk staff who all speak pretty good English. Room air conditioner works well and quiet. Bathroom is small but not overly tight, and shower works well and easy to adjust water temperature. Towels were replaced daily even though we had not intended to do so.Bottled water are provided each day free of charge. Room amenities included tea & coffee. Our rooms were cleaned very early each day by 11am. (We were a family of 7 with 3 rooms, one was an executive twin for a family with a 13yr child). Room lights were also adequately bright and easy to find well located switches.Reception is located on 3rd floor, accessible by lift. On ground floor is Lawson convenience store. Nearby are good shopping choices that Shinjuku is known for.We were able to deposit our larger luggage overnight for ¥100 each for convenience of short overnight trips to other sights around Tokyo without having to lug these luggage along. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

A hotel in the center of the nightlife in one of the most beautiful neighborhoods in tokyo.Very close to Shinjuku stationFriendly and courteous staff.Clean and comfortable rooms.A very pleasant experience with a value for affordable price

An excellent location for shopping and for food. You could shop and go back to hotel to unload your load easily! For those coming from the airport by limousines, best to alight at Shinjuku and take a taxi to get to the hotel. If you are coming from Tokyo station like I did, after coming out of east exit, best to ask for main road and look out for Mister Donut. That is the side road to take to get to the hotel.

great space is Tokyo - if booked early, is only nominally more expensive but rooms are great quality, decent size, and facilities are excellent. Location is fine as well, in the heart of Shinjuku and 5~8min walk from the Shinjuku station

location is good, the room is clean and big enough for 2 personsmore restaurants near by the hotel, it is very convenience for visitorsbut one point is - the room temp is too high, we need to call staff to set cooler of the room

the room have enough space to open 2 29inch luggage.Also Clean and tidy and made me feel comfortable.My wife and me love this room, but we just stay not much time in the room.the location is good which is the center of shopping area.!

The location of this budget hotel is really amazing especially those who are first timers. A lot of restaurants near the hotel as well as mini-stores. You can enjoy walking from hotel and to some of the nearest stores. Aside from the space is a bit average but the rest are all good.

Hotel is in the heart of Shinjuku, 10 min from JR Shinjuku station. There are lot of restaurants and shops in walk distance. Hotel is not so big but very comfortable. Rooms are big enough and equipped by all necessary items. Service is good. Staff is well-skilled. Wi-fi is free but very slow.

The staff were superb and very helpful and service more akin to a more expensive hotel with a concierge. The rooms were a very good size for Tokyo and the bathroom a lot bigger than the average for the area. The room furniture and style was dated, but could be forgiven. The pillows were odd but replaced when requested. Daily bottled water provided. Manual laundry facilities on site were good. Location very accessible to station and shopping. Would recommend.
user_name:
Greg K
Adelaide, South Australia, Australia

review_body: Whilst not ones first trip to Tokyo, however having been there previously only for business meetings this was in a way ones first holiday there. Given that one would be out and about most of the day returning in the wee hours only to sleep we booked ourselves in for a 3 night stay here in September. One can easily enough make it down to hsinjuku station from Tokyo airport, there upon best to take a taxi the first time around which is what we did. The hotel is towards the beginning of Shinjuku and one doesn't have to venture in to the area if one chooses. Having said that mind you the 3 nights we were there there was nothing offensive or dodgy one ran in to and i would rate the hotel and the adjoining area perfectly safe for young families even let alone young couples or solo travellers. In fact Shinjuku has some pretty good restaurants and a host of bars and pubs abound. There are loads of convenience stores around the hotel as are a fair number of coffee and breakfast options. We arrived at about 11.00AM only to be told that our room wasn't ready as they become available only at 2.00, would have helped to have gotten one straight away given we had just come on a red fey 7 plus hour flight, however fair play to the hotel staff they played by the rules. We went for a short walk about and had an early lunch, when we got back at 1.00pm the room was ready. Sure it was tiny but sufficient for the 2 of us with enough space to plant our suitcase and unpack. The bathroom was small but again spotlessly clean and with all amenities. We didn't have breakfast or dine at the hotel at all so cant comment on the F&B. The hotel is barely a 7 minute walk away to the train station which was handy as well really made good use of the train service during our stay. The only grouse I guess I had about the hotel was that it was not comfortable, functional but not comfortable. Also I reckon one can do better and stay at Shubiya or around Rapponji. At US$ 110 the hotel for its standard room represents decent value.
user_name:
Nawabofdelhi1
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Just a few minutes from the East Exit of Shinjuku Station. Great location for a first-timer in Tokyo. We enjoyed our walk to and from the station. The staff were all accommodating. The size of the room is so tiny but comfy and it has a large bathroom with all the needed toiletries.

It is in the heart of shinjukus red light area. But it wasn't a problem at all. The room and the bed however was really tiny. However we only stayes for like 2 nights so we didnt mind. It is super close to shinjuku station about 5 to 7 minutes walk. It was an over all average experience.

Good location for first timer in Tokyo.The hotel Manager and staff are very accomodating.Lawson the convient store within your reach.You can find good restos and bars around the area.The size of the hotel room was a good size and worth the price speacially Tokyo area..Worth your money and good location

Located near the heart of Shinjuku, the hotel is near the major department stores and eateries. If you fancy the all-night dining and entertainment, this is the place to be. Service is good and at the executive floor you have access to a free vending machine for hot and cold drinks, and massage chairs. The room is fairly quiet and not affected by the bustle from the street.We had an executive studio double room. The size of the room was comfortable with a large bathroom.

10 min from Shinjuku Station. The facade is like a budget hotel as it is not located at ground level. Take a small lift to the hotel reception which is situated on the 1st floor. Next to 24 hour convenient store Lawson. 7 Eleven is just a few shops away. Good location for shoppers. Within walking distance to departmental stores. It's in Kabukicho but you will not feel unsafe. It is a very busy street though you have to pass by a few touts on the street outside the hotel who seems to be permanently there during our entire stay.Room is clean and comfortable with spacious bathroom.Bored with the buffet breakfast which serves almost the same dishes everyday.Staff at the reception lacks warmth but efficient.Stayed 8 nights. We opted for bigger room (premier) at higher floor with view.

This is your standard size Japanese room, so it's small. That's a given. It has a nice deep tub for those that like their baths and importantly, it's clean. Location is good, central and not that difficult to find. The lift system can be slightly annoying as one is for the lobby and outside and then you have to use another set of lifts for the rooms. Not really a deal breaker though. Plenty of food options around, although the actual street itself is more dancing girls sort of places so would avoid that strip!Service was good and people are helpful. Would recommend.

The staff was very helpful. They kept my luggage for 2 days while I travelled to Mt Fuji. Upon check-out I lost my USB. They followed up on it and managed to find it and had it mailed back to me. Excellent service.

This is hotel is in the middle of all the hustle and bustle of Kabukicho.The rooms are relatively big to Tokyo, the price was very good, and we even got upgraded to a high floor. There is a self service laundromat in the hotel (which is really important in Tokyo!) and the back-facing we room we got was very quiet considering it is in Kabukicho adjacent the Golden Gai.Great hotel, had a really pleasant time.

We were surprised to find out how handy this hotel is and good service we received. The hotel has reasonable size as a 3 star as you can imagine, but clean. You can explore the famous night district in Shinjuku at door. It's not dangerous at all as people might think in the Kabuki area. We definitely consider to stay again. It is also very close to the station which can be a good plus for tourist like us to carry some luggage.

I walked from central station and liked the location and area. The touts weren't super pushy just a bit annoying. Used the shop next door to buy some beer at a decent price.The staff at hotel was friendly and gave me a map and also booked me a limo bus to Narita airport for the next day. The room was small but OK for me being a solo traveler. The shower was great.

Location of this hotel is very good. Surrounded with places to eat. So you need not to worry if you are hungry and still have to look for places to eat. There's also a convenience store at level 1. Staff of the hotel are all very helpful and courteous. Allowed us to check in when we were early.

Clean, not very noisy even when it's located around lots of bars and restaurants. No room service in case you need a late night snack. Wifi is extremely poor as most of Japan. People from hotel is very polite and extremely helpful. Doesn't have clarity on how to dispose trash in case you bring food in. Room is very small

The hotel is about a 10 minute walk to the JR main entrance. To reach the hotel from the train station, one should take the East exit which is located on Basement 1. You will pass by the shopping mall, Luminest. You have to locate the escalators or lifts which is usually near the ticketing booths. The room was average sized. Sufficient for two adults and two big sized luggage. There is a self service laundry room on the seventh floor which we made use of. There is also a TV card machine for us who love to watch videos., might be useful for parents with young kids. The surroundings of the hotel is always lively which we enjoyed. It's very near Tsujiki Sushik for those looking for good food that's affordable. The hotel is connected to Lawson convenience store on level one. The hotel lobby is on level three. A great place!

The rooms are bigger than the average tiny hotel rooms in Tokyo. Located right beside kabuki-cho. Lots of good food and shops around the area.A short walk to the metro and shinjuku station. Superb service from the multilingual staff. Got a free upgrade to the executive room too.

Family of 5 stayed for 7 nights with 2 rooms. location is the best. hotel staff helpful and clean. When I booked I was expecting a serviced apartment as I stayed previously with another Citadines in Tokyo. But this Citadines Central Shinjuku Tokyo is not a serviced apartment, without kitchen facilities, just like a hotel room with beds and bathroom. overall location is good, close to Shinjuku station that take you everywhere.

We had no hesitation in rebooking our visit this time after our inital stay in 2014. The location in Shinjuku in close to the train (JR line and Subway), shopping and loads of food options! Yakitori Alley and Horse and Tiger in Lumine Est (floor 7F) are our picks! The rooms are small but that is expected in Japan. The amenities are modern, with vending machines and ice machines on most floors. There's also a convenience store right downstairs. We cannot flaw either of our visits (other than the pillow).

My wife and I stayed here for 7 nights in December 2016. Initially the hotel seemed like it would be easy to find from Shinjuku JR Station, but it was a little bit confusing until you get the hang of it. The room was quite small, even by Tokyo standards (not big enough to even open a suitcase on the floor); but the bathroom was nice and large. The room was very clean though. The buffet breakfast is fairly good here with a selection of various things which seem to change slightly each day.People seem to go on about it but the nearby Kabukicho area is nothing to worry about really, unless you left your common sense at home before travelling. The touts can get annoying too, but if you politely decline their offers (often multiple times) then they get the picture.In order to help some other people we noted the best way to navigate from JR Shinjuku Station to the hotel (looks harder than it is):- Exit out of the EAST GATE- Once out the gates, head left past the elevators down the stairs following the signs for the Tokyo Metro Maronouchi Line- Once down the stairs, follow the curved path down more stairs- You should enter a long concourse with many exits and large poles running down the middle. Turn right, but stay on the left-hand side.- At exit B10 "Seibu-Shinjuku Line" (there should be blue signs for the SUBNADE too)- Go down the stairs/escalators and continue along the corridors straight- When you can no longer go straight you will be in a room with five larger exits (one being behind you the way you came). The two on the left go towards Shinjuku nichome (marked with ２丁目) and the two on the right go towards Shinjuku sanchome (marked with 3丁目). Take the furthest away large exit on your right for Shinjuku sanchome.- Walk down the hallway until you see three silver/glass doors on your left. At the time of writing this they are next to Caffe Veloce (a dark red coffee shop).- Go through the doors, up the stairs straight ahead of you out to exit 15B.- As you come out the top of the stairs, cross the road to your right, continuing in the direction you exited the stairs.- Citadines Central Shinjuku is about a 100m down on your right.There are other ways but we used this all the time and it seemed to be the easiest/most convenient.Staff are friendly and helpful.You only get given one key - so I suggest getting another from the counter if you need it before going up to your room.Plenty of places to eat and drink around the place, and this hotel is right next door to the Golden Gai district! Very cool.We had a good stay here, but the room sizes make you feel like you aren't getting good value at times. If you don't mind small rooms then I would say this hotel might be for you.

The room was a generous size for couples and was clean. The staff were friendly and the hotel was in a convenient location and a short walk to Shinjuku station. Would stay here again and recommend to a friend!

Rooms were clean and modern. A little small but so is everything in Tokyo. I thought it was well located and was an easy walk to the JR Shinjuku station. Staff were helpful and well informed and the breakfast was delicious. Overall a great experience

We stayed at Citadines Central Shinjuku due to its location which is near the Shinjuku Station. We found the hotel to be very average. The staff were not very friendly and never seem to smile. The noise coming from the road also disturbs our sleep at night. The area has a lot of night life so the noise can continue throughout the night. The plus point is the location which is about 10 mins walk from Shinjuku Station. The rooms are pretty average but slightly larger than most hotels in Tokyo.
In fact, it was not far from Shinjuku Station, it was good to have a lot of shops around.The breakfast system was good and the staff was friendly.I will stay at this hotel when I next travel to Tokyo

Good location. Size of roomis larger than expected, i can open our large lugguage in our room! The room is clean and tidy.But it is better to get brighter lighting in room, we felt the room is too dim at night time.

Comfortable hotel close to Shinjuku station, shops and restaurants. Rooms and bathrooms are clean, small but perfectly reasonable. Not much wardrobe space but enough for a few days. We requested soft pillows as the original were quite hard. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Buffet breakfast was a mixture of western and Japanese dishes and although it felt a bit samey the dishes were well prepared and tasty. There is a convenience shop on the ground floor outside the hotel. Would recommend.

Have stayed here on four separate occasions. This was the first time since the transition to Citadines. Not much seems to have changed (apart from the reception makeover). Still the same great location, and friendly staff.Rooms are typical size for Tokyo. Staff will gladly receive items and forward/receive luggage as requested.

The is small as you would expect, but certainly not the smallest place we stayed. The location is brilliant right in the heart of Shinjuku making it possible to get an I stand feel of Tokyo without going very far.It's located right in the heart of Kabukicho which is the red light district and there are lots of hostess bars around. I always get intrigued with these sort of places and was more than comfortable as people were generally polite. Me and my wife felt safe but you do get a glimpse of this side of Tokyo just from waking to and from the hotel after 10pm.To be honest I would go back.

Place was very clean, of a high standard. All amenities provided and room cleaning service everyday. Central and convenient location. Staff could speak good English and were extremely helpful. This is a pleasant hotel to stay in and is worth the price. A very comfortable stay.

We stayed here for a total of 5 nights, the staff were very polite and warm. The rooms are cleaned beautifully and they provide nice amenities. The only down side to many hotels in the city's of JapanIs you can't open any windows for fresh air and the air con will only go to 20 degrees and the hallways were always very very warm and you de hydrate a lot quicker. The location is great right in the heart of Shinjuku we're all the night life action takes place. We would take a cuppa down with us and just watch the people walk by.. all in all a good reasonable cheap place that's clean to stay in!

I can't say enough good things about this place. Located walking distance from Shinjuku station in Kabukicho (kind of the NSFW area of Tokyo), the hotel is clean and very well appointed. The staff is helpful and the rooms are big by Tokyo standards. I am 6'4" and everything is sized so that I can function (not always the case in Japan). Large bathroom with nice fixtures, large shower, full sized bed and all at a great price.

I stayed in the same type of room in 3 different hotels in Tokyo, and this one was by far the biggest and for the same price as the others. It couldn't be better located, being by both the Shinjuku stations, food options, above a market... really fantastic location. We were there for two morning earthquakes (7+ near Fukushima, so smaller in Tokyo) and I can say that the earthquake system is in great form in the building. We rolled around for over a minute after the initial jolt of each earthquake. Felt like being on a boat. I definitely would recommend this hotel to visitors, and will also plan to stay there myself for future visits.

The thing to remember when selecting this hotel is that it is in the heart of Kabukicho, so be aware that there is significant street noise if your room is on the main strip side, which can still be heard on the higher levels (our room was on the 12th floor), there are many neighboring bars and even though touting is not permitted, it occurs. If you're fine with this, then the hotel has some very good features - reasonably sized rooms and bathrooms, laundry within the hotel for guest use, next door to a Lawsons, 5mins walk to JR Shinjuku station (East exit), approximately 10mins walk to the subway station, and close to Shinjuku shopping, etc. Also being in Kabukicho, it's a close walk back to your room following visiting bars, etc., versus having to catch transportation back. The staff were polite, and there were many amenities.

The hotel is located around 5 mins walk from Shinjuku station and close to Robo dance restaurant for those who are interested. The rooms are very decent better than APA but smaller than Marriott. You have space to keep your luggage a small sofa and sleep. The breakfast is decent. You have lot of people around the area who sell indecent services, be aware during night time. The night life of this area is very happening. you would see crowd even at 2AM in the morning.

I stayed there for 4 nights with my wife.Great location although, a little far from the Subway station but in the heart of Shinjuku area.Room was a little small but very clean and new.Staff were outstanding ( as in most of Japan).Very good value for money.

The hotel is located about 8-10 mins away from Shinjuku train station. We took a cab from Shinjuku station to the hotel after alighting the airport limo bus. If walking underground, try to go towards the direction where Kabukicho/Shinjuku City Office is located (Exit 15B). Keep the Japanese hotel name and address handy in case you need to ask for directions.There are plenty of eateries, shops and malls around the area. A large convenience store, Lawson, is right downstairs as well. We did see some adult entertainment joints in the area but nothing much to be alarmed about as there was no rowdy customers or touting. Basically we just saw some men stationed outside the shops and that's about it. Given a room at level 12 (which requires us to scan our card to access). The room was clean and comfortable though smaller than expected (which is probably normal for hotels in Tokyo). Honestly the room felt like it was more for 1 person instead of 2. There's a sofa which we couldn't use due to the limited space available so we used it to place our luggage instead. The double bed provided is smaller than a standard queen size as well.Hotel staff are polite and are able to speak English so we had no communication issues. In addition to the usual amenities in the room, the hotel also provide toothbrush & paste sets, shower caps and wash towels which you can obtain at the reception desk. There is also a currency exchange machine beside the coffee machine but the rates aren't very good though.

Our recent stay in Citadines Central Shinjuku was okay, and it is quite near the Shinjuku station. The area is good since it is easy access to many shopping malls and restaurants. Nothing exceptional about the room. Staff were accommodating. Would recommend due to proximity of train station, shopping malls and restaurants.

Clean and convenient hotel, close to Shinjuku station and the main attractions of the district. The area is full of great restaurants and cafes. The stuff is very polite and helpful. Good value per price.

Booked this after reading reviews on TripAdvisor.Room very small, breakfast ok, lunch buffet ok, staff helpful, facilities clean.Not for business meetings.If you need a in and out place this is ideal.Central to one of the main train/underground station that will get you everywhere.Good choice for the price/location

The hotel is located in a very central place in Shinjuku area and about 10 minutes walk from Shinjuku station. Rooms are very clean and comfortable, only a little small.Very helpful staff with good English.

We stayed at the Hotel for 5 nights. This hotel have good location, very good and helpful personal behind the front desk, that can help you with many question. They allowed us to check in a few hours earlier than check in time. Room was clean. We will recommend this Hotel to our friends.

Had a fantastic 4 night stay with my husband. The hotel is in an awesome location, so central and everything you need at your door step. No issues at all being in the the 'red light district', felt perfectly safe and happily walked around alone late at night. It was a bonus having the Golden Gai area back on to the hotel and a convenience store downstairs. Breakfast is well worth it, curry, noodles, eggs, bacon, toast...everything you could want. We had an executive suite with plenty of space, worth the upgrade if you're worried about smaller Japanese rooms. Only negative was the unusual pillow, it felt like a large sack of rice. Also the bed was very hard. This may be the same in all Japanese hotels and would certainly not stop me staying here again.

This is my second stay and I can definitively say it's a solid hotel. Clean, efficient and pleasant rooms - but they are small if you are booking the standard room. If you want something roomier book the executive or the suite. Regardless, this is Tokyo and who wants to spend their time in a hotel room? The only con I can think of is that there is no cocktail lounge in the hotel. But Shinjuku is right out the door.The pros are numerous:LocationValueBed ComfortVery quietLocation

This hotel is at least 10-15 minute walk from the station hidden in a side street. Without prior homework and pictures of landmarks enroute it would be harder to find. It does not stand out like the other hotels as the entrance is from a small flight of stairs. However the hotel is fresh and the deluxe apartment was lovely, larger for Japan. The word apartment is perhaps confusing for some visitors, its a room with ensuite. Apartments to me mean kitchen facilities etc. A deluxe room would be more appropriate, but it is a play with words really. Nothing wrong with room has a bath and shower space within the ensuite. Breakfast is rather ordinary so for price I probably would seek alternatives. My recommendation to this hotel was to put art work in the rooms and around the hotel so you cant go too amiss here if thats mostly what I suggested. ps a British Pub few doors away - watch when ordering a guinness as there are 2 types.

We stayed 3 nights at Citadines. It is a nice hotel in a very convenient location... Lots of shops and restaurants around and the Shinjuku station in a short walking distance. The rooms are small as usual in Japan, but they are comfortable and the bathroom is also good and clean.
user_name:
nuria m
Palma de Mallorca, Spain

review_body: My husband and I stayed at the Citadenes from 8/10/2016 - 12/10/2016 .Staff on reception were friendly and tried hard to understand English, sometimes was hard for them.Our room was clean but quite small,we knew this before we arrived so wasn't overly surprised.The location is very good, not far from transport,and shops.

We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights. The hotel is great, perfectly clean and tidy. Very friendly staff, as well.The rooms might be on the small side - when the suitcases are open, there definitely is a lack of room. But that's common in Japan, as I have been told. The bathroom was nice, especially the shower. There are even laundry machines and dryers on one floor.The location is great, especially for night adventures. Very good restaurants around the hotel. It's easy to reach the hotel from Shinjuku Train Station, only like 10 mins walk. The entrance is a bit hidden, since it's not on ground floor. There's an elevator, though, so no problem to access the hotel.From this location, all the amazing districts of central Tokyo are reached within a short time by JR. If you have a JR-Pass, it is extremely easy and convenient to travel by train, even with the Shinkansen.One day, we went on a trip around Kyoto - on which I happened to lose my cellphone. Back at Citadines, the team from the reception did everything to get my cellphone back. They actually had it sent overnight from Kyoto to the hotel and it arrived the next day at 10am. That's a service that is not usual and really amazed me.

kind and helpful although speak English with them is really difficult. the rooms are nice and comfortable, wi fi excellent and very good location.to our first arrival we had warned we were on our honeymoon and we hano riserevato a nice upgrade

Hotel is in a good location for transport but at night seems to be in a very loud and seedy place. Rooms are small but clean. Breakfast is not very good. Eat elsewhere. Overall good for one night but there are better hotels out there

Stayed 5 nights in a double room with free WIFI. The walkway is wide enough to accommodate 2 fully open flat 29" luggages and still space to walk comfortably.Located ~10min from major subway / JR Shinjuku station, one can either walk along the streets or underground shopping to get through. In the vicinity are robot restaurants, don quijote, uniqlo, cinema and lots of cheap eats ~¥250 for a bowl of udon.Recommended hotel for couple / friends.

The Hotel itself was perfect for our stay. The rooms were on the small side however that was to be expected, as most hotel rooms in Tokyo are. We were on the 9th floor, which was just enough to see over the surrounding buildings and see some of Shinjuku's skyline. Rooms on the lower floors may have a less interesting view, as it is quite a dense area. We never had any issues with noise from either inside the hotel or from the street. The hotel itself is easy to locate and is only about a 4-5 minute walk from the Shinjuku Train Station, which is ideal if you are planning on using the trains. There are plenty of restaurants and bars within walking distance, as well as a couple of cinemas, a samurai museum, and a couple of shrines.The hotel reception resides on the 3rd floor of the building, on the second is a nice restaurant, although slightly expensive, and the first has a Lawsons general store, making everything at arms length. There is also a Sake bar on the basement floor that is often busy. Hotel staff speak great English, making any queries you have with anything easy to resolve, and all the members of staff are incredibly friendly and polite. I would certainly recommend the hotel and would stay there again myself.

Good location which I plan to stay in middle of shinjuku and I can walk to shinjuku station easily This trip I plan to use metro subway to connect to many place that I like to see. I had done every per plan

This hotel is centrally located and a short walk from Shinjuku station East exit. Make sure you exit from the East if not you may end up walking one huge round to get to the hotel (and maybe getting lost in the midst).The room itself was standard Tokyo size whereby you will not have much walking room left once you open up 2 luggages. Good thing was that the toilets were spacious with a bath tub in it.Counter staff were friendly, approachable and spoke relatively good English. They allowed us to leave our luggages with them for a couple of days while we toured other parts of Japan. There are washing machines and dryers available for use on the 7th floor. Washing machines are 300 yen per use and dryers 100 yen for 30 minutes. Hotel breakfast was nothing to rave about, acceptable for the 1230 yen paid for walk-in guests.There is a Lawson right beside the hotel on the first floor which was really convenient for us to stock up on necessities and snacks for the night.Overall, was a great stay if you don't mind the small rooms.

This hotel is located an easy 6 or 7 minute walk from Shinjuku station with endless shops, bars, restaurants nearby. It is also a 15 minute walk from Shinjuku Gojen gardens. The rooms are smaller than Australian hotel rooms but are quite adequate. They are modern and well maintained with all the usual facilities such as TV Wi Fi etc. and the beds are full doubles. The staff are very friendly and very helpful. Would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Tokyo.

Down a small street that some buses can,t get to so you may need to walk 50 metres which is no hardship. Despite being right in the heart of Shinjuku and all the noise, lights and restaurants the room we had on the 7th floor was completely silent. As expected in Tokyo small but had everything we needed. Buffet breakfast was good for a quick bite with a good selection for a 3 day visit. Very friendly reception staff who helped out when our transport to airport was a tad late. Well worth a visit.

As expected the room wasn't the biggest which is the same in most hotels here. Could have done with more clothes hanging space but was still manageable. Other than that the hotel has been spot on. Great views from our room on the 12th floor, room was always tidy with fresh bottles of water each day. Breakfast was nice, we didn't book in advance but you still get discount off it by turning up over people who don't stay at the hotel. Good location, plenty around to do. The club touts outside the hotel were annoying at times but easily avoided. Train stations are close as well. Would stay here again

Friendly and helpful front desk staff. Appreciated their restaurant recommendations. Immaculately kept hotel. The room felt new. The housecleaning service was consistent and thorough. The value was excellent.

Nice, clean property. Staff excellent! Staff speaks great English and very helpful. Bathroom had both shower and a tub; however, shower is outside tub. Nice toiletries in the bathroom. Smaller than USA hotels.

Room is a bit on the small side but the location is great. Not far from the station and a easy walk to it. Staff are very friendly and service is outstanding. Would stay here again. Breakfast is not included so be aware of that.

We stayed here for 2 nights and was very pleased with how close this hotel was to everything. It's probably not ideal if you have kids and concerned with being near the Kabukicho area (red light district). Nice clean rooms which are serviced daily and really delicious breakfast buffet. We would definitely stay here again

Anyone who comes to Japan whether on holiday or business should already expect small hotel rooms. This is no exception. However, what makes this hotel so great is the cleanliness of the entire facility, the wonderful customer service and the central location and proximity of the train station. It truly isn't the fanciest hotel in Tokyo but it is a great homebase for all the adventures to be had in Tokyo. The only con about this hotel are the louts that hang around all the host and hostess clubs, golden gai and the general kabukicho area at night. Makes getting to the hotel during the night hours daunting and a little scary on your own. Love this hotel and would definitely recommend!

We joined our friends to travel in Japan which ended in Tokyo. Prior to our stay, I had no idea about this hotel and that it is part of the Ascot Group. Everything in this hotel seemed to run very efficiently. The staff all speak good English and were willing to help which made our stay easier. The breakfast was simple but sufficient for us. The room was a bit small for us which we suppose is the norm in Japan. The area where the hotel is located may be more suitable for young travelers but not for us who travel with a young child. our overall experience was good except at departure when we checked out early in the morning in order to make it to the NRT Bus Terminal, we encountered problem with the taxi which the hotel booked for us. We had to bring all our luggage down to the ground level and there was no staff there to assist us. The taxi driver was unwilling to help either and was even reluctant to fit out trolley into the boot. The driver spoke not a word of English. We finally made it to the bus terminal but not without some tense moment.

Good location without too many commercial interventions and good quality of breakfast. Suitable for personal or team travel. But a bit of noisy on the street side. Very convenient to take subway and JR on Tokyo. Many big department stores located besides this hotel.

Right in the center of Shinjuku, 7-8 mins walk to the train station. Lots of shopping centres nearby. The hotel staffs speak and understand English and are friendly and helpful. Rooms are clean and quite small but still acceptable.

My wife and I stayed in this hotel for three nights. The location is somewhat inconvenient but the services provided were up to my expectations. The room was clean and spacious. The staff were helpful. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who doesn't mind walking a bit in the red light distruct.

This is a great place to stay if you want to be in Shinjuku. It's location is very good and walkable from Shinjuku station. Rooms are nice and clean. The staff are also warm and friendly. I would come back again. Shinjuku station also has convinient airport bus to Haneda or Narita airport.

The location of this hotel is strategic but not really good for kids because its located in redlight distrik area. There are so many 24 hours convienent store around the hotel. Staff were very friendly and helpful. They gave special amenities for kids.
The hotel is located in a terrible area. It appears there is a brothel next door.Rooms very small, breakfast average quality. Close to train station is one positive point. ind something better ,,,,,,

Nice hotel. Good location. Subway stations nearby. lot of activities around on the road. Reception staff are excellent....very helpful. Good breakfast....good house keeping.....what more you want? Book directly from the hotel site if you want good price including breakfast.

Excellent customer service. They accommodate us and have us check in early without charge since we came from a long flight. In fact, we transferred to this hotel as we came from APA hotel who did not give us consideration to check in earlier and would like to charge us for an hour early check in. Giving the fact that I have a small kids who are very exhausted from the flight.

Decided to try the new Citadines in shinjuku and found the rooms about half the size of the older Citadines (just down the street). Check-in was a breeze and finding the hotel was easy, it's about a 5 minute walk from the train station. But they definitely make up for it in by having a large toilet (shower and bathtub). Stayed in a Deluxe Double and the bed size is comfortable enough for 2 adults with a small couch by the size. The location is a little weird as it is sandwiched between great restaurants and the "red light district". Overall, for the price per night, it's a great hotel with a central location.

I found this hotel online and it was perfect. Cleanliness of the room was very good. Staff was friendly.Nice place center of ShinjakuWe recommend this hotel everyone couples etc family.. Just mind Hotel entrance is in the 3rd Floor :)

We stayed two nights in a twin room.big comfortable room and bed.very clean. The location was super. Close to the Jr and lots of good restaurants around. The staff was nice and helpfu and spoke English.We used the laundry service and it was great.I greatly recommend this hotel.

Citadines central was recommended to us by friends. The hotel did not disappoint. Well located, although we initially had some difficulty finding it walking rom subway/train station, once we found itvery easy to get to and from the trains/subway.

We chose this hotel for our short stay in Tokyo because of its proximity to Shinjuku Station. We planned a daytrip to Hakone, accessible via a rail line from Shinjuku, so that worked well. The location was fun with lots of eating options near the station. The hotel was clean, small, but efficiently run. English speaking staff were helpful. Breakfast offered a mix of tasty Japanese and Western options though I recommend a visit to Mr. Donut, a good landmark for finding the hotel!

We guessed the the rooms would be small but didn't realize it would be that small. The bathroom was also tiny and lacked standard amenities. We arrived rather late and were very tired so we thought we would order in but apparently they don't have room service. Fortunately there's an udon place downstairs that open till late, so we're saved. The location is in the middle of the red light district of shinjuku, so lots of gentleman's club around. But from the outside everything seemed decent enough. The positive is that this hotel is very near to shinjuku entertainment district, which gave us lots of options for eating and shopping, and it's not too far from the train station.

We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights at the beginning of our trip in Japan and then another 4 nights by the end. We liked the location. The hotel is situated right in the heart of Shinjuku. Staff are great, very helpful.Rooms aren't that small (we had smaller rooms in other cities), beds are comfy. Breakfast was very good. A decent selection of western and Japanese food.My only negative things are the pillows (too hard for my liking) and for some reason slow internet connection in our room. Some people might not like the fact that there are some hanky-panky bars around this area but it didn't bother us. They are visible but not too much in your face. The whole area is bustling with life at night. We felt perfectly safe.There are plenty of shops and bars around. Right, at the back of the hotel there's this little lane with tiny Japanese bars. You have to pay cover charge to drink in them. We recommend to have a stroll around them even if you don't decide to sit down for a drink. You will find a small brochure about them and the whole area in the lobby of the hotel.

Great location, clean, tidy and helpful service. Booked for two nights and then changed from another hotel for final night in Tokyo due to convenience. Feel very safe even though in middle of red light district.

Checkin to checkout, all staff was helpful and lovely! Not far from the station, and right in the middle of so many things we wanted to do! Will definitely be back! Great value, and actually exceeded my expectations!

Stayed here over an 8 day period. Located within the Kabukicho/Golden Gai district, so an easy walk to heaps of restaurants and bars. Less than 10min walk to Shinjuku Station east gate and department stores.Rooms are small but standard for Japanese hotel rooms in this price range. Good for one person but would be cramped for two people with luggage. Larger rooms are available.Friendly, English-speaking staff on front desk, laundromat on 7th floor is very handy, as is the Lawson convenience store located right next to the hotel.A great place to stay in a very popular part of Tokyo. 4/5 given due to size of rooms.

Our group stayed here for 3 days to explore Tokyo and do excursion to Mt Fuji area prior to a cruise departure from Yokohama. We asked Reception to find and book us a transfer vehicle) for our group with 12 suitcases. The desk attendant was quick to act even though we had a language barrier and our request came early on morning of our excursion. Breakfast was consistently excellent . All staff were well presented, helpful and polite. Most enjoyable stay. Highly recommended for shopping, walking to nearby Metro government buildings for high observatory and to parklands fpr relaxation. Lots of dining choices in this district together with bright lights and variety of entertainment for the young at heart. Close to underground for extensive rail network and yet more retail.

Great location relative to all public transport and all kinds of food in the area. subway station and train just up the street (10mn walking). Shopping center nearby. It is a neighborhood full of life. The staff is really helpful, the rooms are a bit small but adequate, and it is very clean, including the room. Breakfast is good and continental.Great place if you want to visit Tokyo with 2 teenagers, even if you are near the red district but very safe.

A very clean, and professional hotel. The room was well laid out and the staff very professional. Located an easy walk from Shinjuku Station and close to parks and hundreds of incredible restaurants. The neighbourhood gets busy in the evenings but it was always quiet in our room. Easy to enjoy all Tokyo has to offer from here...

if you want to stay clean room you should choose citadines hoteland i am not good at english. so I hope you just follow my advise.thanks to citadines apart hotel staff, I felt treasure and relax. and i hope to your nice trip

checked in late, staff were helpful.rooms quite ordinary and bare.bed is ok, room a bit musky smell. internet is good. location is very central. a lot of bars and restaurants outside the hotel. a lot of touts outside the hotel, was a bit intimidating, but otherwise its a good location for tokyo.

Went to this hotel as we couldn't get other hotels due to last minute booking for a large group of people. Hotel is generally clean but very small for a Deluxe double. Location is near the main shopping area but it is actually within the red light district which is not very safe for singles.

Its name says it all, Citadines Central Shinjuku! You can't be better situated than this well appointed 3-star, if your budget is within $170/night for a double with complimentary breakfast. The room size is ample enough by Tokyo standards. What I liked most about the room is that it was indeed, non smoking, as I requested. I have had experiences, in Yokohama and Singapore, where the designated non-smoking room still smelled of cigarette smoke which I am extremely allergic to. The room has everything you would ever need but the cleanliness was quite observable and the efficient design of the room and bath made it seem bigger than it really is. The breakfast spread was more than sufficient for our 2-day stay that's why I wouldn't fault it in any way as others have commented here. Over-all, a very good stay and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to anyone who wants to be in a spot on location within walking distance to all restaurants, shops and transportation.

A modern, well equipped and reasonably priced hotel in what is probably the liveliest part of Tokyo.Lots of restaurants and nightlife, not too many cars (streets appear to be closed off in the evening). The staff at the hotel were very helpful and had sufficient knowledge of English.Just in case you are affected by noise try asking for a room that doesn't overlook the main street.The only downside was the western style breakfast. The fried egg looked and tasted like one of those plastic replicas that Japanese restaurants love to have in their front windows.

Great location to transport and all kinds of food in vicinity. Subway/train station just up the str(exit door 15 east). Shopping close by. This district is full of life, non stop, people everywhere. Staff are very very helpful, rooms a bit small but sufficient, and very clean including bathroom. Breakfast is ok, fried eggs a bit overcooked every morning, edible if u dont mind it hard.

In the heart of Shinjuku district of Tokyo. Absolutely endless food, bars , micro pubs within walking distance.. The vision of Tokyo you get in films...is from this district. Always a step ahead, Shinjuku is like the near future now. And citadines central is a great base camp from which to explore

The hotel is just in the middle of Shinjuku district and close to the Metro station. Good room but the pillows are terrible. Good quality of food for breakfast. Good cleanliness. The service is ok, the front staff are useful and nice.

I was there with 2 family in a triple in August 16. I booked with them because good balance square mt and price close to a central JR station for the airport.Room and bath are clean and well equipped with water free and wi-fi. Be sure the room and linen/pillow are clean and not smelly of smoke (if you do not like) . They use to smoke inside and not on the road ..funny country.. Must to ask above 5th floor because is located in the red district zone (but no issues compared to other part of the world) and in the nigth sometime can be noisy. Better Street view than rear where there is Gai Alley also very crowded. Breakfast is essential but good value for money. Not all the receptionist are english fluent...Very well located for the shopping zone .

This was our third accommodation during a two week visit to Japan. We had Airbnb apartment in Kyoto and a not more traditional Mushuku inn on Takayama. Overall this was the las least comfortable of all our accommodation as it was quite small room but I'm guessing standard fare by Tokyo standards; room is definitely pokey if you have two pieces of luggage and want to use the table. Staff are efficient and it is centrally located to restaurant and bar options as well as some high end departmental stores. It is very easy walk to Shinjuku station and is an excellent base for access to tokyo and surrounds.Good option and value for money when compared to other comparable options.Would recommend.

Very small room. The "double bed" was comfortable, but very small, seemed to be a one-and-half-bed and no double bed. The breakfast was good, but could offer more variety. But the staff was so amazing!

The room was like a big room condensed into a smaller room. It worked reall good how it was layer out. The bath is shorter than a uk bath but twice as deep. the breakfast was extra and very simple .its quite easy to find and in just the right place

Around the hotel are restuarant and pub which is Shinjuku popular. However I did not hear any noisy at night. Room is of course small and clean. Wifi is easy access. Bed and pillow are ok. Front desk staff are professional. On basement you can find Lawson, convenient store. It is five minute walk to JR.

We stayed at Citadines for 6 nights during our recent trip to Japan. The hotel was very well located in easy walking distance to Shinjuku stations (metro and JR). It is close to several amazing restaurants, shopping and sightseeing areas. The rooms were clean and well appointed and wanted for nothing. Housekeeping was good however had a tendency to throw items left on the bed anywhere in the room meaning some nights there was a bit of a hunt for PJs! Pillows were also a little solid and uncomfortable.There is a self-service laundry (coin operated, only accepts 100Y coins) which was very helpful. Otherwise a good stay and would consider staying here again.

We stayed 2 nights in July. I got a good deal by going to the Citadines website, registering to be an Ascott member, then taking advantage of a line-wide discount promotion. The location was an easy walk from Shinjuku station (though if you are trying that walk, make sure you have a great detailed map or Google Maps turned on on your phone - if you're new to Tokyo you will struggle greatly to find your way there on foot without that support.) For Tokyo, the rooms were sizable and well-organized. Staff were uniformly courteous and helpful. Finally, the breakfast buffet was excellent - and the staff even agreed to open 15 minutes early for us, when we had a 7:30 am train to catch. All in all, a great stay.

Stayed for 10 nights from 28 July with my 15 year old daughter. We both loved the hotel abs the staff were extremely professional and helpful.The room (twin) was spotless. A bit small but liveable. Bedding and towels changed daily. Fresh bottles of wster every day. Bathroom was fab.Location was great too. Yes, it's near to the red light district but we never once felt hassled or uncomfortable. We were out and about every night and the choices for places to eat us massive.Walking distance to metro stations and shinjuku station.The only let down was the breakfast. I suppose if you're only there for a couple of nights is ok but the lack of choices made it difficult to enjoy every day. We skipped probably 5 mornings and ate out.Overall though a very pleasant stay in a very nice hotel.If I'm ever back in Tokyo this is where I'll be staying, without hesitation.

We stayed at Citadines Central for one night when we arrived in Tokyo. It is in a fabulous location in Shinjuku, very close to Golden Gai and a shrine that features a small local market. Please be aware that this hotel is in the red light district, which is not at all dangerous, but may not be suitable for families with young children. The staff were very pleasant and helpful and the buffet breakfast was great! Definitely try the breakfast Udon!! :)

Very pleasant stay. The room size was fairly good and beds were comfortable. Very big plus as has laundry machine & drier. Very convenient location with plenty of food nearby. There is Lawson on 1st floor and 7 Eleven few doors away. About 850 meters walk to Shinjuku train station; can be a challenge carrying large suitcases. Very busy night life around the hotel on weekdays, area may not be appropriate for little children. Staff spoke good English and very helpful. We sent our luggage from hotel (with Staff's help) to another hotel in Osaka as we were taking Shinkasen; lugage arrived safely and in good condition.

For Tokyo standards the size of the rooms was good. The rooms were quite new and comfortable. Staff was friendly and spoke English well. The location was great, on walking distance from the Shinjuku station. Plenty of restaurants in the area.

The area is good but a bit restricted for a lonely woman at late nite..as many cafes , bar and foreign people came out and in and talked in entrance. Drunk Couple wandered around. Not recommend for family with young children

Very pleasant hotel, well situated and calm (no noises from the vibrant streets below).The room are very confortable, the breakfast is great and offers various fresh products.The staff is willing to help you so that you can enjoy your stay.I highly recommend this hotel

My wife and I were in this hotel for honeymoon in the mid of July. The hotel is beautiful and our period there was perfect. The position of the hotel is close to the metro and train station, and it is in the centre of Shinjuku, so it is perfect.

Stayed for three nights.If you are using the Airport Limousine Bus, it will drop you at Shinjuku Train Station. You can walk to the hotel from the bus drop off if you are a good navigator. It is not far but it can be confusing. You can catch a cab to make things easier. It should cost no more than 1000yen.The hotel lobby is on the third floor of the bulidng. There is a sign outside directing you to a lift. The hotel is signed on the outside wall, look up!Do not get your Citadine Hotels confused when in Shinjuku. There are two! Citadines and Citadines Central. I am writing about Citadines Central.The front desk staff are very polite and helpful. They will store your luggage if you need to. Front desk staff speak English.Breakfast is buffet style and has enough choice.Housekeeping is excellent. Your room is thoroughly cleaned each day.Bathrooms are modern with a small tub and the famous Japanese toilet.For long term travellers it is good to know there is a self service laundry on floor 7. A load of washing costs 300 yen. A dryer costs 100 yen for 30 minutes.Don't worry about red light district talk. The local area is safe, clean and free from trouble.You can walk to several department stores from this location and the Shinjuku Gardens are a short walk as well. The gardens will cost 200 yen. You can use a machine or buy an entry ticket from a person at the gate. I would stay at this hotel again.Certainly recommended.

I chose this place following the suggestion of a friend. For Tokyo this is a great location. Staff is excellent, hotel is clean, modern nothing luxurious but of great style. Right next to the hotel there is a nice "old Tokyo" neighborhood with amazing Ramen noodles and bars.

We stayed here for 5 nights in a deluxe room in July. The room was small, as expected, but functional, well-decorated and comfortable. Extras like an iron or humidifier can be brought to your room in less than 5 minutes (we were on 12th floor).A laundry room was available too for 300Y. The location, so long as you understand and appreciate it is near a red-light district and all that entails) was excellent. 5-10 minute walk from Shinjuku stations and next to Golden Gai (though for bars you're better off going to Shibuya's yokocho).The only downsides the cold eggs and sausages at breakfast and the air conditioning which was very drying, but as already stated, you can request an air humidifier. I would stay here again.

Efficient, pleasant staff, who handled our check in and check out very competently. The room and bathroom were very clean and well equipped. The breakfast selections were very good. The location of the hotel is excellent. Our experience exceeded our expectations. We would stay there again and recommend it to others.

The location is very convenient. It's a five-minute walk to Shinjuku station and there are lots of good restaurants just outside the front door. The staff at the front desk were helpful and English was not a problem. Also, the breakfasts were convenient and good. I used the laundry facilities which was very helpful as I was on a work trip. It isn't fancy or luxerious and the rooms are small like many Tokyo hotels and would be crowded for more than one person. Overall I recommend Citadines Centeral Shinjuku because it's central location and helpful staff.

This is a very nice hotel. Me and my 2 friends stayed here and although I had to share a bed with my 1 friend and my other friend stayed on the pullout couch, the room was still enjoyable. It comes with a kitchen which is very useful. It is also about a 5-10 minute walk to all the action in Shinjuku. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

We caught an airport bus to Shinjuku Train station from which we walked from wheeling 5 luggages at 6am. It took about 20 minutes to get to the hotel. We were greeted and checked in but couldn't access the rooms until 2pm. The lobby is quite nice with relics about Japanese culture. The rooms were nicely kept but for the price we paid, it was unreasonable. They were very small and the bathrooms didn't have locks on them. The location of the hotel is right in the heart of Shinjuku, allowing for good shopping and a good night life literally 15 steps outside. However, it is at least a 10 minute walk from the nearest 2 train stations. For families, it is not an ideal place as at night there is a street of bars on one side of the hotel and clubs on the other. However, there are many shops outside for convenience. We stayed for a total of 4 nights (2x 2 nights). The second check in took 2 hours because as a family, they gave us 2 rooms in 2 different floors. Be aware that since it is in the heart of the city, there are constant noises from outside such as sirens and nightlife from many many floors down.

Most impressive was the room design - a very good example of quality industrial design which many more reputable and expensive hotels could learn from. We all have had frustrating experiences with hotel rooms with no space to store and open suit cases, and you are continually tripping over them or squeezing past!!We have an excessive amount of luggage - 2 cases, and 3 large backpacks, plus some groceries. But there was plenty of space to store the contents and the containers, the mini couch was good for watching TV, the small cooking area was quite sufficient and the total space was very comfortable.We did feel its location lead to 2 nights or longer stays because we found it took a little while to work out the train and bus systems - but once this was done it was a great place to stay, particularly with the surrounding super markets and eateries. No hestitation in recommending to others!!

We arrived early but the room was ready, it was small but clean and had everything you needed (2 night stay). The location is great, not far from the station and stuff to see all around. Breakfast buffet is adequate and if you are still hungry there is a Family amart downstairs. I would book here again

Citadines Central is an excellent hotel, the rooms are generous in size for Japan which generally is space limited. The only downside is be aware when travelling with families and in particular this is effectively the red light district. It is not dangerous or threatening in anyway but you're in close proximity to brothels and strip clubs. During the day is fine and it's a very short walk before the area changes but it is something to be aware of, Shinjuku covers a huge area and there are some much nicer overall parts. The hotel staff were helpful, friendly and very efficient. The hotel was clean and the breakfast was very well priced and plentiful.

Good location but not in the night - surrounded with lots ot bars, massages and gambles. Hotel lobby is on 3rd floor, need to take another lift to access the room - not convenient at all. The room was quite small but acceptable in Japan - could be recommendable for short term stay.
